title: It's in the details
message: After hearing a lot of real-time reactions and feedback at Unleash I wanted to give this team a shout out for the thoughtfulness that went into the conceptual ideation behind the booth theme and the ties made to Forum. Every detail was intentional, and I heard from multiple attendees that they really resonated with our Elevate theme and messaging, loved the booth's connection to France, and wanted to learn more about Workhuman. I know there was a lot of research, brainstorming, and coordination that went into bringing the theme to life, it was noticed by many and so appreciated!

title: The Briefing Book Braintrust
message: Thank you all for the incredible teamwork that went into developing Eric, Tom, and KeyAnna‚Äôs briefing books for Paris. The level of precision, care, and expertise you each brought‚Äîfrom messaging and talking points to customer and prospect intel to logistics and scheduling‚Äîwas next-level. I also really appreciated your support on the briefing calls, ensuring each leader was prepared and confident heading into a jam-packed week of engagements. The partnership, collaboration, and strategic thinking from this team made this new process both effective and efficient. Thank you!

title: Soaring high in Paris!
message: I'm getting a bit tired of congratulating you all for (yet again) setting a new bar, but when you all helped pull off what was our largest and most impactful 3rd party event activation EVER, it has to be done!  This team absolutely crushed it last week, delivering two amazing back-to-back events with our first ever Workhuman Forum in Paris and then straight into UnleashWorld, where we dominated attendee mindshare. From the months of planning and design, to pre-event registration drives, meeting scheduling, and hospitality planning, to the flawless on-the-ground execution, it was an extraordinary end result.  The quality of engagement you all drove across an action-packed 3 days and nights doesn't just happen by chance. Every detail was sweated over. Every activity was well prepped and rehearsed. And the plan was orchestrated and delivered to perfection.  I couldn't be more proud of the effort put forth by you all and seeing the results of that effort take form. A sincere THANKS to all who contributed, with special thanks to our extraordinary Events team, who just set that new bar in how to show up big and deliver an extraordinary experience.

title: Sharepoint storage collaboration
message: Conor, A few months ago, we began discussing SharePoint storage usage across the Finance team sites. You took the initiative to analyze the situation and consult with your teams, and about four weeks ago, you returned with a set of rigorous retention requirements and strict storage limits. Based on your recommendations, I implemented the following policies: Reduced version history from the default 50 versions to 10. Configured retention to keep only items from the past 90 days. Once these policies were in place, it took some time for older versions to age out. Now that the aging process has completed, the results have been remarkable: Storage usage dropped from over 7 TB to just over 1 TB. The previously largest site is now the 6th largest. These outcomes far exceeded my expectations. Thank you for your diligence and collaboration throughout this process. Your clear and decisive requirements made a significant impact.

title: An Extraordinary WHL
message: What you pulled off at Workhuman Live was nothing short of extraordinary. Every single detail‚Äîfrom the technology that powered the experience, to the stunning creative that framed our brand and our executives‚Äîwas executed with precision, care, and excellence.  You created an environment that didn‚Äôt just look exceptional, but felt like Workhuman. And you did it while managing thousands of humans moving through a complex environment, aligning every detail to our theme, our purpose, and our mission.  You brought Eric‚Äôs keynote to life with vision and thoughtfulness. You made sure our content tracks were cohesive, our speakers prepared and impactful, and our message loud and clear across every stage, room, and moment.  This was more than a flawless event. This was a defining moment of brand leadership‚Äîsomething only Workhuman could do, because of you.  I‚Äôm phenomenally proud of this team. Let‚Äôs carry this momentum into Orlando 2026. I already can‚Äôt wait.  ‚ÄîRichardtemp

title: Op Excellence, AI mustaches and twins for the win
message: Team! It was so great to spend some with all of you over the past week to start ironing out some parameters around what it means to be "most excellent" operationally across a handful of lanes. I thought our discussions were productive, action oriented, honest, and thought provoking. I enjoyed talking about short term, low cost options we could charge against, while balancing a longer term view of what excellent can look like, and what would need to happen to get there. It was also a treat to meet Mark's less Irish sounding twin... he seems cool, but I still think I like the real Mark better. Lastly, a special shout out for Hillary for raising her hand as captain and harnessing her ppt skills ;-)

title: Master Data Aligned!
message: Dear Team, I wanted to take a moment to express my sincere gratitude to all the stakeholders involved in the Master Data project, particularly in aligning cost centers, departments, functions, and supervisory organizations. It‚Äôs hard to believe that for so many years, the business struggled to align these critical components across Workday, Epicor, Concur, and Spark.  Your hard work, collaboration, and unwavering dedication have been instrumental in achieving this significant milestone. Each of you has played a vital role in aligning our systems, and this foundational piece stands as a testament to your collective efforts.  Today, we have successfully aligned all systems‚ÄîWorkday, Epicor, Concur, and Spark‚Äîalong with measures built within Workday to maintain the integrity of the structure. Additionally, a RACI is now in place, ensuring clear roles and responsibilities across the board.  This is a crucial foundation that will pave the way for future projects, such as the Workday-Payroll integration and security restructuring. None of this would have been possible without your leadership, commitment, and collaborative spirit. Thank you!

title: Expert Interviews - Everest Group Research
message: Thank you so much to this group for your time, preparation, and insight offering during the SME interviews for our research partnership with Everest Group! The Everest Group analysts asked questions that interrogated why our approach to strategic recognition is the best: how we support customers in their success, how recognition is done right (and wrong), and how we teach the market to expect more from their recognition programs.  Your responses reflected the years of dedicated work you have all put into making work more human-- the contributions you made in these interviews will help the Everest Group create a research paper that details why recognition is a strategic imperative-- and specifically, why Workhuman's approach reflects recognition done right.  I'm so appreciative of your support for this Analyst Relations project! I'm looking forward to keeping this group updated on progress and sharing the final paper later this Spring. Thank you!

It was so impactful to see the space and to hear the strategic ideas and questions that will no doubt make for another thoughtful and memorable event! Thank you for a great week and lots of laughs along the way!

title: Events Leadership
message: Before I submitted this award i googled (for fun) "what is a good manager". I found an article that said "Great leaders tap into the needs and fears we all share. Great managers, by contrast, perform their magic by discovering, developing, and celebrating what‚Äôs different about each person who works for them"  As i was reflecting on my quickly-approaching maternity leave I realized a lot of those typical insecurities women tend to face as they approach big life changes, are not things I have to worry about because I have a supportive boss.  As a team we often talk about how you are the best, but today I was reminded that I should also be telling you.   I appreciate having a female leader that not only understands life changes, but supports them. That not only understands our work and what we put into it, but also supports the development and decisions behind them. I most of all appreciate the trust,  transparency, and many laughs. The events team is lucky to have you!

title: "Let me help you with that stick..."
message: Cam, It was great seeing and meeting with you in person this week. You are always ready to jump in and support me. This quality you have is immensely appreciated. I know that I can darn near bring anything to you - in or out of your realm - and you will lend a hand. The advocacy you provide to CI is invaluable. Thank you. Sam

title: Tireless leadership
message: OK, maybe that title is a lie, it'd be totally ok if you were actually tired ‚Äì and maybe even tired of leadership ‚Äì¬†but you make it LOOK tireless. There have been so many moving parts happening since the start of the year from adopting a new function to the endless stream of Q1 events and launches and I just wanted to call out how much I appreciate you and your mentorship. You look out for the team and each person's individual goals, you're trying to balance the budget and planning for team growth and our always top-notch production events, and yet you're still taking on new things like championing Asana and making sure to spend quality time on all our Reflections. It doesn't go unnoticed or unappreciated ‚Äì¬†it is a lot of work. This week is the last deep breath before Forum and the landslide toward Live in Denver ‚Äì¬†I hope you go into it all feeling as great as we all think you are!!

title: Just a moment

title: Human Intelligence Core Collaborators
message: As we make the final approach to the Human Intelligence 2025 Release digital event, I want to send a massive THANK YOU to this core group of collaborators that I've had the pleasure of working closely with over the last 4 months.  It's fitting that the animation above says "Good things come to those who don't wait," because when we were tasked with organizing this campaign and event back in late October, this group wasted little time in strategizing how to deliver Workhuman's most impactful innovation release against some serious time constraints.  The results speak for themselves. We've already reached over 8,000 registrations that include almost 100% customer coverage, and we can all agree that the messaging, copy, and creative that has been delivered through this project has been next-level.  Personally and professionally, I can't thank you all enough for this experience. I've learned so much from each of your different expertise and through how you each approach cross-functional collaboration on this scale. What I'm most impressed by is the consistent positive attitude and collaborative mindset. This was a big undertaking that required a lot of strategic and execution-focused work, but we were so productive because we kept the focus on progress.  Can't wait for the next one...lol

title: Risk control on the up, thanks to you!

In particular, I would like to extend a special thank you to our Control Owners for taking ownership of their controls and providing invaluable input into improving our business internal controls. Your insights and contributions have significantly enhanced our processes and helped mitigate risks effectively.  We have come a long way, but there is still some work to be done. I am confident that with your continued dedication and support, we will get there together.  I also want to acknowledge the vital part our Control Preparers play in this process. Your diligence and hard work in ensuring the smooth implementation and ongoing success of our controls are truly appreciated.  Once again, thank you for going above and beyond in 2024. I look forward to continuing to work alongside you in 2025 and achieving even greater success together. Our risk control efforts are stronger than ever, thanks to you!

title: CCMA Awards...It certainly took a village :)
message: In Q4 2022, we embarked on a journey to transform our Quality Program though procuring and implementing CallMiner's conversation analytics tool within CS.   This took an enormous amount of effort from a dedicated bunch of humans who not only accepted the challenge but stepped up to learn new coding skills, beta tested with super users, changed how they did their day job, gave up their time to learn how to perform Quality Audits, automated Quality Audits, organized a successful on-site event, hours of copy writing and most importantly resulted in a phenomenal improvement to CS Quality that cements our premium service offering for our customers.  To me, it is no surprise to me that CCMA commended Workhuman for ‚ÄúThe Best Use of Technology ‚Äì Tactical Project‚Äù at the 2024 CCMA Awards and I can‚Äôt thank this group enough for all the great work you did to make this happen. You should be extremely proud of your contribution, and I am grateful to work with such dedicated professionals. Thank you!

message: Cam, on this auspicious day/week I wanted to take a minute to express my gratitude for the last 2 years.  I appreciate the curiousity with which you operate and how you consistently look for ways to apply new practices and thought leadership to our daily work.  You inspire our team to do things differently.  You are an igniter of ideas.  I appreciate that you take time out of your busy day to research, to learn and to commit yourself to thinking bigger, taking on new ideas, and then taking the time to discuss and shape the future of Workhuman.   There are so many areas of the business that have benefited from your involvement - CE Growth, TS operational efficiencies, operational reporting, customer profitability analysis, operationalizing the Deals Desk, and every other strategic initiative you have your fingers on.  Stay curious, Cam, and keep investing in your growth -  you are a multiplier and we are better because of you.

title: Grateful for your partnership
message: Cam - what can I say other than I would be lost at WH without you. I can‚Äôt thank you enough for all you‚Äôve done to help me onboard, make sense of how things work, tackle projects and always being an audience to bounce things off of. You are an invaluable partner, and I‚Äôm excited to continue to partner together!

title: Grateful for our team

I also appreciate your warm welcome as I get up to speed here at WorkHuman. You‚Äôve answered countless questions for me, and even when I asked the same question more than once, you patiently give me a recap or appointment to where I need to go. I‚Äôm excited to be on this journey with you as we continue to evolve the team and the work we do for our clients. Dave, I appreciate that you will always give it to me straight, Sheri, I admire your hard work and grit, and Michelle, your can do attitude and humor always leave me feeling positive. Thanks for all you do and for being wonderful teammates.

title: Organizing access
message: Many thanks Conor for helping with my access this week!

title: It takes a village to raise a child!
message: Three months has gone by, quite literally in the blink of an eye. Thanks to all of you I feel like i'm much better informed and instructed in how the good ship, The SS Workhuman moves forward. I've had the privileged opportunity of moving roles quite a few times in the past, and whilst you always hear 'Put some time in with me', 'anything I can do to help', the people in this organization, do not just say, but they live by that value.  I'm incredibly grateful for all of your support, input, time & guidance, and I look forward to the time when I can return the favor, and begin to be the source of answers for some of your own questions as we turbocharge this freighter together!

title: Deals Desk for Dropbox
message: Team - Chris W. and I wanted to thank you for your ongoing partnership, flexibility, and creativity when it comes to doing what is right by our customers. Most recently, this group proposed a solution to help Dropbox navigate missing their minimum commitment by seeing if we can amend their TFC. Dropbox's executive sponsor was impressed by the offer. While we don't have an answer yet, the proposal itself showed her Workhuman's willingness to partner with them and that we want to keep Dropbox as a long term customer. This customer is learning the ropes of so many things in the first year of their Spotlight program, and this is just another way we were able to show up collaboratively to support them. Thank you!

title: What do you want this thing to do?
message: I'm so appreciative of the energy that everyone always pours into the creation of the event. I worry that you'll be come exhausted by us asking "what do you want it to do?" every year ‚Äì but you always meet it with it's intended evolution. It IS a different question every year because we evolve as a business, the business world evolves on the daily, the industry and the people in it are different this year than they were last year. I love the saying "you can never step in the same river twice" because it's so true ‚Äì¬†and both the event and our company are a river! I'm grateful for the nuance and curiosity from those who have been to alllll the events and those who have only been part of the team for a short time. I'm super excited about where we're going to take it this year. I'm confident that this year's event innovations will be less about headshot activations and more about showing the world who we are. Thank you all for a great kickoff and in advance for what I'm sure is going to be quite the ride!

title: Appreciate your session on Pricing and Billing
message: Dear Conor,  Thank you for the excellent session on Pricing and Billing at Workhuman. Your patience, clear explanations, and practical insights were very helpful. I also appreciate your insight on the gaps in end-to-end implementation for billing/pricing data. Looking forward to collaborate more in the future!  Best regards, Yariv

It was truly magical to discuss AI ideas with you, especially on how to increase recognition on the platform. It was amazing to see different areas coming together to work towards improving recognition.  Thanks again for all your effort‚Äîyou made my week so much fun!

title: This A Team come to the Podium, please!!
message: Please stand and join me in welcoming this A Team to the Podium!! I couldn't resist! Janet, you have built tremendous relationships with Manulife's executives, program owner and team. Securing a 4-hour session with busy executives speaks volumes to how much they value the relationships, the strategic alignment and customized content tied directly back to their program, Podium. Their faces light up when they see you, they hang on your words and take your recommendations turning them into actions. Your preparation, sharing insights on what is most important to Manulife, helped the supporting WH cast members be successful, too! Sheri, your strategic vision, mapping content to Manulife's initiatives and support is so valuable. Byrant, it's obvious the Manulife team sees you as customer success partner, trusts you, and knows you deliver. Barbara, the customer satisfaction experience content was spot on, aligned with their CEO's message of easier, better, and faster and demonstrated the value of turning these on. Susan, equally, the human engagement communications are essential and even though Manulife sends out onboarding information about Podium, it isn't directly linked. Engagement comms will directly link users to Podium, getting to a Yes! Audrey, they are ready for Experiences! The content was compelling, the fact experiences is available for 90%+ of the workforce, and in the requested languages was a huge win! Nuvs, having a view into the product and roadmap is always met with great joy by our customers. Alan, the analytics showcasing how the nominator caps continue to influence behavior, and what's possible with some adjustments to the program design helps us continue to crack open the door for changes. Amanda, the communications strategy and plan covering the 5-year celebration, summer of gratitude and then full calendar year prompt Manulife to say we need a 2025 Planning Workshop to integrate Manulife's plans with ours. Let's keep the momentum going!!! YOU ROCK!!

title: Elevating E-STAR & Strategic Account Reviews
message: Eaton Rocks! E-STAR Rocks! This Workhuman team Rocks!! I‚Äôd like to express my sincere gratitude and bestow all of you the honor of Customer Excellence Hall of Famers!   Mike, this is long overdue recognition for your thorough research on Eaton, Eaton‚Äôs executives, what they‚Äôre talking about externally and connecting it all into how E-STAR supports their vision, mission and business strategy! Your meticulous preparation for the Eaton Strategic Account Review meeting today has not only impressed us all but significantly contributed to our success. The ability to anticipate customer needs, synthesize what‚Äôs most important, and help the WH subject matter experts prepare accordingly is a rare skill, and it's clear that your efforts have made a substantial impact. Today you were the ultimate master of ceremony, setting context, weaving in your knowledge and expertise, and connecting all the dots for the audience! Thank you for setting such a high standard of excellence and for your unwavering commitment to our team's success! Tony, you‚Äôre right back delivering key program metrics, using your incredible excel and chart skills to make the data impactful, and reinforcing the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù these metrics matters right after paternity leave. Greg, the data nerd (your words) genius! Bernardo and Julie (executives) captivated by the way you structured your section, tying what matters most to the analytics shown from let‚Äôs demonstrate impact, capture performance & potential and enhance equity. Julie reiterated technology, reporting and marrying key talent data together is a huge focus for Eaton. You nailed it! Jessica, your prep prior to leaving on holidays was valuable and you received shoutouts in the meeting for your incredible ongoing comms work. Sheri, your leadership and reinforcement of key messages, the power of recognition and how it supports talent and business outcomes prompts others to sit up and listen! You all ROCK!!

title: Gratitude for Renewals Overview
message: Thank you Cam for providing a thorough and detailed overview of our renewals process. Your explanations were very helpful to my understanding. Keep up the fantastic work!

title: Qualcomm - Welcome to the WH family!!
message: Huge congratulations to Sameer and the team who were actively involved in the successful sales process with Qualcomm.  After a 29-month cycle, I am extremely excited to share that they are the newest member of the WH customer family adding 50,000 more users to our platform!  It was a win that required significant effort and strategy led by Sameer with support from so many WH team members along the way to ensure we had a positive outcome.  During the course of the process we had more than 70 documented meetings and every engagement and deposit made was very intentional. This included having several key Qualcomm executives at WHLive, many ‚Äúmoments that mattered‚Äù (YOS videos, Birthday videos, delivering WH golf balls/shirts, even a video from Snapdragon stadium which is sponsored by Qualcomm), a strong ABM campaign (Custom demo, microsite, mood video), and lots of customer storytelling to create unparalleled levels of credibility.  This sales process was a rollercoaster ride with lots of twists and turns resulting in a head-to-head competition with Augeo who promised the world at highly aggressive prices. But at the end of the day Qualcomm realized that our level of experience, product capabilities, and strategic value we provide are hands down the best in the industry and we became the obvious choice.  This would not have happened without the tireless work of all involved including Hari Date, Nuvs, Erin Avery, Cam Torre, Martina Campbell, Jason Gori, Meisha-Ann Martin, Larry Dennison, Alessandra Fagone, Brian Moore, Brian Kennedy, Owen Cooney, Christopher Claude, Julia Towle, Emily Smith, Hillary Mahoney, Chuck Labovitz, Rich Sorrentino, Rahul Srinivasan, Nick Eng, Ekaterina Kim, and Nina Reichert.  Thank you for going above and beyond to support this important sale!

title: Customers being acquired project team
message: Team, well done! Together, we officially launched a critical new process driving awareness, action and accountability with respect to existing clients being acquired by new business opportunities. Born out of a forecast call, and each of you raising your hand, we spun up this collective cross-functional effort with our first meeting mid-July, and now early Sept, we've trialed two scenarios and built a repeatable process. Sales, CE, Legal & Finance came together to build strategies & process in an effort to protect our base while optimizing new business, exploring ways to leverage clients to open new doors, gain insight, and hopefully land and expand. At one point, we identified 8 clients with ~$20M billings and approx $72M in new biz to mine through. While the true hard work has only just begun, it HAS begun, and we have a process in place that can now repeat. Thank you for your imagination & determination to drive this innovation!

title: Amazing colleagues
message: Jose, Daniele, Dave, and Cam, I want to acknowledge the tremendous effort you've put into supporting our customers. I'm truly blown away  The hours you‚Äôve dedicated are incredible, and it‚Äôs a pleasure working with you. The recent workshop we had speaks volumes about your commitment to enhancing our support. I‚Äôm excited to continue working with you and joining calls with customers. The sense of camaraderie you‚Äôve built with our customers is impressive, and the relationships you've fostered are remarkable. I can clearly see the amazing work you've done and the relentless hours you‚Äôve invested. Your dedication to our customers is truly phenomenal‚Äîjust wow!

title: DXC Sensational!
message: TEAM!!! Amazing work and even more amazing initial outcomes from the DXC executive meeting. Adrian, your daily care and concern for this client set us up so well for PROOF that we care about the partnership and our long-term relationship with them. Isha, your initial analysis gave them the taste they needed of what we could do in terms of telling the ROI story they need for the executive team. Susan, you delivered the ROI/Outcomes story so well, helping them catch that vision and realize we are very interested in their bigger success. Sheri, you positioned the really difficult parts of the conversation so masterfully. We still have a journey ahead, but we're starting from a point FAR FARTHER down the road now than last week. Well done,  all!

title: Community Milestone: Gainsight Selection/Contract

Your diligence, thoughtfulness, and dedication helped us get this across the finish line. I appreciate the open dialogue, time, urgency and collaboration from each of you. Looking forward to kicking off the next phase with many of you!

title: Plan the Work and Work the Plan
message: Team, thank you all for a highly collaborative, productive, and engaging workshop this week. We took two full days as a team to review program, cultural, and MELT performance. We were vulnerable and transparent, we questioned everything, we debated critical growth areas and areas of improvement. Tyler provided a HX strategy update on how we plan the org and foster unity in the marketing organization. We walked away with critical next steps that will inform the unified GTM strategy in 2025 while setting the stage for a great H2 and 2025. Thank you all for the participation, the preparation, and for driving the business forward.

title: Spark Leadership Guest Speaker of the Year!!!
message: When I polled folks across the business to find out "who is incredibly charismatic and informative when explaining our business model?" Cam's name came up so many times. Cam, you took a seed of an idea and turned it into an incredible 1 hour presentation for our 31 Spark Leadership participants. Thank you so much for building the materials, taking feedback before the presentation, leading a Q&A, and giving one of the best ever guest speaker sessions. Don't take my word for it - one of our participants said: "Cam was a fantastic addition to the session. So interesting to understand our pricing model and how we make money. Learned a lot!" Best of all, we will be able to repurpose some of the recording for future training as well! THANK YOU CAM!

title: Designing Service & Support Future
message: Thank you for your outstanding dedication and engagement over the last 2 days. Each of you brought unique perspective, experience and insight into the workshop. Thanks to you, we have a strong foundation for building the maturity of our service and support capability over 2025.

title: That's a Wrap
message: The 2024 Spotlight Series just wrapped up! The 2nd and 3rd episodes were only a month apart! Thank you for your participation. The work started almost a year ago and each of you said 'Yes' to your role, whether it was work that spanned over the year, or involved being recorded for a segment. A lot of work goes into this event - planning, sourcing, promo, web, tech support, scripting, recordings, post-production. The list is long, and so is the list of humans who support this event. The team learned and pivoted over the year, modified the segments, adjusted the promo, never gave up on sourcing speakers, got creative with recording locations, and masterfully edited the episodes to include the best of the best content. Spotlight is the bass guitar of the Events portfolio - the important steady beat supporting our message and a platform to share it with the world. Cheers to all of you!

title: Work in progress and progress achieved!
message: Team,  I wanted to pause a moment and express gratitude for the support you have given as we try and put some rigour and process around our Insights to Action reporting and oversight.  All of you have been working diligently on executing different projects in order to help drive improvements in our program involved customers sentiment (we often refer to as "buyer" )   The recent nps results have been a reflection of the work all of the Workhuman teams have been doing,  but it is important that we get information to the relevant groups in order to help them decide which of the customer requests should be prioritised. title: Clifton Strengths = Witchy Super Powers

Although it's no surprise that I get a bit uncomfortable with messiness, you were well-prepared to guide us in leveraging our individual strengths for personal, professional, and team growth and showed me how to communicate around the messy. We saw an immediate use case in how I relayed a project to a member of my team! And it worked! It was incredibly enjoyable to engage in this exercise with the Corp Comm Leaders, and it‚Äôs an experience I will continually revisit as I learn more about myself and advance in my career.  We make lots of jokes about witches in this group -- but I think you really gave us a way to consider and make use of our powers. Corps Comms witches forever <3

title: Overcoming invoice generation issues at QE!
message: I‚Äôm extremely appreciative for the exceptional teamwork and dedication demonstrated by the wider technology teams during the recent challenges with our client invoice generation at quarter-end. The situation was undoubtedly demanding, yet the collective effort to swiftly address and mitigate the issue was remarkable. The ability to come together, assess the potential impact, explore viable solutions, and implement a fix ensured that our quarter-end close could proceed as planned. The level of communication maintained throughout was exemplary, and so important in navigating these hurdles. On the AR team, the shift from our scheduled routine to an improvised approach was handled flawlessly ‚Äì  the minimal customer inquiries regarding the delayed invoices speaks volumes about the effectiveness of how the issue was handled. On the FA & Tax front, the unwavering flexibility and teamwork were instrumental in steering us through the Close, culminating in a successful quarter-end process. Thank you all once again.

title: Helping shape leaders
message: Cam, thank you so much for your leadership recommendation reads. "Reality-Based Leadership" by CY Wakeman and "Dare to Lead" by Brene Brown have really opened my eyes both in how to be a better leader and a better human. They've helped me identify the fact that story building is something I naturally do, and that I should take a step back, ask clarifying questions and build my courage. They've also helped me identify the benefit of helping team members build their own courage by not being dependent on their leaders. I'm looking forward to practicing what I've learned from both to these great reads in order to build those leadership muscles. side-note, you're also a prime leader role model, thank you for all your help!

title: Hit it out of the park! ‚öæÔ∏è

Thank you again; I truly appreciate your support and willingness to help.

title: Gratitude for the Gratitude Bar Experience
message: We had to pivot this week to come up with a solution for the Gratitude Bar at WHL Forum. We came to an agreement on what the challenges are that we needed to solve and what the attendee experience. We sowed the seeds of a few ideas - one of which took root and now less than 24 hours later, it has blossomed into a fully vetted solution that should work for this event and many in the future. Here's to flower power!

title: See something, DO something - Connecting the dots
message: Dave, I want to highlight and commend you for seeing an opportunity, taking quick action to bring the right people together in service to demonstrating to a client at risk another tentpole of the value of our partnership. Amy, thank you for acting with urgency and for fostering such excellent relationships with market leaders.  During a call with Maine Health (aka Maine Medical Center) Sue the VP of HR Shared Services name dropped Ed Boyle at Gallup that he was speaking at an upcoming HR team meeting. Hearing how Sue valued Ed's point of view, and also knowing Sue is currently leading a x-functional committee examining internal programs and their impact on employee engagement, and that they are considering making a pivot in their strategy around recognition, Dave, you quickly ghost-wrote an email that Amy could send to Ed asking for his support and endorsement of working with Workhuman. Amy, you jumped right on it, and within hours had this response:   "You are so good at your job. How did you know about this meeting? I was literally made aware of it today. Of course I am up to a quick connect on this. Let me know what you need me to do and I will sort out how to work it into the session. Great to hear from you Amy."  That (visualize me pointing to the above) is the power of relationship, and a demonstration of how when all of us work together with a focused goal, we can move the needle, and do so quickly. Thank you Dave for connecting the dots between Gallup, Ed, Amy & Maine Health to seize an opportunity, and Thank you Amy for taking the baton passed to you and closing the loop.  I appreciate you both working quickly and confidently understanding who can help and taking the initiative to make it happen.

title: Quicksight Reporting Success
message: I want to say a big thank you to each person who contributed to the publication of the first Quicksight Revenue Reports to Production. This is a massive milestone for both the Fin Dev and Finance teams and took a tremendous amount of teamwork to get here. The journey began in 2022 when the Daily Batch Revenue Recognition Project kicked off, upgrading from a previous monthly run. The was released in June 2023 and laid the building blocks for the production of Quicksight Revenue Reports, with daily data population. From there Fin Dev and Finance worked together to explore opportunities for various reporting requirements across Revenue and Awards. We have had countless workshops, meetings, messages, emails exchanges and much more to share ideas, requirements around source data, content, definitions, calculations, format, structure, visuals, improvements, the list is endless. I‚Äôm delighted that we have now released the first two reports to Production, with a number more in development. The benefits of the automation of these reports include time saving efficiencies, quality control, removal of risk of manual error and the ability for daily refresh. The building blocks in the development of the domain and core models also opens the door for endless opportunity and efficiencies in further report development. Thank you for your ideas, collaboration, out of the box thinking, teamwork and all-round enthusiasm in this space. Well done to all involved!

title: ‚ÄúGreat Scott!‚Äù
message: Feb 7, 2022 - My 50th day in role, and likely the 10th time I asked how WH managed subscription overages. Cam & Kev, as you may recall, we held a call on that fateful to discuss. We knew our agreements allowed us to charge clients "for additional Users above the designated Quantity", but we also knew that due to a lack of process & data transparency, our Humans could not ably act on this claim, leaving meaningful unbilled dollars on the table each year. By the meeting‚Äôs end, we crafted a vision, including mining data with Product to display via QuickSight, developing user reporting for our teams & our customers, defining what ‚Äúvalid‚Äù users are, and establishing overage thresholds. We did not lack inspiration, but lamented we were not organizationally ready for the discipline & insights needed to execute.  Apr 2024 - My sincerest thanks and congratulations to ALL of you business stewards, for assembling your talents to redefine the term ‚Äúshared success partner‚Äù! After a 2+ year business transformation journey, you have successfully launched a thoughtful, 1st generation invoicing solution grounded in that Feb ‚Äò22 vision. This month 55 clients were intentionally billed for their Q1 user overages, resulting in tens of thousands of revenues being realized for valued products & services ‚Äì and this is the first of many quarters where this will routinely occur.  I laud your varied contributions that now benefit our company. You have designed, piloted, and launched new protocols, tools, reporting and communication cadences, and have ensured WH and our customers are both aware of who is benefiting from our products, and you are enabling us to take ‚Äúcredit‚Äù for this goodness whenever we determine we should. Please know your combined efforts have set an impressive new standard for future successes should we once again choose to elevate our already solid business expertise to greater heights.

title: Aba awesomeness
message: Thank you to each of you for your incredible support during the Executive Dinner at Aba during WHL! Your dedication, hard work, and coordination were key to making the dinner a success. From weekly calls, to approving and sending invites, to setup, to facilitators and runners, to our gracious hosts - each of you played an important role. And despite the challenges of another long day, your unwavering commitment ensured that everything ran smoothly, leaving attendees with a fantastic experience!

title: In the midst of brilliance
message: As we reflect on the resounding success of WorkhumanLive Austin, I am compelled to extend my deepest gratitude and admiration to each of you. Your leadership has been instrumental in turning a bold vision into an awe-inspiring reality, cementing its status as the premier conference for business leaders worldwide.  Your meticulous attention to every facet of the event, from pre-promotion, central, design & experience to speakers, technology, production, communications and surrounding events, has transformed ambitious ideas into a seamless experience for over 3,000 attendees. Your ability to orchestrate, collaborate, and innovate‚Äîwhile setting egos aside‚Äîhas not only elevated our brand and the WHL "product" but has also reinforced our promise to the community we serve.  The dedication, creativity, and problem-solving skills you displayed were pivotal in crafting an event that not only met but surpassed expectations. The quality of the keynote speakers, the depth of the sessions, and the flawless overall execution ensured that every participant left feeling connected and inspired. Your efforts have strengthened our relationships with customers, partners, and prospects while enriching the HR community and paving the way for new opportunities in pipeline creation and customer retention. The spirit of collaboration and inclusivity you fostered has set a new benchmark for excellence and showcased the true essence of Workhuman.  I am truly grateful for your hard work, passion, and unwavering commitment to excellence. I'm so proud to have you on ALL on the team. Thank you, every one of you, for your significant contributions.   Richard

title: It's great seeing you in action
message: Jill, calling you out for some great creative thinking here. We met today with some players representing an off-plan ask for internal event support. With more sizeable off-plan asks like this one, finding the resources (people and money) to make it work can be tough. On the call today, you listened carefully, ensured you understood some of the key moving parts tied to scope and funding, and you offered up several creative ideas for how to create the best experience possible while also saving money in the process.  They were all received well and I have confidence they'll make a real impact on the event.  Thanks for all you do to make events here a great experience.

title: Welcoming newcomers
message: Thank you all for your support of the Newcomers on Tour at WHL. This was a new activity this year that we developed to support a specific attendee journey. As with all new ideas, it required a lot of work behind the scenes to plan & develop and it required a lot of humanpower to pull it off onsite. Thank you to everyone who helped create and market the experience. Thank you to our hostesses who guarded the doors and shepherded the attendees onsite. And thank you to our fearless tour guides for making the experience educational and entertaining for attendees.

title: True Wrangler
message: Amy, thank you for being the speaker handler for John Baldino at both the Newcomers on Tour and the Lone Star Social. Because of your expert wrangling, John was at each event on time and prepared with his talking points. These new events were being tested out this year and I think including John enhanced the experience for the attendees. Appreciate the support!

title: Helping a guy out
message: Amy, thank you for thinking about the human (me) in addition to the audience on our first day of Live.  It was a long day, and I needed to complete all of the D1 reporting in the new template.  When I let you know I would not make it to your social event, you quickly sent me a picture of a small work room you had there, and encouraged me to join everyone there, have some food and drink, and continue to work.  It allowed me to be present, complete the days work, and also enjoy being around the team.  I appreciate you!

title: We Did It! -- Workhuman Innovation Launch
message: Thanks to this groups' hard work, collaboration, and innovative mindset, we were able to successfully pull off Workhuman's first product innovation launch. This required a great deal of cross-functional collaboration and I deeply appreciate how all of these teams came together and supported one another to create a stunning web page, powerful marketing campaigns, and impactful enablement for our internal teams as well as our customers.  All of this effort goes a long way towards advancing Workhuman's innovation reputation and further separating us from the competition. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

title: Our Fearless Leader
message: When reflecting on Austin over the last couple days I'm immediately reminded that we are the luckiest team (not to play favorites but...) You trust your team, while also lifting us up, being the voice of reason, and somehow through the crazy we leave with sore abs from laughing as hard as we do. It puts a new spin on work hard, play hard, and I am so grateful to have you leading the way to Austin and beyond.  Even when leading the way means jumping in and placing sticky notes :)

title: Taking Care of BOK Financial
message: Thank you all for supporting BOK Financial during Workhuman Live!   They had a FANTASTIC time at the event and felt truly taken care of. Each one of you supported their experience in a unique and important way. With an opportunity to move them over the line this year, they had multiple exclusive events like J Prime, Aba, meeting Brene Brown, and the Thursday Takeaway session. We have gotten extremely positive feedback throughout the event and post event. WHL won over key contacts at BOK Financial and we will be sure to use this momentum to accelerate the process.  Thank you!

title: Nailed It - Texas Style
message: With a final RFP presentation at Baylor Scott and White, the Monday after Workhuman Live, it meant putting your game faces on (not to mention flying BACK to Texas) and you all delivered.  Erin and Cam, it was so great to see you in action in person. This meant that there were serious time challenges, third party questioners and a large group to present to.  You both NAILED IT with a compelling conversation about our philosophy, platform features and capabilities and discussion of our partnership, not to mention discussing the art of the possible with Wellness Programs.  The people in the room were very engaged and appreciative of the discussion.  Even with the time constraints, you hit all the points, played off each other well and made a real conversation.  Katrine and Allie, your participation on the zoom call confirmed that we have and will provide excellent support for them, and your knowledge of the context helped us prepare thoroughly.  You all put our best foot forward and the 3rd party evaluator put it best when we saw her later ‚ÄúYou did a great job‚Äù.  Thank you!

title: One for the Books!
message: Here's to the incredible team of humans who supported our WHL breakout session scanning & line management this year in Austin!  You all stepped in and stepped up, and I cannot thank you enough for your patience, smiles, generosity and frankly keeping your calm, even when at a few sessions, it felt like people were ready to storm the room! You were all pros, from start to finish - and wow did we finish on Thursday with a bang at Cy's session. It truly looked and felt like this image above. Thank you for being kind even to those folks who we all knew were "pulling one over on us" (let us never give out book signing tickets again!) and for being so wonderful to me, running around with my hair on fire. And most importantly, for filling in for each other when other priorities arose - delivering a truly amazing experience for every one of our attendees, and for all your teammates. You are appreciated more than you know.

title: Workhuman Live Austin 2024!
message: As we revel in the success of WorkhumanLive Austin, I'm compelled to express my deepest gratitude and admiration for everyone who played a pivotal role in orchestrating what has indeed become the world's leading conference for business leaders. To our magnificent events team, your ability to transform our vision into a stunning reality is nothing short of miraculous. Every detail of the event was crafted with precision, turning ambitious ideas into an awe-inspiring experiences for over 3,000 attendees. Your dedication and creativity have not only set a new benchmark for excellence but have also showcased the true spirit of Workhuman. The cross-functional execution of the Sales, Marketing, and Customer teams was crucial in weaving the rich tapestry of this event. Your efforts have fortified our brand's promise and paved the way for new opportunities in pipeline creation and customer retention. I must also acknowledge our Workhuman back-office teams - your support over the last 18 months has been the backbone of our success from procurement and legal contracts to finance and administrative champions, your relentless support ensured that every piece fell perfectly into place.  Your collective attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and commitment to inclusivity have not only enhanced our relationships with customers, partners, prospects, and the entire HR community but also enriched the experience for every attendee. From the quality of the keynote speakers to the thought-provoking sessions and flawless execution, you all ensured that every participant left with a sense of connection and inspiration.  Thank you, each and every one of you, for your hard work, your passion, and your unwavering commitment to excellence. Here‚Äôs to your success and the continued growth of our event as a beacon for business leaders around the globe. Cheers to the entire team behind WorkhumanLive Austin!

title: Teamwork makes the dream work!
message: Thank you for taking time out of your day to meet with me. I appreciate the knowledge and history sharing, it helps me since I am still fairly new to WH. You did a great job breaking down the different sections of a contract just so I can visually understand how most are done. Thank you!

title: Thoughtful Leadership Makes a Team
message: Amy, I've been reflecting on last week at WHL, and three instances keep resonating with me that I want to express my gratitude for.  First, on Monday night at the Austin Taco Project, you were the only one who thought to offer me the chance to take a break from checking in speakers. It allowed me to mingle with them, which made such a difference in my interactions with them the rest of the week. Your inclusion made a significant difference, and I cherished that time.  Secondly, being included in Issa Rae's meet and greet backstage was unexpected and incredibly appreciated. As a newer member, I didn't anticipate to be included backstage at all. Your decision to invite me, even though you could have excluded me, was so thoughtful. It led to a memorable experience and a team moment in that photo opportunity with Issa that I would have missed otherwise.  Lastly, during Andy's book signing, you ensured I didn't miss a special moment when everyone headed to the room where Richard gave a "cheers" to our group. Your thoughtfulness in including me left a lasting impression.  So all of that to say, I just want to thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for your genuine thoughtfulness as a leader. I've always been in roles that often go overlooked by supervisors and members of leadership for some pretty cool opportunities like the three I mentioned here. And the fact that you were aware and thoughtful enough to include me, when you didn't have to, and when nobody else would have, is something I'll carry with me for the rest of my life. It truly means more than you'll ever know.  I feel incredibly fortunate to work for and alongside you. Thank you for everything you do.

title: Little things that matter!
message: Nicole, Jose, Erin, Jeff, Ashley and Jill - thank you for helping me with the many little things that needed attention to ensure a smooth experience for the customers as well as myself at Workhuman Live the past week. From coordinating parking passes for the CDO, to getting creative with me to ensure prime seats were reserved for our VIP guests, to correcting my name on the app to avoid confusing customers, to taking notice that I wasn‚Äôt keeping myself nourished while running around, to making sure my water cooler reservations accommodated the large Execuitve group, to making sure my hotel booking was done correctly‚Ä¶ the list goes on! These may seem like small things but they each had a big impact in the audience that was involved. Every little thing adds up to a collective experience and I appreciate each one of you for making it easier for me to deliver a flawless one. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!

title: RFP Superstars!
message: Thank you all so so much for going onsite to BSW and giving the most incredible presentation - it was so apparent how much time, effort and preparation went into today. The customers were so engaged, asking questions, laughing at stories and really taking in everything that you were showing to them. I know everyone just got home from WHL and to then hop on a flight for a one hour onsite was probably the last thing anyone wanted to do so THANK YOU! And not just for today, but for all of the ongoing strategy and presentations while I was gone too. You all absolutely killed it :)

title: Creating an experience that resonated
message: Ladies, what can I say but, 'I see the vision now'. Before anyone else, you all saw the opportunity to bring the HX community into the role of shepherd and representative to the conference experience in a major way. And while I truly made the face that was displayed to the conference and internally felt that you might regret it, you certainly were right. Attendees increasingly came up to share how seen and validated they felt in watching HX take center stage and how invigorated they were to take lessons and the power of their voices back to the workplaces to share with their organizations. I certainly couldn't have created or foreseen the impact this would have on so many and I am grateful that you trusted me to shepherd your vision out to attendees.  thank you so much for what you've done which is to create for everyone there last week the experience and feeling I had at my first Workhuman live. It matters more than you'll know.

title: Quick to be Strategists for Lunch!
message: Brenda and Cam, Thank you so much for joining Brandon and I for lunch with Lisa for MillerKnoll.  The complexity of what they have been going through as an organization from the CEO PR Debacle to the two most senior level HR leaders leaving and being replaced along with their efforts to harmonize 16 brands amidst it all has been interesting to navigate during a deal cycle.  The two of you were more than happy to spend time with Lisa at Workhuman Live, engage in robust conversation and really listen to all the challenges she has faced in her 8 month tenure with the organization.  Cam the second you heard they were in your home state you willingly offered to be on site and be part of the conversation.  Brenda the time you put in providing your additional thoughts after the lunch conversation and ability to see the many impacts of their strategy is so valuable.   Appreciate you stepping in and value the partnership with you both!

title: Urgent Customer Questions from Qualcomm
message: Since nobody was busy this past week, getting to this urgent request from Qualcomm should be easy.  Oh wait, we had Workhuman Live ALL week long which required significant FOCUS (see what I did there) and attention to making sure all the attendees were having the best experience possible, learning, networking, and being inspired.  After our big finalist presentation last week, there was a glimmer of hope that we'd have a chance to breathe as we entered the week of WHL24.  However, we received a flurry of questions that came from Qualcomm that needed to be answered with accuracy, care, and sensitivity due to the nature of where we are in the sales cycle.  You all were kind enough to break away for a bit to help me think through and craft the proper responses, which included another clarifying question even after we sent over the initial responses.  I simply wanted you to know how unbelievably grateful I am to this group for your support üíØ

title: Writer‚Äôs Room
message: Thank you to the Workhuman Live Writer‚Äôs Room! I‚Äôve always wanted a writers room and you guys delivered. Having a sounding board, a place to discuss and brainstorm, to swap ideas, to tease out difficult narratives - this is what‚Äôs makes a story come alive. We always have to balance the heart and the head with this conference. It is a balance of altruism and direct business objectives. Getting that balance right can be infuriating at times and needs a thoughtful approach. I think we got the balance right. Jen, you were juggling so many strands and so many different voices, it is a wonder you didn‚Äôt go mad! Thank you all for your diligent efforts and creative energies. Well done!

title: You made WHL Spectacular for so many!
message: Thank you for leading your teams to create a spectacular high touch event for all of your customers this week at WHL!  I know that you and your teams went to great lengths to create specially curated value added engagements - from the CDO breakfast, to the Cy Wakeman dinner to what you all did with Schneider, ensuring even the littlest details were cared for.  You know how to make a splash so much so there were so many opportunities created.  I know there will be a lot of recognition going out to your folks for the finer details, but I wanted to make sure you know how much I appreciate each of you - your leadership, your creativity, and your experience to make WHL even more special and impactful so much so, that we managed to open doors to new possibilities this week.  Impact that drives outcomes.  BOOM.

title: A Lilly Partnership WOW!
message: A massive CONGRATULATIONS to an amazing team of people from all sides of Workhuman who contributed to an outstanding and game changing TWO DAY on-site business review and planning session in Indianapolis with Team Lilly. We WOWed this customer and their stakeholders. It was successful because we listened, tailoring our message to invite dialogue. We built relationships at every opportunity, delivered differentiated value and modeled a commitment to the partnership. We got Lilly thinking differently about ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs possible‚Äù and we shifted their view of us! They know we are a collaborative thought partner fully invested in their success!   Thank you to the many teams and people whose contributions made this possible: Danielle D‚ÄôElia for her unwavering focus, collaborative partnership, and visionary strategy consulting leadership that showcased ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs possible‚Äù for Lilly. YOU moved them! Margarita Kurlyanchik whose deep knowledge and steady guidance in her commitment to customer success, and Bryant Attaway who is stepping into the CSM role without missing a beat. Grant Beckett for inviting dialogue, imparting wisdom, and lending differentiated value at every opportunity. Isha Vicaria and Jesse Harriott for thinking about data and innovation differently, effortlessly weaving insights with value, and whose work and insights were enabled by so many on the WhiQ product team: Matt Graci, Yanqin Tan, Mimi Zhang, Andrew Nedilko and Danielle Sinha.  Adam Basilio and Jason Gori for bringing our product roadmap and reporting to life. Sarah Whitman, Weichen Zhu and Mindi Ennis on the e-com team for digging deep to showcase the value of the Store experience. Susan Nolan and Eliza Goehry, who delivered insights on the engagement series, illustrating how successful those campaigns can be from a best practice perspective. And Sheri Riter for her strategic leadership and support. A team effort through and through. Thank you ALL!

title: Last minute star!
message: Nothing like swooping in at the 11th hour for a strategic review with a customer that is really invested and uses these reviews to drive forward their strategy with data and our recommendations! With a small window to get this done and get it done right you corralled all the right people to ensure Lam would have the best of the best providing what was important to them. You took the time to meet with Lark in advance and really listen and hone in on what she was looking for so we would have the opportunity to hit on all the most important items, recognition experience, IC awareness, manager engagement, and so much more!  thank you for leading this to another successful review for Lam with many actionable takeaways and they cant wait to implement. Lark couldn't even go to sleep with out saying how appreciative she was!

title: Lam Singing your Praises!
message: Sheri & Margarita, Wow ‚Äì the GLOWING remarks from Lark at Lam says it all: ‚ÄúThe annual review meeting provided Lam with extremely valuable insights and recommendations. I can only imagine how much went into this and ALL the incredible work that was required for this presentation. THANK YOU both! We greatly appreciate you bringing in the other subject matter experts as well. We look forward to implementing several of the solutions discussed today.‚Äù  These kinds of accolades don‚Äôt just happen everyday and speaks volumes to the work you all are doing together with Lam.  Sheri, you have stepped in with the absence of an SCD at this time on top of your day job and to no surprise, knocked this out of the park.  Margarita, I know how dedicated you are to all the customers you partner with, so your work and partnership with Lam is so impactful.  Thank you both for your commitment to excellence!

title: Avanade Case Study Filming Help
message: Thanks to you all for shortly disrupting your day to help capture b-roll for Avanade‚Äôs Microsoft Teams Case Study shoot.  Things came together last minute, but your willingness to support an initiative that will bring eyes and ears to this impactful integration is much appreciated.  Cheers!

title: Who knew it was a scavenger hunt?!
message: Thank YOU for being part of the Workhuman Live 2024 Scavenger Hunt (AKA - gift card prizes shuffle). There was a plan. It required a pivot. Then another pivot. In a short timeframe. Thank you for keeping an eye on the prize to make sure we give our attendees accurate details in all the places - while educating them about our EComm platform. Cheers!

title: 2023 Audit - Done!!!!
message: A huge thank you to everyone for all your work during the 2023 year-end financial audit. The completion of the annual audit is one of the key milestones for the finance team. A target was set of having the audit completed in record time this year ‚Äì yesterday this target was achieved with the receipt of EY‚Äôs signed audit report which sets a record for earliest completion of the audit and issuance of the financial statements ‚Äì a fantastic achievement! Each one of you delivered in order to reach this milestone ‚Äì providing listings & reconciliations, preparing schedules, accounting memos, detailed explanations, attending meetings, jumping on calls, pulling samples, addressing queries‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.the list goes on. While going through an audit can be frustrating and seem never ending at times, you all demonstrated remarkable commitment, teamwork and urgency in ensuring that all of EY‚Äôs requests and follow up queries were closed out efficiently and timely. It‚Äôs great that we can now start Q2 with the audit behind us. Great work all and well done!

title: Investing in our new talent.
message: An award i have been meaning to put through for some time and that a big thank you for the time invested in finding the right talent during the hiring process for the open role within the AR collections team at year end. i know a lot of work was done to comb through the market review candidates and set up interviews. there is then the time invested in conducting the interviews during what was a super busy period of the year as we approached the end of year. Thank you for your collaboration from providing feedback on the candidates and being a soundboard for me as i created the rec and put thought into the required personnel to fill the roll, it was great that we were all on the same page and ultimately in agreement on the chosen candidate. getting it all tied up prior to the Xmas break to have our new hire start in the new year was super impressive and important as we had further time consuming activities taking place in Q1 that required focus.

title: The Best Brain Trust!
message: Thank you all for the work, content and ideation you put forward for the Prudential strategy call! We set out to prove the value in our partnership and to get them thinking about all the ways we can optimize You Rock! to it's fullest potential, and boy did we! The amazing discovery session at the beginning of the call gave us all the ammunition we needed to not just tailor the upcoming annual review, but also the strategy session we were in. I know it may have been taken about 70% of the hour, but I know it is going to be integral to our ongoing PRU strategy. Seriously - shout out to Sheri, Isha, Shelly and Adam who presented their fantastic content eloquently while at a break-neck speed! I couldn't be more excited about the direction we are now in for the annual review, their 2024 strategy and beyond. Thank you all again for your work and for being the best Brain Trust out there!

title: The most innovative leader
message: Amy,  Daily, I am floored by your unwavering dedication to driving innovation within our corp comms team.  Your encouragement of experimentation has encouraged us to push boundaries and explore uncharted ways and means of tackling projects.   Your strategic way of thinking, always with data in mind, coupled with your openness to new perspectives enables us to perform in new ways as a team together - you truly drive innovation and collaboration. Your ability to inspire and motivate others is setting a remarkable standard of leadership for us all. So lucky to be a part of your team.

title: Department Meetings
message: Thank you all for the help, guidance, logistics and planning, that went into my department World Tour these past few weeks! It's actually a difficult thing to accomplish logistically. Getting the right amount of attendees, whilst making sure there was enough department concentration in each meeting so that I could tailor the talk to the specific circumstances, was a balancing act. I was disappointed that my rider at each location of Crunchies was cruelly ignored, but I pushed on ¬†üòÇ A special thank you to Amy who, mercilessly, had to sit through every one,  and listen to mostly the same talk track time after time - what an accomplishment! Seriously, thank you all for the endless help!

title: Help with Babson students
message: Thank you for your help walking the Babson students through your organization and how we use data to drive decisions.

title: Ever Evolving Team
message: Thank you all for your continued support in nurturing the non-org,  Salesforce Team! The collaboration and constructive discussions had around structuring the team and each of our responsibilities (yay RACI discussions at 8AM/EST) helps in both our personal career development AND our teams efficient, quality, deliverables to the business.

title: End User NPS vs Program Design...Signals Found!!
message: Wanted to take a quick moment to celebrate this brilliant team for your continued focus and teamwork. For many weeks, you've carved out time to crunch the numbers (Barbara & Radoslaw), make sense of the patterns (Cam, Lynette & Naomi), and helped us take our findings forward to new stakeholders. Congrats on the great progress we've made and always looking forward to our next!!

title: Excellence in Leadership
message: Taking a moment during the (somewhat) calm before the storm to recognize and thank you both for your leadership.  As we head into the final weeks before Austin, I want to recognize you both for the quiet things you do daily to keep the team motivated, priorities in check, and ensure we offer our attendees the very best experience.  I am grateful to be a part of this kick a$$ team.

title: 1 month from today
message: 1 month from today, Workhuman Live 2024 will be over. That means right now you are swamped, probably stressed, maybe losing sleep, keeping track of 100 things. AND building Workhuman Live Forum, wheels turning on a couple Spotlights, plus ramping up Workhuman Live 2025. Its a lot! Keep breathing, doing great work, with FOCUS ;-) on the month ahead. The finish line is coming into view. You can do it. Thank you for your dedication, commitment, and perseverance. Best. Team. Ever.

title: Bringing Vague Ideas to Life!
message: Chuck, Cam - I cannot thank you enough for your inspiration, innovation, drive and commitment to bringing the concept we talked about back in November to life in our 2024 CE compensation plans.  Each of you working diligently to bring clarity & definition, thinking through the possibilities and delivering a solid approach to replacing our MBO components in our plans with something that is quantifiable and unquestioningly aligned to our objectives as an organization and as a company.  I am so indebted to both of you for your tireless approach to getting it done right and done well.  Thank you for taking the time to consider a lot of different options, work with people across the organization like Meghan to understand how NPS works, and ensure that we could inject this new way of compensating our teams in time to lock in for 2024.  Your attention to detail, careful consideration to what works, and desire to build an approach that would actually enable upside for our people is so appreciated.  Undoubtedly this took many cycles of discussion, contemplation, reworking and more research.  And then, Chuck to have taken the extra step to put the powerpoint slides together that told the whole story for our team call today was an added bonus.  THANK YOU!

title: We got this
message: What a few weeks for our tiny team of two. While the change we're going through could create anxiety, unease and fear in a person, I have none of these feelings. With you as my leader, I know we are making the right decisions and I believe whole heartedly that you are the greatest leader I have ever worked with. You care. About it all. Even the little things that no one should care about. Knowing I have you to support, guide and laugh with me through the week is what gets me up on a Monday morning. The Corp Comms team is hashtagblessed to have you.

title: Q1 QBR Leadership
message: Sheri, this recognition is far past due, but I wanted to share what a wonderful job you did leading your first solo QBR for your team in Q1.  There is a tremendous amount of preparation that goes into delivering an end-to-end experience each quarter - not only planning the topics to inspire, coordinating leaders to join, setting expectations and leading the strategy.  I appreciate the passion you have for your team and focus you have on what is needed to really get the team focused on the right things to move the business forward.  Your leadership is paramount to their success and I appreciate the care and dedication you exude.  Bravo to you!

title: Data Delight!
message: Team, thank you all for the recent work on various report generation and data reviews.  So much of the work we do is dependent upon data to make informed decision and predict future outcomes.  All of you have helped in generating new reports supporting both Workhuman Live and Spotlight on audience data & segmentation trends, revenue trends, historical performance, trend comparisons and normalization, and more.  It‚Äôs a daily need, that continues to push us in the right directions and supports the strong event performance we are seeing.  Thank you all for your partnership, collaboration, and patience.  Now just wait for the post event asks üòâ

title: Many Hands Make Light Work
message: Throughout the week we met with this group of individuals to help us get ready for a very important upcoming meeting with Applied Materials.  During our time with them in the sales process, design, implementation and launch this January...their team has always had an interest in what their near peers are doing in this space.  As we prepare for our meeting next week with the Head of Compensation, Head of Benefits, and Shared Services Leadership - all of you played a role in helping us understand how LAM and KLA have been successful in partnering with Workhuman.  In addition, we learned more about how Gilead decided to finally make the move from YOS only to adding R&R to the equation as they look to take their program to new heights.  I feel like we'll be able to confidently lead the Applied team to understanding the value of our partnership, and how we can ensure they are wildly successful as they grow their program and partnership with us.  Thank you all again for your support, it is so very appreciated üíØ

title: Many Thanks on this special occasion
message: Ladies, First off I am beyond blessed to work with such amazing, passionate, group of women. These past few weeks leading up to this soft opening this week you have all either jumped in last min or has been on for the long run. I am at a loss for words for the dedication of leadership, team bonding, taking charge where needed, and being the running support system that our Workplace Experience team needed at such a crunch time. I look around at this strong amazing set of women and thank my lucky stars to have you on our side as we step into this new chapter at our beautiful space. Thank you all and we appreciate your time and leadership. Keep shining through, as today might be international women's day but you all lead the pack all year long. Be proud of the ladies you are and keeping shining!

Although we ran out of time I hope you all enjoyed the discussion and being part of the contribution process for this project. Looking forward to collaborating with you again in the future.Thanks.

As we continue into our 2024 journey together, I can see great things happening already and the imagination you all have to take us to the next level is inspiring. Again I think a great kick off for the Site Functional Leadership Team and excited about what lies ahead!

message: Shout out to the Season of Giving taskforce for yet another successful customer marketing holiday campaign (and debrief session)! With this cross-functional partnership these campaigns continue to improve as we drive more engagement with our customers & unlock new opportunities to encourage recognition during these important national & global holidays. Thank YOU!

title: Making great progress
message: Barbara, Lynette & Cam...thank you so much for your continued focus on our Recognition Maturity Model passion project. Barbara, you've taken our idea and run with it in such an amazing way and based on our latest meeting, it's easy to see how incredibly close we are to being able to pull out some very useful Program Design insights from our Qualtrics eNPS data. Cam and Lynette, a huge THANKS for continuing to share your invaluable perspectives on what questions to ask based on your extensive experience with our customers over many years. We've now had around a half dozen meetings over these past 4 months and we're making steady progress! Know we have more work to do but I can't help but celebrate each of you as we continue to move forward. Very soon we'll able to share with our future customers (and any current customers looking to freshen things up) all of our data driven best practice program design recommendations thanks to this project:) Cheers to this brilliant team for all the work thus far!!

title: Unlocking key customer data
message: Thanks Cam for joining my All Hands to continue to educate and unlock where and how my team can see where to find key customer insights. Today was an important call to continue to connect the dots between the work they do to our initiatives to Zoe‚Äôs breakout to the WH Strategy Board. Having it all tie together matters, and being able to learn how they can measure impact of various strategies plus see commitments in forecasts‚Ä¶it all hangs together. I‚Äôm impressed with how quickly dashboards and capabilities to measure what we need has come together, and it‚Äôs why you hit the stage last week. You continue to deliver day in and day out in pursuit of teamwork and collaboration to make us stronger and Win. And yes, I‚Äôm going to keep using that pic time and time again!

title: Coming Together for BSW

After receiving the email from WTW letting us know we were being requested to join a meeting to help BSW during their review of different recognition programs this team quickly came together to develop a well thought out presentation with just over a weeks notice. I know many of you rearranged calendars to ensure you could make both the planning and final meetings and due to this I feel confident that we are well prepared for this meeting and will be very successful.

title: Powerful Reflection
message: Amy, there almost aren't enough words to express my gratitude for how far our relationship has come. The psychological safety you have fostered, moments where you've pushed me to grow, and the support to do so that you've continued to give. I take something new from every conversation we have. I deeply appreciate how we have grown together and am so lucky to have found you as my leader after all of the change I have been through. As I wrote my first reflection, I reflected on the challenges and accomplishments I have experienced under your guidance. Giving me the opportunity to reflect and feel pride for so many reasons was a powerful exercise. Thank you for leading the way you do, albeit challenging at times, it's pushed me to truly look within and learn so much.

title: A boss a leader and a friend

title: Activate Core (Dream) Team
message: Team,  What an amazing event! From start to finish, every detail was sweated. Every moment was scrutinized for maximum impact. Every idea and concept was taken to the next-level. Every attendee learning objective was kept at the heart of every decision. The result was our best kick-off event yet, and that's off a tremendously high bar set last year. Your individual and collective commitment and "can do" spirit was inspiring to observe throughout the preparation process and even more inspiring to experience as it all came together. title: Putting Pendo to the Test
message: Team, thank you all for the partnership and support in leveraging Pendo to extend reach and awareness of Workhuman Live to our customers. Innovating and trying new things is such an important aspect of how we will grow, achieve results, and ideally reduce overall effort needed across the team to do more at every step. I appreciate everyone being open and enthusiastic to the idea, working together to help bring it to life. Now we watch to see what we learn from it!
