It all starts with the great relationship that you have been building Chris that put us in a good position to kick things off.  James and Michael helped paint the picture by leading the RFP part of the process which was incredibly detailed, and as per usual, you crushed it.  Making sure we showed up and ready to dazzle - Larry, Brian, Kevin, Owen, and Chris...can't thank you enough for your excellence in building a fantastic custom demo and mood video for the delivery team, it really was moving for them.  Lastly, to Nuvs, Cam Jason, and Lisa, thank you for helping craft and deliver an incredible presentation to the 15+ attendees from the Kaiser team.  We've left a lasting impression on their team and have given ourselves the best chance to bring on the entire enterprise of 200K employees.  I appreciate all that you do to help set us up for success, and hopefully all this teams efforts will result in another happy Workhuman customer!!!

title: Respect for honesty, candor and proactiveness.
message: I wanted to take a moment to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional work and dedication demonstrated by Amy Rice and Amanda Grady this week. Their partnership in kicking off discussions has been truly commendable, and I am grateful for their honesty, candor, and proactive approach.  Amy and Amanda's commitment to taking proactive steps to elevate Workhuman to the next level and secure key opportunities for Eric is exemplary. title: The answer is yes!
message: I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful for your recent support in helping to get our first-ever live workshop for the Sustain/Evolve segment off the ground. Whether the ask was to cofacilitate and help shape the agenda (Patrick), figure out how to host the live workshop and register customers (Luke), or set up and send registration emails from Salesforce (Cam, Miguel, and Chrissy), the answer was always a resounding YES! I know 2024 has started with a bang, so I appreciate how you all stepped up with already full plates to help us kick off a new initiative to better support our customers and their long-term success. While we‚Äôre a few weeks out from the inaugural event, the first email we sent was a success and registrations are already coming in. I thank each of you for your respect for teamwork, your respect for customers, but most of all, your respect for urgency!

title: Continued Support
message: Sheri and Susan I want to thank both of you for the continued support during the GE HealthCare.  This project has some may unique aspects to it, and both of you were always involved and looking to help wherever needed.  Thank you so much.

title: Marketing Support
message: Hi all,  I want to extend my sincere thanks for all your outstanding contributions and all your hard work and support with Marketing over this busy year. Different approvals, requests, queries we have with our Invoices or suppliers‚Äô, new vendors onboarding, WH Live Events, you guys always managed to get all this sorted immediately due to your professionalism and the respect for our customers Wishing each one of you a Happy Christmas filled with well-deserved rest and looking forward to another successful year working together.

title: Fantastic support
message: Hi all,  I want to extend my sincere thanks for your outstanding contributions over this challenging year. title: Making Marvelous Moves all Year
message: Happy Holidays all!  I wanted to take a moment to thank you for all the incredible work you all have delivered in 2023.  It has been a tremendous year full of lots of ups and downs, but you have given your all to our customers and I couldn‚Äôt be prouder of each of you.  This year has been the most challenging I can remember for Workhuman, but you never missed a beat in delivering growth, renewing our partnerships, and creating new opportunities that have set us up for success in 2024.  As I reflect, the meetings you all had with Executives from the world‚Äôs largest and most admired organizations are achievements most only dream of, but you make it happen regularly.  Thank you for the commitment you make each day to our customers, myself and Workhuman.  Cheers to your dedication and perseverance!

title: People Leader of the Year!
message: Cam, I seriously couldn't have dreamt up a better People Leader! There have been many ups and downs throughout 2023 and you were there with a cool head throughout it all. You recognize the importance Salesforce plays for the company as a whole and are open to re-prioritize at a drop of a dime to ensure the mission critical/most value added projects are top of list, even if that means a project outside of your department! You give us the space needed to complete projects and always offer a helping hand when barriers popup. I hope I can be even half the People Leader you are some day! Thank you for being you!!

title: Fantastic Partner
message: What is the definition of partnership?   "A partnership is an arrangement between two or more people to oversee business operations and share its profits and liabilities."   Cam, Thank You. Thank you for the hours of time you have given me throughout 2023 in service to helping me better understand client operations, billings growth and the state of the customer business. You have helped me learn to fish, enabling me with tools and insights involving me in a way that I now have such a deeper level of understanding and appreciation for the client side of our business. Along the way we have had some incredible conversations too flushing out opportunities, ideas, whales, and the number of books you have shared in your excitement of new ideas is inspiring.  Thank you for being a partner, sharing with me our profits and liabilities. I appreciate you are a straight shooter, open-minded, highly motivated, thoughtful and passionate about our direction. It has been absolutely wonderful to partner with you this past year, and I'm looking forward to what we'll accomplish in 2024! üçª

title: Minimum Commitment Support
message: Lads a massive thank you to both of you for all of your help with minimum commitment this year and especially the last few months. You have both really helped our team push the process of sending invoices once a client misses their commitment target which has resulted in no delay in sending invoices. The last few months you have also taken ownership of the At Risk Clients list and taken the group through that on our monthly call, asked the CSM for updates along the way and pretty much said "Send" to every potential penalty ahead of time. This has been a huge help to the billing team. Thank you both and enjoy!

title: Financial Assistance!
message: A big thanks to all our FinDev stakeholders in Finance for what has been an interesting year. There's been numerous projects we've worked on where your collaboration has been fundamental in helping us achieve our goals. From introducing Experiences earlier into the year, shifting the monthly batch RevRec to daily, and then of course the US Sales Tax project. These and other projects have required plenty of input and UAT from yourselves which is a big ask when you have to make time outside of your main duties. It's also been an interesting year for production issues, not always of our making of course but you have been very patient and helpful as we worked on resolving them. Thanks again from FinDev!

title: Moderna 3-Year Closed/Won!
message: Team, we can officially say that the Moderna 3-year renewal is officially closed!  Cam and Jamie, your efforts were instrumental in making this a reality.  Throughout numerous discussions with the Moderna team, you helped us clearly demonstrate the unique value we offer and why we are priced the way we are.  Moreover, I truly appreciate your partnership with the CSM team.  Your willingness to share knowledge, help facilitate crucial conversations, and highlight the importance of why we choose to monetize our system in 2 key areas, underscores your dedication to delivering maximum value to our clients.  Chris and Chuck, a heartfelt thank you for your crucial roles behind the scenes and your willingness to talk through the final details.  Your support is always appreciated!  Alex, you have maintained a strong relationship with this group for the last couple of years, which led us to this point.  We had a nice onsite with them earlier this year, and they had no doubts that Workhuman was the right partner for them to help energize and get the most out of their employees.  Thank you again to this entire team for delivering a key win to close out 2023 strong.  Cheers to 2024!

title: Reorg? More like WEorg!
message: They say change is hard. Heck, it definitely is.  BUT‚Ä¶. when you‚Äôre lucky enough to have a talented, engaged, and supportive group of players in the mix to work through it, together, it gets a whoooole lot easier.     Over the past several weeks, I engaged you all asking for your time and insights to support us collectively working through the ‚Äúwho does what, now?‚Äù of it all. Along the way, I‚Äôve been continually impressed with how you all handled the work.  Each of you was clearly driven to make yourselves available amid all the other daily work. What‚Äôs more, along the way you all remained consistently engaged, thoughtful, open-minded, and positive in the face of working through the change.   Did we cure cancer? No. Have we solved every little thing that needs to be solved for? No. But we certainly solved for the vast majority of the most pressing aspects of the new ‚Äúwho does what‚Äù for our restructured creative teams. That is a major milestone and something we should all celebrate.   Thank you all for stepping up to help get this done, together. Here‚Äôs looking forward to starting of 2024 with what, to me, looks to be some of the strongest alignment we‚Äôve ever had regarding how our Marketing creative teams are structured and what work they each support. Upward and onward!

What‚Äôs more, along the way you all remained consistently engaged, thoughtful, open-minded, and positive in the face of working through the change.   Did we cure cancer? No. Have we solved every little thing that needs to be solved for? No. But we certainly solved for the vast majority of the most pressing aspects of the new ‚Äúwho does what‚Äù for our restructured creative teams. That is a major milestone and something we should all celebrate.   Thank you all for stepping up to help get this done, together. Here‚Äôs looking forward to starting of 2024 with what, to me, looks to be some of the strongest alignment we‚Äôve ever had regarding how our Marketing creative teams are structured and what work they each support. Upward and onward!

title: Bay Area, Birria and the Balm of Gilead
message: Team Gilead, as I reflect on our whirlwind travels in the blue-sky Bay Area, I am thankful for everyone's commitment to making this Design Lab meeting a success for our Gilead partners. With some big team changes (PM out on maternity, one of the program sponsors unexpectedly out on long-term leave, executive sponsor getting more involved), it was critical to get face-to-face time to instill confidence in Gilead for their program launch and timeline. The fact that Camille gave us four hours of her time speaks volumes, and we got important insight into leadership and cultural initiatives underway at Gilead, as well as how to position the program for success to support a culture of gratitude ("G" is for Gilead and Gratitude!) Thanks to our amazing sponsor Lianne, we learned about the Balm of Gilead (a biblical perfume with healing properties), how delicious Birria nachos are on Food Truck Thursday, as well as a rapport-building dinner in Burlingame. Cam, the strength of the relationship and Gildead's careful consideration of their program design with the massive change elements is a credit to your pre-work and handholding with the team to contract. Matt, my partner in crime (8 launches and counting?!) - thank you for co-piloting our Design Lab approach to ensure we provided Lianne with the best experience, and the confidence that we used the time with their stakeholders in the best possible way. Dinorah - thank you for traveling cross-country for this learning experience, enhancing our client experience and supporting me onsite at the DL. There's no one else I'd rather embark on a Lyft minivan tour of the Bay area with than the three of you!

Adam, Stephen, Chaslau, Maksim, Ruchi and Aiden for the run up to launch with invoicing set-up and launch day support, datafile requests and working on last min eligibility rules, SOLI reviews and branding tweaks. Chris, Kevin, Connor, Julia, Emily, Hillary, Jennie, thanks for your work on the Sanofi finance and amendment requests, the FX queries, custom invoicing, and the CIL set-up. I appreciate there has been a lot of meetings and work both internally and externally to support these, thank you all for your work to get us here. On launch day there was great excitement generated with site celebrations, balloons, cupcakes and selfie boots at the launch events, we received really positive feedback from the program team and Sanofi employees. Huge congrats and thank you to you all again for your contributions to this client launch.

title: Big Ask = Big Response
message: A staff DSAR is never a simple ask when they have access to so many systems and we deal with so much of their personal data. When you get 7 in the same timeframe it is one big lift. Thanks to each of you in the business areas who dug into your files and your email to assist with this request. Thank you to the HX teams who had to dig into their own files as well as those of former colleagues and for multiple people - I know it was a mammoth task. A bit thank you to Simona and Liam who supported this effort from infosec side, reviewing every piece of data on all requests and removing the data of other users! I know there were times when we didn't think we would get through this but we did!! Thank you all.

title: WHL Forum - An Only Workhuman Can Do Event!
message: Team, I want to express my sincere appreciation and take a moment to recognize you for the remarkable team effort that made the first-ever WHL Forum in London an extraordinary success this week. The energy and dedication you poured into planning and executing this event from garnering 591 registrations, and securing inspiring speakers, thought-leaders in Dan Health, and customers from Sanofi and bp to localizing the event creative, sourcing local entertainers with the ‚ÄúShowstoppers‚Äù, and executing a seamless and flawless logistical plan ‚Äî you were all truly exceptional.   Your passion, expertise, and collaborative spirit showed our mission and values on center stage! We created a perfect balance between knowledge-sharing and networking, leaving everyone feeling enriched and motivated - evident in how we captivated our audience and ignited their passion for creating a positive workplace culture (reinforced with our data) while allowing participants to actively engage, learn, and exchange ideas with their peers.    Your collective efforts helped support our annual business goals by creating an opportunity to engage with 72M in active pipeline across 15 opportunities, 27 customer accounts representing 280M in annual billings, 4 media interviews onsite, and 30 product demos with high-end brands like Rivian, Pearson, Lacoste, and Virgin Media. Beyond the numbers, we created a solid brand reputation in the market. You have all made a significant impact on the success of the Workhuman Live Forum, and I am grateful to have such an exceptional team by my side.   You should all feel really proud of what we accomplished this week! Thank you

title: We appreciate you!
message: Cam and Jamie -  I have to give you both a huge THANK YOU for always being great partners to the CSM team.  Your constant support is such a great reassurance when we are dealing with a client inquiry or heavy discussion.  Knowing that you both are willing and able to support our clients is the best feeling.... and then seeing you work your magic is the cherry on top.  I know I have reached out a few times in recent weeks and never once felt like I was bothering you or asking for something that would burden you.  Please know your day in/day out support is paramount to our collective success.

title: Flexibility where it counts!
message: Jill,   I wanted to say how appreciative I am for your 1) willingness to adapt and apply a resource to the Calibrate event, despite the wonky talent assignment history on that project 2) honesty and transparency in the discussion. While the resource is a real win, I also can't tell you how helpful your candor is.   Discussions like that take me leaps/bounds ahead of where I was in terms of really "getting how it works here".   Keep being you. If we could all be so clear/honest, I think this whole place would run far more effectively.

title: You all are my sunrise!
message: I'm 1000% stealing Cam's summary of the WHCP team and turning it around to thank each of you: You each were the food, sun and water to helping make for a terrific all hands today.  Luke, you pulled together interesting and compelling stats to celebrate the 1 year anniversary of Customer Central, and iterated an idea into a very fun game that spurred interest and interaction across the team. Thank you for being receptive to my suggestions; you were lightening quick and the reveal elements you designed were so fun! Melissa, you took my choppy slides and thoughts with notes and turned it into an immersive and interesting deck, also remaining flexible to all the "one more edits" and "can you add"s that occur all the way to the night before. I am so impressed with your talent. William, thank you for sharing and showcasing Invitation Homes as a successful offline story. As you heard from the team, they are interested in sharing that story forward, using client images if they agree -- that's success! Thanks for paying it forward. Cam...my star of the show...thank you for joining to demonstrate how they can measure the impact of the team's engagements by viewing billings, IPE growth and more. You left them wanting more, and I'm excited that we are bringing this level of business insight and interest. I love that you plugged right into my spring/summer analogy, and was super touched to hear you compliment the team as the "Food, Sun and Water" for our clients.  Thank you Everyone for making the meeting shine, and bringing me such warmth today.

title: Harnessing Good Energy for bp!
message: Thank you to everyone who pitched in on the bp RFI that was just submitted today (1 minute before deadline!). There were a lot of tricky questions, but I venture Kevin Nealon would approve of the way we harnessed in the good energy and blocked out the bad (Harness. Energy. Block. Bad. Feel the flow. Feel it.) Thank you again!

title: Salesforce Superheroes!
message: Overdue (but MIGHTY!) gratitude and congratulations to you Superheroes for the launch of Consulting Engagements in Salesforce! You lent your individual superpowers and collaborated on a difficult task to accomplish an important goal. An example of I=I+D at its best!  Jen, your vision was the start and your prioritization was the successful finish! Thank you for sharing prior learnings and re-centering us when we got mired in making it just right. Your push to "go" was the pivot point that got us live.   Cam, as translator and negotiator, your knowledge of both our team and SF helped us interpret each other‚Äôs language and offered give-and-get perspective. And your "let's just try it" guidance pushed us forward.   Chrissy, our lynchpin. You tweaked an existing approach, scrapped it, tried others, and ended up where we started. Accurate? Haha! I loved the moments when we‚Äôd be stuck and you‚Äôd suddenly push back from the desk with an idea. You could practically see the lightbulb go on! Meanwhile, you dug into a part of the business you hadn‚Äôt really worked with before. Your sheer expertise and being the SF key-holder made you invaluable. But the WAY you worked with us - full of patience and willingness to understand the needs - is what I appreciated most.   Jenn, you did ALL the things: taught yourself SF, cataloged requirements, corralled stakeholders, problem solved, architected iterations of approaches, and maintained urgency. I love working with you on these operational projects and this was our biggest yet! You create the kind of cross-functional partnerships where everyone engages and delivers their best. I mean this from my very grateful soul - this wouldn't have happened without you. Thanks to you, we've made game-changing strides in tracking, reporting, and understanding how WHCP most impacts the business. Such a major achievement to be proud of!

title: Quality & Precision
message: Dear Janet, Robyn, and Sheri,  Thank you for your support on the Biogen renewal RFP the past few weeks. With multiple proposals going on simultaneously, benefiting from your account expertise in completing the RFP questionnaire and leadership on the pricing front was invaluable in terms of putting our best foot forward.  Thanks again! James

title: Accenture Executive Dashboard
message: Team, I wanted to express my heartfelt appreciation for each and every one of you who contributed to the successful development and delivery of Accenture‚Äôs monthly executive dashboard. The collective effort and dedication you put into this project truly paid off, and I am extremely proud of what we have accomplished together. The impact of the executive dashboard cannot be overstated. Providing key details on the health and performance of the Recognize program is invaluable in driving informed decision-making and enhancing their overall strategy effectiveness. The insights and visualizations we have crafted are shared broadly across Accenture and allow leaders to grasp the narrative of recognition effortlessly, empowering them to take actions that make a meaningful difference. Melissa thank you for your exceptional contributions throughout the creation and design process. You have an unwavering commitment to excellence which is evident in your handling of the visual design and formatting, as well as your commitment to refining the dashboard through numerous iterations. Thank you for your creative thinking and patient collaboration. Ray, Noah, Will, Dylan, Jack, Greg, and Phil, thank you for extracting and compiling the data and metrics that form the foundation of the dashboard. Your meticulous attention to detail and analytical expertise ensured that the information presented was accurate, reliable, and meaningful. Cam, Liz, and Danielle thank you for your invaluable contributions to the strategic aspects of this project. Your insights and collaboration were crucial in ensuring that the dashboard remained relevant to Accenture‚Äôs needs and effectively captured the essence of its recognition program. Steve, thank you for effectively managing the execution of this project. Your leadership and coordination skills are instrumental in keeping everything on track and ensuring a seamless monthly delivery. Thank you all once again for your contributions.

title: You are the Workhuman Renaissance!
message: Cam,  Thank you for being so supportive, proactive, and diligent once again for everything these last 2 months - from closing an incredible quarter, delivering so many process enhancements, and helping to structure another impressive board update!  I know you've been working many long nights over weeks just to get things lined up for our QBRs, SELT, Board and then all the weekly updates and efforts we are pushing across the organization.  When I floated the idea of a new way of visualizing the renewals forecast for the board meeting you were already taking over, ticking and tying numbers and making sure things were right.   I know that I've asked you to do a lot in a short period of time, and always you step up and deliver, and I want you to know how much I appreciate all that you've taken on this year.  I know we still have a long path ahead, but please take a deep breath, look around and take stock in all that you have enabled for this organization.  Multiple board members approached me last week to say thank you for the accomplishments in Q1, I let them know that none of it would have happened if it weren't for you, your leadership and your team's commitment day in and day out that really paved the way for so many things to actually come to life in the organization -- and that's on top of your day job.  I'm so grateful you're fighting on our side!

title: When A Plan Beautifully Comes Together!
message: I am in complete awe of how quickly you jumped in to strategize and execute our plan to support TFS! Our swift and compassionate response not only exemplified our values at Workhuman, but will truly make an impact on a client who is navigating through rough seas. I can't thank you enough for jumping in to assist, for your ideas and for your commitment to ensuring we kept what was most important as the nucleus of our message - SUPPORT! Although we faced a few challenges in bringing this video to fruition, you did not give up and I am sincerely grateful for the role you played in bringing this masterpiece to life!

title: Amazing work to Support our largest Customers!
message: Wow, what a fantastic couple of days together!  SCDs, you showed up with dedication and fortitude to continue moving the ball forward at our largest customers.  There was a ton of creative thinking, partnering to support one another and focus on growth that we need to deliver, despite the challenges that are there in some instances.  The passion for striving to excellence is so apparent in your mindset at the work each of you are doing daily.  For those of you who joined us who are working alongside us to make the impossible possible, thank you!  Your partnership and determination to help deliver on the goals we all set together is beyond appreciated.  Each of you showed up, ready to listen, bring ideas to help support and grow our customers from each of your organizations.  The work we do together is so inspiring, and I can‚Äôt wait to see our hard work move the needle and celebrate together in our wins.  Cheers and thanks to each of you!

title: Riter - On Time
message: Cannot say enough about how meaningful, respectful, and efficient or QBRs went with your leadership and time management. Was really a factor in making this one of the most productive and effective meetings we've had (IMO). Thank you.

title: Bloody brilliant teamwork
message: Hats off to this team for your persistence, thoughtfulness, and coordination to secure Nathalie Mackin from bp to join us as a speaker at Workhuman Live Forum in London!  It all began with Marie and Jose in offering up Nathalie! Thank you for your dedication to making bp successful with their program and creating such a strong relationship with Nathalie and the rest of the bp team so opportunities like this can happen in the first place. You both also raised the flag when we heard feedback about needing to streamline the speaker agreement in order to make this amenable to the bp team. On top of that, there's a completely new (read: more stringent) process to get speaking engagements approved by bp! Nathalie even said herself she wasn't sure if we could make it happen based on the circumstances! I also appreciate you keeping the momentum going while I was out on PTO - you have been invested in getting this speaking opportunity to happen since day 1.  Emily - thank you for hearing us out completely and taking quick action on revising the contract so that this could be a win-win for both us and the bp team!  Hillary - thank you for your guidance, explaining the legal language in "plain English," taking an early call with me to run through it all to finalize the agreement on our side, and for helping us push this over the line to send an executed speaker agreement for counter-signature!   Amy and Kathryn - you do whatever it takes to make things possible and you make it FUN. I appreciate your determination, energy, flexibility, and passion. I'm inspired by working with the both of you. You make me want to be better and do more  Thank you ALL for your incredible team effort here! So fortunate I get to work with this group of varsity players.

title: Meetings, meetings, and more meetings!
message: Team, thank you for all the hard work on our WHLive meeting tracking & reporting. Onsite meetings at WHLive was a huge new goal ‚Äì and we realized we did not have a way to differentiate event meetings from other meetings happening. From defining and building a whole new process, to creating custom reports in salesforce and quicksight, and ensuring the data mapping was all working ‚Äì this team came together and delivered! Your attention to detail and commitment to data integrity has been incredibly valuable.  We are able to see over 350 meetings in our reporting ‚Äì 118% goal attainment! Thanks to your efforts and reporting, we better understand our performance, have a model for future events, and can now focus on ways to optimize our processes. I wanted to take this opportunity to thank you for all that you do and your continued partnership.

title: That's a Wrap. (A San Diego Wrap Report that is..)
message: Thank you to an outstanding group of individuals who powered through and provided all the detail necessary to complete the Workhuman Live Post Event report - on time!!!  The event was amazing ... but just when you thought your job was done, we tasked you each to provide all the data for the post-event report analysis.  Thanks to everyone for the additional time and effort to close the loop on our flagship event for 2023.

title: Leadership in crunch time!
message: Just a quick note to thank you all for your help, guidance, and leadership during all phases of Workhuman Live. Your direction enabled my team and I to manage the event registration, on-site services, mobile app, and digital activations with clear goals, responsibilities, and a path to success. WHL is no small undertaking and you made sure we were all rowing in the same direction.

title: It's time for the Daily!
message: Amy, thank you for partnering with me on our daily reporting at Live.  We had a lot of happenings to capture each day, and you quickly whipped up a template, tagged stakeholders, and ensured the daily delivery. With so much happening every day in real-time, reporting can often fall to the side.  But you ensured it was a priority and helped tell the story, and ensure all were informed.  I so appreciate your help and commitment to the events.

title: Wow Work for WHLive 2023!
message: Where to even start with the awesomeness this team brought to WHLive 2023!  You all inspired our largest customers to show up to WH Live in San Diego from across the globe (not just in the US, but from Europe and Asia).  Not only did they show up and advocate without question, but you also got them to speak, bring their teams and champion change at their organizations. I was beyond proud to see each of you hosting your customers with enthusiasm and spirit, helping them to understand the impact they can bring to their companies, laughing and building champions of Workhuman.  You played an integral part in creating the experience for them at Workhuman live.  I was pleased to see the partnership in helping to create experiences for those customers where colleagues couldn't be present.  I loved getting to hear first-hand from our largest customers about the partnerships you all have held for years in some cases and just a few months in other cases and how much it means to them as individuals and their organizations.  You all inspire me every day and the impact you're delivering to our customers makes all the difference.  Massive congratulations to all of you on a very successful WHLive 2023!

title: Thank you
message: I just wanted to say many thanks for all your time and help with the recent review of the Customer Request Management process. Despite being a very busy period you made time to meet and go through the end-to-end process, provided input and valuable feedback and quickly responded to any follow up queries / requests that I had ‚Äì thanks again, it‚Äôs very much appreciated!

title: Behind every great speaker...
message: ...is an amazing announcer! To this group of amazing WHL breakout speaker announcers - a HUGE "THANK YOU" SHOUT OUT!  You were the hype-makers, the time-keepers, the "stay calm & keep calm" crowd controllers, and of course made our speakers shine! I personally want to thank you for being a vital part of the success of our breakout sessions this year. You not only showed up but you SHOWED UP! The rapport you each immediately built with each of your speakers was evident, and you reflected the energy in the rooms. I so appreciate your willingness and partnership in making sure everything ran smoothly. Kudos to all of you!

title: Workhuman Live ‚Äì thank you for working the event!
message: I wanted to take a moment to express my heartfelt gratitude and appreciation for the incredible work that you all did in the planning and execution of WorkhumanLive San Diego.  Your efforts created an unforgettable experience for over 1,500 attendees and reconfirmed our event as the world's leading HR conference.  Your commitment to excellence in planning and execution throughout the event truly helped to strengthen our relationships with customers, partners, prospects, and the entire HR community.  From the quality of the keynote speakers and the thought-provoking sessions to all of the momentum and energy around sales and customer meetings, to each and every shift you each worked of demos, badge scanning, troubleshooting questions for attendees, and more you all played a pivotal role in ensuring our attendees had a positive experience, which has and will translate into increased brand loyalty, new pipeline creation, and customer retention. Thank you all for making this event such a success!

Thank you all for making this event such a success!

title: You Crushed it!
message: To this incredible group of humans who made the WHL breakout sessions run flawlessly.... THANK YOU from the bottom of my soul. Many of you lived through the "challenges" we experienced last year, and for those who didn't you heard about it, so you new the nerves were running high. Clearly working technology is always a huge help, but that's just the ticket for entry.  It's all of you who kept the flow of attendees happy, directing them to the right spots, giving them a smile and a feeling that you were there just for them. Honestly...Walmart has nothing on this team! I'm so incredibly grateful for all of your support, even when you weren't scheduled so many of you jumped in to help as needed.  Simply the best!!!

title: Super stakeholders
message: Steve, both Conors, Tara, Kevin and Martin.   Thank you all for being such super stakeholders to work with over the past decade. Your help has been invaluable explaining accounting policies and helping mapping them into algorithms and processes that the FinDev team can implement. You've frequently engaged with me in straw-man discussions to explore layers of requirements and evaluate different approaches - while kept room for fun.  It has been a great pleasure to work with you for the past decade - and I'll miss the tech challenges in my retirement. I wish you all every success in building a B‚Ç¨10 company, with smoothly automated financial processes leading to an easy life!

title: Deep Dive into Salesforce
message: Thank you for coming to our team call today to navigate a private group dive into what's possible for our group in SF. We appreciate the level of preparation you've already put in as well as the opportunity to weigh in and ask questions before it rolls out. As a team, we're committed to "COLLECT the dots so we can CONNECT the dots" and the new structure will be helpful in bringing that to life. And Tiffany, thanks for bringing a set of ears focused specifically on ensuring there will be strong enablement to accompany the new process. Looking forward!

title: WorkhumanLive!
message: Dear Jill, congratulations on another incredible WorkhumanLive San Diego. Your extraordinary leadership and unwavering commitment to improving the event experience year-over-year has truly paid off, and this year's event was nothing short of exceptional. From the new main stage set up and customer celebrations to local entertainment and waffle Wednesdays - your willingness to never settle for the status quo and your talent to execute "never done before" ideas is your superpower. Your ability to build trust and strong relationships with your team and senior executives is a testament to your hard work, dedication, and scrutiny of everything that touches this event. It's clear that your team has a deep respect for you and your leadership style, and that trust is evident in the quality of the event you've created - the fact that is truly unique to the geography each year is also a testament to the creative process and partners you've brought together.  You've pushed the boundaries of what's possible with this event, and the result has been a truly remarkable experience for all who attended and the business. I'm so proud of you and all you've accomplished this year. This success is a reflection of your talent, your hard work, and your unwavering commitment to excellence. Congratulations on a job well done, and here's to even more success in the future. London and Austin here we come!

title: Breakout support success!
message: Jill, first I want to express my gratitude for your work in masterminding yet another thoughtful and successful WHL.   Second, your understanding of the Speaker team's needs, and your willingness to involve us in the selection of our breakout support many months ago, have truly made all the difference.  As Maya and I continue to find our groove, we sometimes face situations where we don't know what we don't know. In those moments, having a vendor like Media Loft, who exudes a sense of cool, calm, and collectedness, has been an absolute game-changer. Jenna, Tara, and the entire Media Loft crew quickly became our people.  It was your early consideration of our needs that allowed us the space to both learn and continue to build out a process that works. For that, I cannot thank you enough.

title: It takes a village!
message: Thank you, to each and every one of you for your unwavering support of the Speaker team. Throughout WHL, you were always on standby, ready to jump into action no matter how big or small.  From the early morning tech checks (which grew unexpectedly on Tuesday due to the previous day's travel delays) to the meet-and-greet sessions, printing all the things and author book-signing escorting - you were there for us.   I know that it can be nerve-wracking to be asked to take on new tasks on short notice, but you rose to the challenge. It's because of your willingness to go above and beyond that we were able to navigate it all with such ease.  Thank you! Your contributions have made a difference, and I feel incredibly fortunate to have such a fantastic team by my side.

title: Workhuman Live - One for the record books
message: A very special note of respect and appreciation for your combined teamwork and leadership.  Workhuman Live is a herculean effort - one that takes the hard work of many, many humans.  We are all lucky to have you both as our leaders in that endeavor.  I am thankful every day that I'm on a team with you both managing all the things.  Thanks for all you do.

title: You made me look good!
message: Thank you Kathryn and Amy for all the support and guidance leading up to my two sessions this week.  You both jumping in last minute on the Accenture session and taking the reigns to direct into a productive, relevant session was so helpful.  And then Amy your targeted suggestions on how to dig deeper with Mike at Cisco really helped to great an engaging interactive session, and we got great feedback.   Just wanted to let you know how much I appreciate it - you might think this is just your job, but I can tell you not all companies get this level of support.  It really made a difference and took a lot of stress out of the pre!

title: 2022 Audit
message: A huge thank you to everybody for all the hard work associated with the 2022 EY financial audit. This is one of the key deliverables of the finance team and after a long couple of months, we are finally seeing coming towards a conclusion. This year saw a number of other competing projects ‚Äì Corporation tax audit, testing for the upcoming Epicor upgrade, the unplanned work associated with banking operations to name a few‚Ä¶..but even with these competing priorities, you all demonstrated great focus and tenacity to ensure audit tasks were closed out as efficiently and timely as possible. There was a significant amount of information requested from listings to reconciliations to sample selections and then queries and more requests! While this seemed never ending at times, you all continued to deliver. It is great achievement to be at this stage of the audit and we can now start to put it behind us. Great work and well done all!

title: Jumping in, doing great things
message: Thank you both for representing on the CHRO panel call this morning - there is a lot happening and I was double booked. You stepped up in a big way....Maya, you killed it, taking the lead at a moment's notice! Our panelists felt supported and they have action items to move forward and a plan for a successful session. This will be a great breakout in SD, thanks to you.

title: Go Live Comms - Concur Travel
message: Clare, Amy - a special thank you for your support in helping us to adapt and re-align our communications approach over the last few weeks. We would not have got to where we did without your valuable input and contribution! Thank you so much again!

title: End Of Qtr. Ops & Finance Collaborators!
message: All, thank you for your time, inputs, and support on the regular end of quarter meetings as Q1‚Äô 23 came to a very successful close. Q1 2023 proved to be yet another record-breaking quarter for the business! With billings increasing by $20M +, and redemptions increasing by $15M + Year over Year for Quarter 1. The regular end of quarter meetings provides an excellent platform for the teams to communicate how the business is preforming vs forecast, highlight any potential risks and enable continued communication and collaboration across the teams ensuring that we are all aligned in our common goal - successfully delivering an exceptional employee experience globally, while also meeting the business goals and successfully hitting our many KPI's targets. As we are all well aware this type of success does not happen by itself or when teams are working in isolation, it really does take a village to continue to successfully deliver at this scale. Thanks again for your support and collaboration, Enjoy!

title: There is no *I* in "Events" nor in "Spreadsheets"
message: Wow!  So while onboarding a new Travel Management Company - which meant all travel for (A REALLY HIGH NUMBER) staff for Workhuman Live had to be booked offline - through multiple spreadsheets and cross checking information - through *many* changes (the Workhuman way!), this team did it.  You are each the consummate professional. One of the best parts of being at Workhuman is being surrounded by talent who not only make you better at what you do, but also lift you up when needed. You exemplify collaboration and teamwork with no ego getting in the way. Thank you for making me an honorary part of this team. I have a newfound appreciation and respect for the effort that goes into making WHL a seamless experience for staff attending.

title: Employee Appreciation Day Task Force
message: The numbers speak for themselves! Thank you to each and every member of the Employee Appreciation Day weekly customer task force! From precise planning leading up to March 3‚Ä¶to troubleshooting setbacks and planning for future success‚Ä¶.the partnership surrounding this campaign was incredible! The contributions of every individual were invaluable and many of you came to the table during our debrief to offer compelling suggestions to enhance our holiday campaigns going forward. We walked away with new ideas to improve internal & external communication, recommendations that will help us uncover deeper billings & redemption insights, and suggestions to ensure these celebrations continue to result in a great experience for our customers. Looking forward to applying these learnings and knocking the upcoming national & global celebrations out of the park!  World Gratitude Day---here we come! THANK YOU all!

title: Dream Team!
message: Talk about the dream team right here! All i can say is what a team effort with the recent Biogen risk. What started at the beginning of the week as a challenge we were faced with and a customer wanting to cut back, turned into a major positive where they have now agreed to move forward with converting what was $3.3M last year in cash awards, to now non-cash awards!! All in the matter of hours at that! While Biogen is reducing the value of those large value cash awards, it is still a massive win to have 77% of what was invested last year in cash awards to now be non-cash, especially during a time when Biogen was looking to cut back in non-cash initially! This team came together to talk about the challenge we were faced with, review data quickly to make an informative and clear decision on a strategy, get a call scheduled in less than 24 hours and deliver a pitch that resulted in an email from the customer less than an hour later asking us to move these cash awards to non-cash. This was a prime example of what great looks like, and i am so fortunate to be able to work alongside each of you to make this happen! Amazing job team!!!

title: Game changer, Sheri for the WIN!!!
message: Sheri!! Sheri!! You should write a Whitepaper on "Leading companies through change by keeping the humans at the center." It's game changer,  Sheri you need at the helm. You masterfully put together a strategy and plan to illustrate to GE how critical social recognition is during times of change, backed by their own data, how imperative it is not to have disruption in the program, and how to seamlessly transition the Impact Awards program into their critical talent and programs during changing times as GE spun into 3 independent businesses. Check, check, and check! Fast forward, you continue to lead all of the GE businesses through the strategy with the first one being, GE HealthCare! How? You lived their tagline every day be extraordinary, be curious, be bold! Now that GE HealthCare isn't tethered to a universal GE program, you are showing Ruth Nash, Kristin Hart, and Tatsuki Matsuyama all that's possible with the platform. The demo this week was SPOT ON! Getting them to imagine everything from a new program name to signal a change, to a new look/feel, experience, new features, making recognition easier, simpler, less steps and meaningful - the full power of the WH Cloud in action! It was thrilling seeing their eyes light up, the high level of engagement, questions and holding the attention for the full hour. That's hard to do with a group like GE HealthCare but not with you at the helm. Super impressive work! And what's more? This strategy is being played back to you as GE HealthCare is in the final stages of signing a renewal agreement in the next 60 days with a $10M annual investment that's going to be so much more in the months and years to come as they freely make decisions around program design, investment and high wattage of program communications. Talk about injecting a level of heartbeat into an organization! Super proud of you, Sheri! The dedication and passion is paying off! YOU ROCK!!

title: Support
message: I just wanted to call out the stellar support you have all provided and continue to provide while we navigate through the new process of making payments. We have had quick turnarounds, templates, and payments created on the fly, all of which you've given urgency to do and, in turn, have enabled us to get payments out as quickly as possible. Your support and advice during this time are so appreciated. Thank you!

title: WHL
message: Tackling the WHL lists has been no easy task. the excel docs upon excel docs. There's no one id rather sit on a friday zoom and go line by line with to make sure we don't miss anything.  this team has handled every hurdle with constant communication and one goal- get it done correctly and produce a quality event!!

title: Events budgets
message: Jill, want to say thank you for all your time in jumping on calls and replying to emails so quickly and going over the past and future events budgets/spends and also sending in unpaid invoices and all the split and details required in order to have accurate accruals booked on my side. This is a great help to Finance team, highly appreciated.

title: Cheers to you both!
message: Tiffanie and Amy - thank you both for extending the invitations to the secret happy hour out to your guests at Workhuman Live! We really appreciate all the support and feedback we have gotten from both of you, including your amazing jingle Tiffanie! From brainstorming ways to keep the event lively to combining all of our powers and information, we are lucky to work with great people like yourselves! We are super excited for this event and cannot wait to have a provision (or two) with both of you!

title: Project Visibility Progress
message: "Visibility Matters in the Workplace." I see each of you embracing our annual narrative and threading it through your programs. I see you finding ways to incorporate the soon to be final video assets into your plans. I see you being open to different points of view on how and when we leverage the full body of quote, unquote "brand assets" in ways we haven't tried before. And I appreciate each of you. Together, we will guide prospects, customers and existing/future employees through the Workhuman journey while helping achieve shared business results. I value the role you're playing in Project Visibility and I'm excited to see this team's great ideas come to life! THANK YOU!

title: Making time
message: Thanks for making time on this sunny Friday for an unplanned presentation to leadership. With so much going on (as is 'the way it is' this close to WHL) I appreciate you finding time in your day on top of all the deadlines. Cheers!

title: Organizing Organon
message: Well done on an amazing meeting with Organon this week. Their laundry list of feature requests were no match to the knowledge, enthusiasm, and creativity of this team. Sheri, you did a marvelous job setting strong boundaries with them around the custom development we would (and wouldn't) discuss. Sherry, the solution you presented with the new flow showed empathy for their problem and and helped ground everyone with a solid understanding of our solution. Justin, despite just recently taking over reporting, you handled their reporting questions gracefully. Nuvs, you jumped in right in time with your deep understanding of the intricacies of the product.   Great job, team, on a great presentation! Cheers for a new (step forward with) Organon!

title: You rang?
message: Jill, thanks for the quick call on your commute home, to discuss an extra thought... and then some other extra thoughts...üòÖ Video planning for WHL takes a lot of problem solving and collab. Feels great to be able to partner with you, talk through ideas on the fly, and keep going. Glad you rang, my friend.

title: Kicking off 2023 Right
message: Over the past month(s), all of you have been working diligently to build bold strategies to ensure we are best aligned to support our customers and have a solid plan for growth and increased investment.  This incredible group of humans showed up with brilliant ideas, a collaborative spirit and a passion that will no doubt bring success to Workhuman and our customers in 2023 and beyond.  It was two days‚Äô worth of engaging dialog and commitment to find ways to move the needle, despite challenges and roadblocks that may be in our way.  We have solid plans to create even stronger relationships with Executives across our largest customers.  Next, a new renewals process to make our them even more impactful, engaging and successful. You also established a renewed sense of how to up level our Account Strategies to ensure we are always out front leading and bringing a proactive approach.  Our partnerships and alignment with our partners across WH are stronger than ever and I thank you all for leaning in as we are better together.  Cheers to each of you - a big thank you for bringing your best as it was so evident!

title: Awesome Leaders
message: As we wrap up Employee Appreciation Day, I wanted to take a minute to thank this awesome team of leaders for your support.  While today‚Äôs events were a great an example of how you all come together to work around and through issues for our customers.  And you do this every day. You bring yourselves fully to ensure we are there for our customers and you all lead your teams with strength, professionalism, and humanity.  I appreciate you all every day and am honored to work with you.  Thanks.

title: Not just today...
message: In the last 6 months, I've been so honored to have the opportunity to work with each and everyone of you and want you to know how much I appreciate your whole selves.  Getting to know you on a more personal level, having the opportunity to see how you each operate in both the best and worst of days, and watching you each helping to build this operation up in new ways gives me so much confidence.   Jen, your energy to ensure our customers and employees are getting the best possible experience in all the engagements and particularly this year at Activate, is so inspiring!  Dave, thank you for leading on so many fronts, and always stepping into those difficult customer situations and taking the hits - I hope things will settle down and you can focus on your day job more!  Leslie, thank you for inspiring your team to think big and ensure we're developing the best possible motion to drive growth.  Corbrina, thank you for trusting me and stepping into a big role - your efforts with Accenture are already making a big difference.   Alice, thank you for your tireless pursuits in creating the best darn customer experience at Workhuman Live and every day here. Lisa, thank you for stepping into a new uncharted area and bringing innovation into the team for repeatable success!  Cam, your heroic efforts to bring organization and structure to the chaos fills me with so much confidence!  And, Derek I am honored to have the opportunity to pick your brain to understand more about this industry - you give your time freely, and I learn so much each time we chat.  This team has made my first 5 months as a Workhuman human so fulfilling, and I can't thank you enough - I'm so glad you're all in my boat!

title: Celebrating you all on Employee Appreciation Day!
message: I wanted to share with all of you how incredibly appreciative I am for all the work each of you do to support our largest customers here at Workhuman!  Leading the worlds biggest organizations to inspire and illuminate the good in their cultures is a massive responsibility and you all make it look effortless.  The varied strategies, passions and approaches you bring to the work you do is remarkable and so evident in the partnerships that you garner.  Thank you for your commitment to Workhuman and bringing the very best to our customers.  I hope that as we continue through 2023, you feel how valuable you are to me and the organization.  Cheers to each of you!

title: Operational Rigor!
message: Thank you Cam for coming to my leadership meeting to show the team six exciting areas that have been enhanced, developed or debuted that provide us with insights about customer health, trends, areas to capitalize in the customer lifecycle, or help us look around corners. We covered how to look at where a client is segmented, how risks are being shared in line with our No Surprises principle, understanding Renewals, what does red status mean, Engagement tracking, and Billings. Comments from the team were "game changing" "we've grown up!" "will make this so much easier" "welcome the insight"...everyone was riveted, and I look forward to having you come back for deeper dives in all areas as the team gets familiar and comfortable. It's very exciting to see the progress made thanks to your leadership. Thanks Cam for taking the time to dive into this with the team today, we greatly appreciate it!

title: Putting Work(human) in the Spotlight
message: Team, congratulations on another really successful Spotlight.  Thank you for your due diligence from scripting and developing the theme, integrating its production alongside Activate 2023, sourcing the speakers, building out the intro and outro's and Q&A for the panelists, facilitating the questions for "Human's on the street" and for capturing critical and timely workplace perspectives. As a team, we achieved 95% of the goals we set up with remaining goals (meetings) to be smashed over the next 30 days. Overall, you created an amazing experience for the 5000 prospects/customers and optimized the investment. Thank you!

title: Always my anchor
message: Just a big thank you for always knowing when to check in and reminding me that this chaos we're experiencing is normal! It's the right time. We do this every year. This is the time that we freak out and second guess and the event feels like a big ball of crazy ‚Äì but then, you give us all a gut check. This is when it all comes together, the pieces land and we glide into another amazing Workhuman Live. As someone who doesn't come from events ‚Äì even after 8 years of doing it here ‚Äì the rollercoaster parts still surprise me, but I always look to you and I only worry if you're worried! You remind me that this is fun, not to lean into the madness, but to ride the excitement. My favorite summary of the creative process (pictured) says it best. We're going to make it. It's going to be awesome. I could never do any of this without you.

title: Champion for Customer Marketing

title: A busy few weeks!
message: Amy, I wanted to take a moment to pause and thank you for all you've done to welcome my team to yours. You've given us a lot of time, actively learning about what we do, who we work with, and why. There's a lot of opportunity for the team as we think about our ways of working and I think these changes are going to lead to great results for us and our employees. The shifts of focusing on the corporate strategy and being business partners are going to elevate the team. There are new opportunities for individuals and exciting topics to dig into. Thank you for being so open during all of our discussions, for truly listening as we make our way through the planning process. Change can be hard, but I'm thankful to have you as a partner through this and know I can share my thoughts with you and be fully heard.

title: You Created Magic Out of a lot of Virtual Paper!
message: Thank you to all of you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to participate in our CE Engagement Workshop today.  Your enthusiasm and sharing created the space for laughter and creativity, and allowed for a ton of innovative ideas to start flowing!  Thank you to Cam for the extra effort in helping to structure the day, creating the Miro board that helped to organize our thoughts - I know that took a lot of effort to get going, and particularly grateful to your help given everything else you have going on.  Colby, thank you for the last minute organizational things to get our breakouts moving!  I am confident that the output from today's session will help to create structure and focus for the engagements as we move forward.  I loved hearing about all the Special object stories - love getting to know each of you a little bit more.  Look forward to seeing the product of today's energy shape shift into value added customer engagements!

title: Thanks for the lightning speed!
message: Thank you Cam & Leslie for jumping in on a very urgent request coming out of the board meeting to deliver a new cut of renewal forecast in a short period of time.  I appreciate the multiple iterations you went through and continued sense of urgency.  I am not a fan of firedrills as I know its stressful and distracts from the day job.  I appreciate the effort you led with the rest of the group to get to a level of detail that satisfies the needs of our executives & board.  I look forward to partnering with you on the future state process so we can establish a well oiled process that will will ease the burden of repetitive manual updates for you and the rest of the team.

For 4months there have been many meetings, internal & external, discussions on approaches with the best intent and focus on the completed renewal! It is great to have this document signed and continue the partnership with this customer.   Bryan thank you for your continued partnership with this customer, while this work was going on in the background, you had regular meetings to support and enhance WOW and didn't let this distract from the day to day, not an easy position.   Well done and thank you, it's wonderful that this work is now complete, thank you for the teamwork!

title: üëâ Thank you for telling our story! üìöüí¨üåè
message: Amy, Jenna and Kathryn, I struggled with where to begin this Spark Award but only because I felt strongly about choosing the value which could somehow scratch the surface in reflecting the magnitude of impact you and your team achieve through your passion for our organization‚Äôs iconic brand.  As communication leaders, your storytelling not only drives business results innumerable ways but most importantly your human reach is extensive. Thank you for telling our story!   Thank you for making the world a better place!  My warmest gratitude, Donna

title: Leading with Purpose! Activate 2023
message: Jill, this picture tells a story of the trials and tribulations of planning and executing Activate 2023.   You were exceptional and outstanding in planning and executing Activate 2023.  Your exceptional attention to detail, creativity, and organizational skills were truly remarkable and made the event a resounding success. Your hard work, dedication, and unwavering commitment to excellence were evident in every aspect of the event, from the venue to the seamless flow of activities, to the delightful food and drinks, to Memoir, and walk-on music and everything in between. Every participant was thoroughly impressed and it's awesome to see social blowing up!  You truly went above and beyond to make this event memorable. You have set a new standard of excellence and have made a lasting impact on all of us. Thank you for your contributions and for making this event a huge success. We are proud to have you on our team and look forward to many more outstanding events under your leadership.

title: On site and on point.
message: Not everyone gets to see the behind-the-scenes sorcery that is an event coming together: hotel rooms, badges, travel arrangements, show flows, and bears, oh my! The company is a lot bigger and it's been a while since we've had a real-live in-person kick off. I know that there are other recognitions flying in for the shiny outcome ‚Äì¬†and it was a FABULOUS shiny event. But this award is for HOW it got made. This award is for the days leading up and the hours breaking it down. The unshiny work of collaborating with all the teams that get activated (see what I did there??) to put this together. This team is top-notch when it comes to respect and caring, for each other, for the travel weary colleagues flying in from all over, for our onsite agency partners, for the hotel staff and servers, for the teams back in the office dialing in. The 6am call times,  the late night shift from breakouts to tattoos, and the post-event clean up while everyone else was wheeling out their luggage. You never let your exhaustion diminished your service, your care, or your respect ‚Äì and it is worth calling out on it's own! Thank you!!!!

title: Activate execution at its finest
message: Team, you did it, it was incredible, and I‚Äôm proud to say we‚Äôre back!  We concluded Activate 2023 ‚Äì bringing back an in person sales and customer kickoff after 3 years of hiatus.  I know you all went through months of preparation and planning, dotting ‚ÄúI‚Äô crossing ‚ÄúT‚Äôs‚Äù, creating virtual, in-office, and in-person experiences, filming and facilitating Differentiator workshops, and more. You executed flawlessly, dealt with challenges without hesitation and ensured all our humans were informed with comprehensive communications throughout the event and fun well-thought-out games that allowed for maximum retention of our strengths. You created in-office experiences, provided an environment for everyone to thrive and engage, and you all put your best selves forward.  Thank you for always upping your game and never settling for the status quo. You did it and did it exceptionally well.  Thank you!

title: leading the way
message: thank you for leading the way, steering the ship, trusting your team, and all the things that you do that wouldn't fit into one award box.

title: Landing the Big One!
message: Zoe, Leslie, Sheri, Steve and Chris, just an overdue award to recognize the amazing achievement of landing the Merck renewal! This one took a huge effort from many people, over an extended period of time. Of course, you would expect nothing less for the company's largest customer! It was a long, arduous road! Zoe, it must have been a baptism of fire for you to help shepherd this process at the final furlong! Sheri and Leslie, you continued to keep up the drumbeat and kept everyone internally on their toes to ensure we delivered a proposal that was acceptable. Chris and Steve, this was a tough negotiation and you found a way through it, protecting the company and in the process landing an extended - 5 year - deal! It took creativity and lateral thinking. Thank you all for this extraordinary achievement, together, you landed hundreds of millions of dollars of business for the company for the next half decade!

title: Activate Leadership
message: Jill - as we close in on Activate I want to thank you for your leadership on this event. The Events team inherited this one partially cooked and you embraced it like you always do. You 'activated' the team and absorbed/managed all the changes in scope at every step. Never accepting mediocre, you drive us to do better on every thing, every day. True mentor and leader. Cheers to you!

title: Better Together!
message: Jill, as I head to San Diego on a site visit and look ahead to April, I also look back at the past year and cannot thank you enough for your partnership.   The past year was one to remember for sure, from leadership changes, role changes, the return of in-person ‚Äì and all the uncertainty that came with it.  At every turn, every decision to be considered, you are there with me in the fight. You bring a clear and thoughtful approach, with impressive foresight, to help ensure we head on the right path.  Thank you for all the collaboration, occasional bitch sessions, and true partnership in driving the amazing results our events do.  We‚Äôre better together!

title: Continued guidance and support
message: Amy-  I don't say this enough, but thank you for all of your support and guidance during my time here so far. It truly is a blessing to have someone like yourself in my corner to help me navigate Workhuman waters. I've learned a tremendous amount from working here and by working with you. You're a fantastic leader, and our team (and company) are very fortunate to have you.  Reid

title: Fixed!
message: Ladies thank you again for leaning in to support last week and for making it such a quick fix. Really appreciate your partnership!

title: List City
message: A BIG thank you for all the help with our renewals campaign and ensuring our list is as clean as can be. It always makes things so much easier when we can jump on a call to talk it through. Jamie, I know how much time you put into manually updating the list and I am so grateful for that. Cam, you have been so communicative throughout this process and helped us find a solution that works best. title: End of Year Meetings Ops & Finance Collaborators!
message: All, thank you for your time, inputs and support on the regular end of year meetings as 2022 came to a very successful close. Q4 2022 proved to be yet another record breaking quarter for the business! The regular end of quarter/year meetings provide an excellent platform for the teams to communicate how the business is preforming vs forecast, highlight any potential risks and enable continued communication and collaboration across the teams ensuring that we are all aligned in our common goal - successfully delivering an exceptional employee experience globally, while also meeting the business goals and successfully hitting our many KPI's targets. As we are all well aware this type of success does not happen by itself or when teams are working in isolation, It really does take a village to continue to successfully deliver at the scale we now find ourselves at! Thanks again for your support and collaboration, looking forward to working closely together throughout 2023 to see how many more records will be broken!  Enjoy!

title: Merck Renewal Magic
message: Sheri Riter - Where to even start with this incredible achievement!  You started planning for this renewal well over a year ago.  You set your strategy and worked every step, not ever wavering, building all of the details that truly mattered and were so confident in every aspect of this renewal.  There is an immense amount of pressure to manage Workhuman's largest client and to get a 5-year renewal in place is another level and truly remarkable!  Your executive relationships, both at Merck and here at Workhuman made all the difference, from the details that were shared, tackling new program managers, making them advocates and beyond.  It was amazing to be on this journey with you, to see how you lead procurement and knew every tiny detail, prepped to make sure that you were consistently one step ahead and finished incredibly strong.  Your dedication to Merck and this organization are so evident.  I agree with Steve Cromwell, this was the longest negotiation in the history of renewals.  I'm beyond proud of you Sheri and cheers to five more years of amazing partnership with Merck!

title: YOUR EXELLENCE in our Conversations CoE!
message: Thank you to this collective brain trust and powerhouse we affectionately call our Conversations Center of Excellence! I'm SO grateful to all of you who built our solid foundation long before I came to Workhuman, making it my pleasure to pick up the CoE baton. I'm not carrying this baton solo, however, and I appreciate all who've remained in our group, and the new faces who've joined along the way. Thank you for your insight, expertise, energy, desire to drive Conversations forward, our practice to challenge each other and our boundaries, ask great questions, say when something doesn't make sense, and all the amazing dialogue to drive innovation for our Conversations customers. Most of all....this "work stuff" aside....I genuinely enjoy YOU...it makes my heart happy when we all share a laugh, tell a story, or otherwise "be real" with each other in our meetings. Let's keep that spirit going in 2023! THANK YOU for all you contribute, your whole selves...

title: Always keeping things moving
message: Thank you for being on top of everything, helping move it all along (i mean literally everything), working on what is supposed to be a well deserved vacation and just being the best boss! Looking forward to seeing everything come to life in the new year!

title: Process & Controls Finance Milestone!

Starting something new is never easy but you have all been a instrumental in making sure that we're managing risk for WH and in helping us move toward a controls based audit for 2023. Looking forward to continuing the controls journey with you all into next year! Have a wonderful Christmas!!

title: Cash Stars!
message: Hi team,  I just wanted to take a moment to recognize you all for your work on the CashStar order forms. This award, to me, is the definition of Respect for Teamwork. Not only do we have representatives from 3 different teams involved, but everyone played a role in getting this issue solved. I'll admit, as the E-comm rep, I probably did a minimal amount of work. Jason & Lynn, I'm glad that you brought this to my attention.  Conor, thank you for the helpful suggestion. Hillary & Emily, thank you for clarifying everything about why we set this up and for then for creating a new order form. Finally, thank you Jason & Kevin for reviewing. Go, team! title: Marketing, Sales and CS Governance Superstars!
message: Hello Superstars!  I wanted to wholeheartedly thank you for being core members of the leads strategy and salesforce governance forum. The level of dedication and support throughout has been amazing! Week in and week out you attend, bring items for attention, provide crucial inputs, subject matter expertise, collaborate, attend specific workshops all in the interest in delivering solutions and governance for architecturally significant change, integrations, automation, process change. This spans strategic change across the phases of the lead strategy, planned critical system improvement and capability change across the front office stack - but also this group of humans has delivered a high level of transparency with the Marketing, Sales and CS teams highlighting issues/obstacles that also require significant technical solutions, governance and implementation. The data and analytics teams involvement is crucial, helping the team to understand knock on impacts to reporting and analytics ‚Äì maintain the ability for the teams to measure against the strategic goals!  The leaders ‚Äì Celia, Jacqui, Cam, Meghan and Mark have been instrumental in prioritising across strategic and non strategic change so the execution teams have clear priorities. 2023 phase 2 and phase 3 of the leads strategy ‚Äì further automation, integrations across the stack, capability assessment and consolidation of technologies and processes, key data enrichment partner decisions (POC), Salesforce and Marketo DB clean up, retention policies, aligning to regulation, compliance and so much more fun!!!  I cannot wait üòä,  see you there!!  Gill

title: Great Partnership and Teamwork!
message: Sheri, I'm not even sure where to begin, so I'll start by saying thank you for your tremendous partnership over the last couple of months (and all year for that matter).  Between Merck, GE, and Organon, we've had a pretty busy and crazy end of the year and you've been a great partner through it all.  Let's see, for Merck, you coordinated and led their semi-annual account review and made sure all the appropriate parties involved were on point with our messaging to the Executive Sponsor and program team.  Gathered the team to make sure we delivered 2 important 'Moments that Matter' to Merck.  And to cap it off, you've been deep into a renewal where we can finally see light at the end.   For Organon, there's too many items to list, but leading a successful QBR, coordinating countless meetings to discuss their product enhancements, bi-weekly check-ins with their exec sponsors, and another challenging renewal are just a few things going on with them. And let's not forget GE.  You're on top of everything we need as they prepare to spin-off into 3 different companies.  Your quarterly outreach to key stakeholders has brought a lot of energy and engagement into the program which has led to a number of gratitude summits.  I'm sure I left out a bunch of other accomplishments with these customers.  I can't thank you enough for your partnership and I really appreciate all your help and support.  Really looking forward to 2023 as we continue to move these customers forward in their journey.  Thank you!

title: Opportunities!
message: During the year each of you identified opportunities for me which pushed me out of my comfort zone. Thanks for seeing my ability to do these speaking opportunities and supporting me! Very grateful!

title: Support
message: Conor, I would like to thank you for all the support you have given me on the Insurance claim for damage to the 4th floor. You have played such a key role in every aspect to keep things moving forward, although this process has taken a lot longer than we hoped, we are very close to closing out and certainly wouldn‚Äôt be at this stage without your drive and guidance behind it. Thanks again it is very much appreciated!

title: Driving Women & Allie ERG Forward!
message: Sending you all a huge thank you for your invaluable contributions to the Women & Allies ERG this year! It has been a very exciting year, with Workhuman joining the 30% club and publishing data on pay equity and the gender pay gap, a fireside chat with Mary-Ann Sieghart, author of 'The Authority Gap,' in honor of International Women's Day, the continuation of W&A's bi-monthly virtual coffee connection, the development and launch of our "How to be a Good Ally" workshop, a Workhuman fitness challenge, raffle, and fireside chat with representatives from SAFE Ireland, Saoirse, Jane Doe International, and Voices Against Violence to recognize Domestic Violence Awareness Month, charitable donations to Saoirse and Jane Doe International, recruiting efforts focused on greater representation of women that led to a significant increase in women leaders and engineers at Workhuman, Workhuman's sponsorship of GTA Black Women in Tech's 'The Voices in the Shadow' book featuring our own Alma Tarfa (also recipient of Diversity in Tech's Rising Star Award!), among many other milestones and achievements. Looking forward to continuing to move the needle on gender equity with this incredible team in 2023!

title: Thank you!

This completes the Concur project launch - one that will be key for Workhuman to scale well beyond our 1,000+ employee count! Thank you all!!!

title: First Graduating Class of Spark Director+ !

These 40 graduates completed a journey of self reflection, upward feedback, and personalized learning across 7 course offerings: Strategic Planning, Delegation & Empowerment, Emotional Intelligence, Cultivating Resilience, Leading Hybrid Teams, Psychological Safety, and Change Management. Thank you, graduates, for investing time in your own development!
