Be proud of the work you have done to reach this massive milestone - we are!  Cheers, The Chris' (French & Campbell)

title: Thank you for the warm welcome :)
message: Hey team,   I'd like to cap off my 2nd week at Workhuman by thanking you for being great teammates. You've welcomed me into your processes, patiently answered my questions, and earnestly listened to my opinions. I never thought I could be so comfortable while also drinking from a firehose!  I'm grateful to be working with such a bright, friendly, and hard working group, and I look forward to gaining your trust and delivering epic event experiences together.

title: Most energizing meeting I've had in 9 years!
message: Yesterday I met with Jen, Jill, Alice, Meghan and Brian to discuss the WH Certified experience at Work Human Live. And I'm not kidding when I say it was the most energizing, productive and fun meeting I've had in years!  Coming from a research & advisory firm with a very corporate, process-driven culture, let's just say that most internal meetings were heavy on the seriousness and light on the levity. I continue to be inspired and validated in my decision to join Workhuman just 6 weeks ago, and yesterday‚Äôs meeting with you all was a highlight thus far. Excited to collaborate to bring WHC to life in Atlanta!

title: Bring on 2022!
message: What a group of inspirational and determined people all of you are!  In our time together this week at our QBRs, we focused on our vision and commitment to success in 2022.  I was blown away by the commitment and passion each of you demonstrated to continue to drive for the very best experience for our customers.  That in turn means, we will be driving for the very best for Workhuman.  2021 has been a challenging year in so many ways, both personally and professionally for each of you and the grit and fortitude you all demonstrate on a daily basis is unparalleled.  You all have blown your Moonshots out of the water and have continued to drive this business forward against many challenges.  The integrity and spirit of delivering the best experience for our customers, their culture and their employees is what continues to drive our success here as we continue to see more recognition happening at our largest customers.  You all are the lifeblood and I‚Äôm so proud to work alongside each of you.  Cheers!

title: Making it all work
message: I want to recognize the great work you do day in and out. You‚Äôve been critical to making all of the pieces work together for the team and our customers.  From incubating, and now growing, our operational capabilities, to building tracking for team awards and driving Celebrations opportunities, to building a scalable renewals process which is smoothly, you‚Äôve led the way in us scaling for growth.  You‚Äôve also been the go-to person for information for me, for Board slides, for other teams. Many of these requests are last-minute, sometimes only-partially defined and yet partner with requestor (often me!) to refine the ask and get us the right information quickly.  Despite having so many balls in the air, you always seem to bring a sense of calm to the work and ensure it all gets done well.   Thank you for your leadership and work in making the gears of our business turn together to generate success.

title: A long RFP comes to a close
message: Team ‚Äì now that we have an actual signed contract from Sensata, I can officially thank the group that participated in their RFP process.  My intention was to send this recognition moment a longggg time ago.  The whole RFP process started before I was even employed at Workhuman and who knew it would be 1.5 years later before things were official.  Not only did Sensata decide to renew for 3 more years, but they are bringing on a full Service Anniversary program for the first time and they went all in on Life Events/Community Celebrations.  Danielle ‚Äì you are definitely my most overdue recognition ever.   You helped us prep for this RFP, had a presence on our client meetings, but more importantly you‚Äôve been a great leader, coach and friend to me since I started here.  As a remote new hire, I can't tell you how important all of your guidance has been.  I wouldn‚Äôt be where I am today without you.  Cam ‚Äì you have your hand in pretty much everything.  So many of my client presentation talking points are taken directly from you.  Thank you for all your work building the RFP deck, helping sell them on Celebrations, the many pricing conversations we had, and everything you did to get this deal over the finish line.  Dave ‚Äì it goes a long way when we can have our leaders participate on client calls.  Thank you for your presence on our RFP finalist meeting (December 2020!) and showing them that there‚Äôs an entire team at Workhuman invested in their success.  I appreciate you all!

title: A Manager you can rely on!
message: Cam, thank you so much for all of your help during my first month! Your knowledge of the internal business processes has been so helpful and you are so quick  to respond to any questions I have. You've made me feel like a part of the team since day 1, thank you!

title: Analytics Rockstars
message: Team, thanks so much for the quick turnaround on data and thoughtful dialogue around our customer marketing programs! It felt like a great example of how powerful cross-department collaborative efforts can be. So thanks again for all your hard work we really appreciate it!

title: Thankful for You
message: This is the time of year where everyone is rushing toward the 'finish line'--literally pushing themselves and each other toward another year of record breaking performance. It's the crush of renewal season, always a bit stressful and uncertain until the deals are done. Thank you for hanging in there for each other and acting with integrity and professionalism. I'm so thankful to work with each of you! Wishing you a beautiful long weekend with your family and friends. On to December! Gobble Gobble!

title: Thankful to be on your team!
message: A wild year made easier because of your compassion, empathy, and leadership!

title: Events is sometimes like
message: a Charlie Brown Thanksgiving. Popcorn, toast, and jellybeans. Who needs turkey?! You contribute seemingly simple yet magnificent resourcefulness and problem solving capabilities to the team. And of course what really matters is the people. Thank you to the humans who plan, build, review, deploy, monitor, and report on all the work. I am grateful to be able to work with you. Cheers!

title: Allyship in Action
message: Sometimes it gets exhausting when you're always having to call things out. But on this day, you two stepped in and did it. I can't say enough how much that means to me. Not only were you upset on behalf of others who got left out of the antiracism blog article and the lack of representation, you did something about it. This is what true allyship looks like. I am honored to know you and glad to work with you. You both make Workhuman better. Thank you so very much.

title: Scenario Planning Sesh #1 was what I'd call a Win
message: My head is spinning from all the inspired thinking in today's planning meeting. Thank you for sharing your Plans on a Page <or is it 'Plan on a Pages?!'> with the broader team. Thank you for deep diving into some of our Marketing priorities to identify integration points, gaps, opportunities for testing, and more. It was awesome to see different people gather to collaborate cross-functionally and spend time thinking about the "what if sh....scenarios." And lastly, thank you for being good sports about the ice breakers questions. From Buzz Lightyear to time machine travel, childhood crushes  and early retirement dreams, I learned a lot of new things about each of you today!  And yet, I am sure you all agree that it felt like we barely scratched the surface in our three hours today. Not to worry! This is the starting point and I have a good feeling that this was just the first of many Scenario Planning sessions to come. So strap in and look forward to next steps AND the next invite. I am excited to work together to ensure we are set up to deliver business results, feel proud of our work, and have some fun along the way.

title: Thankful to Be on Your Team
message: Amy, just wanted to send a note of gratitude for your steadfast leadership of our team. I can only imagine the amount of slacks, meeting invites, calls you have on any given day. Yet you always make time for the team, prioritizing 1/1s, sharing relevant company info, and so much more. You're always looking out for what's best for the team and clear on priorities so we can focus on what really matters. I know not always easy so I want to say I really appreciate that and I know others do as well. Thankful for you!

title: Scenario Planning Sesh #1 was what I'd call a Win
message: My head is spinning from all the inspired thinking in today's planning meeting. Thank you for sharing your Plans on a Page <or is it 'Plan on a Pages?!'> with the broader team. Thank you for deep diving into some of our Marketing priorities to identify integration points, gaps, opportunities for testing, and more. It was awesome to see different people gather to collaborate cross-functionally and spend time thinking about the "what if sh....scenarios." And lastly, thank you for being good sports about the ice breakers questions. From Buzz Lightyear to time machine travel, childhood crushes  and early retirement dreams, I learned a lot of new things about each of you today!  And yet, I am sure you all agree that it felt like we barely scratched the surface in our three hours today. Not to worry! This is the starting point and I have a good feeling that this was just the first of many Scenario Planning sessions to come. So strap in and look forward to next steps AND the next invite. I am excited to work together to ensure we are set up to deliver business results, feel proud of our work, and have some fun along the way.

title: Championing content management greatness
message: Managing over 100 speakers. At least 56 breakout sessions. 8 keynotes. All from Excel spreadsheets, sharepoint sites and file sharing services is......cumbersome and can be more of a bottleneck as we look to scale our events. Thank you all for helping to champion a content management system for Workhuman Live to better scale, grow and manage all the content for this big bet. It's only going to help us show up better for attendees, which is vital. After all, what's an event without some amazing content!

title: Planning for Purpose!
message: Team,  What an incredibly informative, purposeful, and quality team-building day! Thank you for being present and prepared, for sharing your FY22 department vision and goals, and for collaborating on a unified FY22 brand marketing plan and most importantly our guiding purpose as a leadership team. I feel energized, optimistic, united and supported, and look forward to taking on the challenges that FY22 will bring.

title: Sometimes it takes a village...and tequila.
message: Team ‚Äì thank you all for helping to bring the Texas Tequila Talks event to life last week. Alana, Katie, Rachel, and Anthony, thank you for your great work on the design and development of the assets/invites. Dianne, thank you for overseeing and managing the project and timelines so smoothly. Scott, Meisha-Ann, and Omar, you lead an amazing presentation and discussion, thank you for hosting. Beth, Lori, and Phil, thank you for your support and for facilitating invites to key contacts to ensure we had an engaging group at the event. Chris and Melissa, I appreciate your help in coordinating our customer presenters, allowing attendees to hear firsthand their experience with Workhuman. And finally, Jill, Melissa, and Wendy, without you, there would have been no tequila (or event at all). Thank you for being so organized and for driving all the planning and logistics of the evening. As you can see, it was a true team effort, and I look forward to planning more great events like this in the future. Amazing job all!

title: What an amazing team!
message: A huge shout out to Jill, Jen, Mark, Jeff & Melissa who made this week‚Äôs Atlanta site visit with Sparks a true experience! While this may have felt like ‚Äúold hat‚Äù for many of you, this was a first for me and I was blown away by the level of expertise, thoughtfulness, partnership, collaboration, comradery and energy that every human brought into the process. It made the trip so unique, successful, and of course fun! Each of you brought a lens and level of detail that was critical to the mission. And on top of everything else, you made me feel like part of the team, no matter what my question, observation, or idea was. THANK YOU!!! I can‚Äôt wait to continue to play my small role in the evolution of WHL 2022. Please know how much I appreciate each of your contributions. YOU all are what make this event so phenomenal!

title: So much more than a team!
message: I need to tell you all how very grateful I am to work with you each day.  The past months have been somewhat of a rollercoaster for me (big surprise, right?).  I‚Äôve been well off my game, reactive instead of proactive, triaging instead of being well planned.  It‚Äôs not the way I prefer to work, but have found myself there all too often due to the external struggles I have been managing.  And throughout it all, you have been there to have my back.  Always with a ‚Äòdon‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve got it‚Äô attitude and helping hand.  I couldn‚Äôt do it without you, and am so thankful for your never ending, never questioning support.  I‚Äôm lucky to have you on my team, and look forward to having the chance to offer back even a fraction of the help and support each of you have given.

title: Hired!
message: Team, thank you all so very much for your time, focus, and thoughtful feedback as we searched for a digital event experience manager.  Each of you provided such wonderful feedback throughout the process, and maintained great focus on helping us find the right fit for our team ‚Äì even with so many other demands on your attention. We had a few starts/stops, but ultimately, we found a fantastic candidate in Alex.  He has officially accepted the role and will join our team starting Nov. 22nd.  I cannot wait!

title: The goal is progress, not perfection!
message: ‚ÄúFirst steps are always the hardest but until they are taken the notion of progress remains just a notion and not an achievement‚Äù ‚Äî Through a time of transition, new planning processes and forecasts, and current executional needs this team has been exceptional. You‚Äôve come together, forced needed changes, asked the right questions, and most importantly you‚Äôve done it as a team. Thank you for leading by example, overcoming the daily challenges, and for accepting new perspectives and approaches.   You are building our game plans now so we can all enter the stadium with confidence together next year.   Remember, The goal is progress, not perfection

title: Cleared for LIFT off
message: It was only fitting the title was a bad pun. Cam and Danielle - thank you for all your work over the last year that led to a very productive and exciting JetBlue call with the executive sponsor today. You have advocated on their behalf and gone the extra mile to show our partnership. Today for the first time in many months, our executive sponsor acknowledged that and as a result we have a really promising path forward with JetBlue. I don't want to jinx anything, but it sounds like we will be working with them for many years to come. Just as important, they are ready to re-engage through standing meetings and work with us on strategy. All the little (and BIG) things you've been advocated for and pushed forward over the last year during their time of need are paying off. Jamie - you did a great job of coming in and reinforcing our commitment to the partnership and making the team feel heard. It was clear that Icema loved your moment of human connection talking about your destination wedding and your great experience with JetBlue. Your suggestions and reassurance made for a very happy JetBlue team...and maybe free flights for you?! Thanks again to this A team for all your hard work and support on JetBlue!

I can't wait for your peers to hear about them.  Thank you not only for the great work but for the positive attitude and growth mindset you brought to the discussions.  I'm very grateful to be on this journey alongside such caring teammates.

title: Sales Orders.....
message: Thank you both for all of your help, support and guidance with our open sales orders project. Conor this is something you have asked for/suggested for some time now and with the help of Kevin and yourself we worked on creating it over the last 4-6 weeks of Q3. The three of us had numerous calls to make sure we had it right and had everything included. This involved going through all of the billing checklists and trackers for Q3 and adding them to the file and then adding in the invoice numbers to show which was/wasn't billed. This will completely change how we close out Non award activity billing at the end of every month/quarter and will be an integral part of shortening our close also. Without you both this wouldn't have been possible, thank you both and enjoy!

title: Close in 15!!!!!!!!!!!!!
message: Less than three months ago, I asked a cross-functional team to take on a massive challenge to reduce our quarterly financial by more than 33% within five months. An analogy for this would be like changing the tires of a race car as it rounded the track. In just three months, not only are we well on track to achieve this lofty goal, but we have already created efficiencies and have a terrific plan to tackle the most challenging automation aspect of the plan - well ahead of schedule. I could not be more proud of how this group came together as a team with a passionate focus on achieving this goal and sustaining its impact going forward. I appreciate all of you and thank you. I am grateful to be part of your team, and I cannot wait to celebrate again when we declare victory again....Thank you!

title: Good cop bad cop routine!
message: Cam- I have to say, we have truly mastered the bad cop, good cop routine! Your role being the bad cop, is by far the hardest. But you my friend, absolutely kill it every time! Most recently, we had to opportunity to present to Hershey‚Äôs PMs, new Program Owner, and the old Program Owner (who isn‚Äôt going anywhere, anytime soon. We had a challenge to help them truly understand the value in frequent recognition, not limiting their employee experience and to continue to deliver a best in class recognition program. The old PO flat out said ‚ÄúI am at the point that I want to give people the ability to give 4 awards and thats it!‚Äù You masterfully explained why that is not a great experience, and how they could better leverage the tools available to them. You respectfully questioned their thinking, and helped us get to a place where they are willing to separate out their programs to ensure sales incentives and safety awards are set up and budgetted for separately. We have our work cut out for us, but I wanted to take a moment to thank you for always being there to help deliver excellence to our customers- and for allowing me to play the better role of good cop too:-)

title: Grounding Our Foundation
message: Amy - Thank you for being our Rock during times of transition. When we found ourselves suddenly down two team members, you immediately set out to bring Strike 2 on board to help ensure we continue producing great content on social. Now that they're up and running, it's exciting to see the potential for growth! Not only that‚Äìyou're always checking in, reminding us where our focus needs to be, and helping us stay grounded. When I say "us" it's all of us. Corp Comms, Marketing, Workhuman. You're everywhere! All that said, the support and attention you've shown Micah, Roshni, Angela and I  these past couple of weeks has been invaluable. THANK YOU!! We appreciate you üíØ

title: Strike 1, Strike 2, Home Run!

We are starting to get underway, and are on the path to create even better than content than before. title: Statutory Accounts ‚Äì Done!
message: Fantastic work in closing out the 2020 Statutory Accounts. This is another major milestone to have accomplished. A huge amount of time and work was involved over the last number of months in getting this over the line from preparing workpapers and roll-forwards, calculating statutory adjustments, preparing reconciliations back to the US GAAP financials, addressing audit requests and queries and finally going through three separate EY partner reviews. This would not have been achieved without great teamwork, determination, focus and attention to quality. Well done everybody in completing this and ensuring all our deadlines were met.

You delivered a fabulous production and flawless launch.   Your passion is contagious. Congratulations and celebrate the moment!!

title: Workhuman Live is LIVE
message: Team, we‚Äôve done it again!  After months of planning and hard work, we‚Äôve launched Workhuman Live back in the market, back to LIVE. From initial messaging and look books, to web designs and creative assets, writing of all the words, and getting the legal-ese just right ‚Äì Live slowly came together for the market.  Emails, media, social, and enablement are all launched, and registration is doing its thing to capture and confirm our early adopters.  We‚Äôre just at the start (yes ‚Äì 221 days to go) ‚Äì but I am so proud to work with this team committed to excellence and success every single day.  Well done all!

title: If Slack Speed Dial Existed...
message: I would have you on it! Last week I was struggling to show up, process and get work done. We were chatting all things work and you made a point to ask me, how are you? And took time to listen to my oversharing, offered some free time to chat live about it and encouraged me to keep going but also pause if I needed to. I didn't call you (whoops) but knowing that I could gave me the energy to finish up the day, enjoying the evening with my family and remember that tomorrow was a new day. Thank you for your support and your willingness to listen.

title: A very special moment that matters
message: Team! Thank you all for your participation in our special retirement book and gift for Diane Abbriano at New York Life.  Diane has been a long standing champion of Workhuman and will be retiring at the end of this week.  Diane brought the Applause program to life and has been overseeing the program for over 6 years.  Huge shout out to the experience team (Chris, Amanda and Meghan) for the amazing idea and bringing it to life!  We gathered messages from Workhuman colleagues that have worked with Diane over the years as well as internal New York Life team members to create a special send off to this next exciting chapter of retirement!  Here is the note from Diane after receiving the gift: Thank you for the most thoughtful gift!  It was a nice surprise.  Actually, it was more than nice, it was amazing.  I have received many letters of congratulations and some beautiful gifts, but I couldn‚Äôt wait to share this book with my family because it was so heartfelt and personal.  From the first time I met with Tom Vitkofsky, Workhuman became part of my extended work family.  I could not have launched Applause and made it a success if it weren‚Äôt for Lynette, Mark, Chris, Lauren, Sheri, Martin and the rest of the Workhuman superstars who were always there to support us.  Please pass along my thanks to this terrific group of humans! --- This clearly made an impact and it would not have been as meaningful without all of your help and participation, thank you!

title: Spotlight Experts
message: We took the Product Segments work in house. And what wouldn't we? You are the experts in our Products, our Brand, our Voice, our Message, our Data, our Stories. Thank you for adding this important work to your plate; finding time, making time, juggling, and giving it your best. Cheers!

message: All, as Jack and I presented to the Customer Strategy Leadership Team today, it really hit me how powerful your incredible work and insight has been. I feel very blessed to be working alongside all of you and learn something from you all each time we meet.  The tremendous amount of work you all have done and are continuing to do is remarkable.  Cheers to all of you!

In regards to hiring Abby when she was 9 months pregnant, Amy was quoted in saying, ‚ÄúRather than worry about the stage of their pregnancy, more employers should hire women for who they are and who they can be.‚Äô‚Äô I'm beyond proud and honored to work beside every single one of you strong women working to lift up other women in the workplace!

title: WSJ!
message: Amy, thank you for: 1. Being a badass working mom, 2. Being open about your experience being hired while expecting and hiring expectant moms, 3. Telling your story to the WSJ! Not only did this story allow us to build rapport with a top tier journalist, but this online & print piece helps Workhuman's brand awareness. Again, THANK YOU.

title: Leading with humanity!
message: Thank you, Amy, for your ongoing support, counsel, and strategic leadership that you provide our team. message: To this magnificent group of remarkable leaders, I wanted to share with you the gratitude I feel for all of you every single day. title: Transforming the Future
message: This team is beyond INCREDIBLE and the TRUE DREAM TEAM!  As I think about the future of where Workhuman is going and the experiences we are working diligently to create in partnership with our customers, knowing all of you are leading the way makes me beyond proud.  We spent an incredible couple of days together leveraging our 'Empire State of Strategic Minds" and worked with determination and passion to identify, align and set a path forward for what is next, how to get there, and take us well beyond a $1B company during our QBR session.  The level of strategic thinking, passion and determination you all demonstrated was truly inspiring.  The transformative strategy you all have outlined is what is going to move us forward in all the best ways with focus on our customers digital transformation, sustainability, agility, inclusion and equity efforts and beyond.  I can‚Äôt wait to see where the vision takes this team and the relationships you have built. Amazing work team!

title: Award-Winning Chronicle: #1 in New England/US TV
message: Reid,  thanks to your grit and determination, you secured Workhuman on Chronicle! Thanks to you, we get to share our amazing story with a captive New England audience. Chronicle is not only the oldest and one of the most popular and awarded local magazine TV shows in the country (out-ranking all other in terms of audience growth YOY), it is the #1 watched in New England - with audience growth across all demographics that consistently out-performs all others in the country. It's not easy to get coverage on this highly popular long-running show - and you did it!    Now everyone in New England who works for a living - or loves someone who does - will know what it means to Workhuman.   Amy, thanks to your incredible set up and your leadership with Reid, a new teammate, Baystate Health will bring to life a thriving culture of recognition. They are heroes, in the 4th Wave of a Pandemic, who are willing to take time out to share what it looks like to Workhuman and why, during the hardest of times, social recognition has made all the difference to their employees and the communities they collectively serve.    WAY TO GO, TEAM!  Thrilled with this new phase of PR for Workhuman. Congratulations!

title: Beautiful filming and video outcome for Merck

The words from the client speak volumes: Wow ‚Äì just wow!  I cannot thank you enough for the support and encouragement.  I am normally super critical of myself but have to say this is something I am really proud of!

Thank you for always being a great resource to leverage, and sharing your knowledge and expertise with me to help me grow! As my title of this award said, you are simply the best!!

title: Collaboration, planning and customer rock stars!
message: Team,  Thank you all for your participation in our Onsite / Offsite this week.   This dedicated block of time helped us sync up, reconnect, share ideas and plan for the remainder of the 2021 as we prepare for 2022 planning.  Even though some of us were virtual, you all brought your full selves to the meetings and we had meaningful conversations with clear actions.     Jay, Danielle, Jose and Kara, your SWOT analyses of your businesses was insightful and helped us see the broader opportunities and challenges; balancing the broader themes with your books of business.  Mick, you added to that with context around the Client Services segmentation and support approaches.  Amy, you brought great insights into our biggest engagements that helped level-set us.  Rich, your update on scaling launches and your creative ideas for shortening the window sparked great discussions.  Erin, your view of the product update process helped us see path to better collaboration; an AHA moment!  Kerri, thank you for bringing HX context into the discussion and being a great partner in the meeting.  Cam, thanks for the deep and broad update of operations and approaches, not to mention the awesome idea to have a camera on in the room as well as each person‚Äôs camera.  Michelle, we now have the data that shows that you and your team are doing heroic levels of work and started to plan out to adjust our plans to support them.  And Dana, thank you for all of your support, coordination, planning and ideas to make it all work.    While I‚Äôm eager to get together in person as a group, this was a great chance to spend focused time with all of you and have some laughs. Thank your for time (into the evening for Jose and Mick!), creativity, and partnership.  While some of you may not be great bowlers, you are all great leaders and humans and I appreciate you all.  Onward and upward!

title: Lighting Up Spotlight

Focus areas like Conversations and Service Milestones are critical path for companies that want to overcome The Great Resignation, pandemic-driven culture decay and deterioration of relationships, and the need to build back culture amidst distributed and dynamic work. Keep pushing! With gratitude, -C

title: NIST Assessments are so much fun!!!!
message: The NIST review back in February was 4 hard days of BSI consultant digging in to all elements of corporate to rate us against the cybersecurity standard. Roll on 6 months ‚Ä¶.. include the production environment and ask BSI to repeat the exercise plus a Threat assessment. 9 days of interviews and delving deep into all our controls. A big thanks to all of you for taking the time, sharing your expertise and impressing the BSI consultant who is stunned by the advances we have made in the last 6 months. Gratitude to you all.

I so look forward to our continued partnership!

title: Sweatin' to the... details
message: Thank you to this core team for the perspiration, inspiration, and attention to detail you've provided over the past few weeks as work to improve our tagging process for social. This initiative is critical. And you've all played a massive role. When Jon originally pitched to me the idea of coming up with a "Formula" for our organic strategy, I was admittedly confused. But I soon realized the value - not just for our content planning - but as a way to improve the way we tag, report, and analyze activity on our daily social media posts ‚Äì and our website. Since then, you've been extremely patient and focused on helping us get to where we are today. It's taken a few rounds of word-smitthing, updating fields in Sprinklr, and getting new team members trained on utm's, but I am happy to see that we're now in a good place to be able to launch this new process next week! This level of detail and tracking is something we've never had before (at least on our owned channels) and I'm bleeping pumped for the insights to start rolling in. Thank you team utm-awesome!

title: On-Boarding Thank you!
message: Jill, Stacey & Jaime - thank you so much for your on-going assistance with getting me (the newbie) up to speed on all things related to Workhuman and our team.  You took time away from your busy schedules to educate me and answer the many questions I've had (and will continue to have) since starting here at Workhuman.  I appreciate your patience and am grateful to have you as teammates!

title: Closing Time
message: I would like to say a big thank you this group for all your time and effort towards the analysis of the financial close process.   Over the past few weeks, the Architecture team has involved this team in over 120 hours of meetings as we looked to understand the pain points with the current process.    Everyone across the Finance, Operations, GBGS , Fin Dev and DBA teams was incredibly helpful and supportive over the last few weeks,  taking time out of your schedules during an intensive period to answer our questions.   Given the complexity of the process,  we required multiple sessions with members of this group to wrap our heads around this process, with this team demonstrating remarkable patience and enthusiasm to articulate the challenges faced.   We have emerged from the process with the utmost respect for the exemplary work this group does and a commitment to help address these challenges .   Thank you all again for your time and dedication.

title: No Ego Leadership
message: Yesterday there was a meeting about a booth. A booth under pressure to be built on time. A new idea surfaced. I said in my head "No, it's too late!"  You, as always, calmly and carefully considered the idea. Considered if it would improve the work, the attendee experience, the brand representation, align with the goals of the event. This is what you bring to Workhuman. Always thinking with the company in the forefront, open-minded, no-ego leadership. It is why the events succeed, and the events team is dedicated again and again even as the twists and turns of pandemic life continue to challenge almost every, single, step. We stay in it because of your leadership. Cheers!

title: Better Educating to Our Future Customers
message: Dan, Amanda, Jess, Alan, Mark, Dave, Hari, Marcy, Corinne, Naomi, Meisha-Ann, Cam, Jay, Melanie, Amanda and Sarah - I wanted to take a moment to appreciate each of your contributions this past quarter as they've been key to developing assets that better educate our future customers. First and foremost - Dan, Amanda and Jess: thank you for your collaborative spirit and support through multiple iterations; the important and skillful work you do brings everything together! Alan, Mark, Dave & Hari: I want to thank you for the relentless focus you bring to each of our WHiQ slide reviews; your diverse perspectives and ability to communicate complexity in simple terms is what makes these meetings so informative and productive! Last but not least, Marcy, Corinne, Naomi, Meisha-Ann, Cam, Jay, Melanie, Amanda and Sarah, thank you for your deep partnership helping to create a number of new slides (soon to be made available on seismic) that beautifully illustrates what a 3 year partnership with Workhuman entails. Together, we've made so much progress - yet our work is seemingly never done...always something we can further improve upon. That being said, I wanted to hit pause and take this moment to let each of you know how truly grateful I am for your friendship and continued partnership, all in service of better educating our future customers!

title: Collective efforts
message: Humans (see what I did there haha), a massive thank you for all of your help the last couple of weeks to help improve non award activity billing and specifically interactions with our customers. I could be preparing to create a min commit invoice or a subscription invoice and reached out to all of you for assistance. We've gone over the length clients have left on contracts? (if less than a year obviously we cannot bill for the full year) how are they at making payments? are we able to get new amendments drawn up? has a client paid their latest subscription invoice? why a client have pushed back? The past few weeks there seems to be an increase in all of these queries and all of have really helped out with solving them. We have also had to have numerous calls on these, shoutout to Danielle for jumping on a call with Stephen and myself at 8am US time! Non award billing is really growing and you are all helping the process easier as we go along. Thank you all and enjoy!

title: Together is Better

You are all amazing people, and I am thrilled to have the chance to work with each one of you. P.S. Only you will know why I selected this photo for the award!!!

title: Respect for Quality QBRs!
message: With the pace of business and everything on our plates, it's easy to want to just keep your head down and march forward...However, it's important to stop, look back and evaluate the past. With the right mindset, the past offers lessons that can influence the future - helping us work smarter, make better marketing investment, strengthen our process, refine our messaging/creative and ultimately shape what we will test and optimize next. We wrap the 2Q'QBR up on Monday and I wanted to say THANK YOU to each of you for the time and effort you put into documenting and sharing key insights from your respective areas of marketing expertise. QBRs are an important part of the planning cycle and I am grateful for your commitment to them.

title: Working Human Champions Unite!
message: I wanted to express my gratitude to this fine team of colleagues who have come together to share ideas, express concerns and TAKE ACTION to help shape the human experience and culture for our Marketing team. Your commitment goes way back to last fall when we formed the original Pulse Survey Groups but we reinvented ourselves about a month ago and decided there is strength in numbers. When you share a common goal and vision, it might make sense to join forces. And, wow...were we spot on. I love the collaboration and get giddy when hearing and seeing the larger group feed off each other's ideas. This group championed the DiSC workshop as our first official all hands L&D opportunity. This group helped reimagine the town hall as a platform to showcase the strong work and diverse voices across all of Marketing. This group is thinking ahead to what the next phase of work, when we step away from our Zoom calls and return to the office in some form or fashion, means for our newest marketers and everyone else that survived the last year+! This group is thoughtfully pulling together strategies to help foster the human connections that will inevitably make our team stronger and our work even better. It's a side hustle when we are all hustled out most days, but it matters and I genuinely appreciate your investment. We've only scratched the surface, but after receiving positive feedback on yesterday's town hall and coming off of a lively planning call with many of you earlier today regarding our next couple of initiatives, I am feeling optimistic about the journey we've chosen to take together. #btpftp THANK YOU for your commitment to me, to each other, to all of Marketing, and to working human!

title: Okay, WOW.
message: JILL!! You blew me away today. I suggested that if you had any downtime (haha, what's that) that you had access to resumes for your open req if you wanted to browse them and let me know if any jumped out at you as someone I should screen. Hours later you sent me an ENTIRE list of every applicant and whether or not you had interest in the profile. What would have taken me an hour to sift through I will now be able to do in 10 minutes. THANK YOU soooo much for this act of kindness. I am so looking forward to being your partner on this search!

title: It has been a pleasure
message: Steve and Conor, a massive thank you for all of your support over recent months. In March, we began our search for a tax manager, and to build out a brand new systems team within finance consisting of three new hires. It has been a real pleasure working with you both on all of these roles, your guidance, support, quick responses, and always making time to speak with candidates in a very timely manner ensured we provided amazing hiring experiences for all of our new team members, and ensured we had successful recruitment campaigns. Thank you for everything

title: Content Crusaders
message: Amy & Jill, while this seems overdue from the May event, it‚Äôs top of mind for me. Coming back from maternity leave, I‚Äôm in awe of all the work you both took on to ensure the content at Workhuman Live Online was a success (and it was with a 4.7/5.0 rating!). This is not an easy area to jump into. There are relationships to form, quick deadlines to hit, and many moving parts. Thank you for the time and energy you poured into these sessions in my absence. You‚Äôre a huge part of the reason I was able to enjoy my time with baby Jules this spring.

I know Eric is excited to share the impact the Inclusion Advisor is having!  Your willingness work quickly through teamwork and a total dedication to quality has left me in awe!

title: Rockstar Panel
message: Hi Team,  I want to send out this recognition moment to thank you for the time you spent interviewing candidates for our Newest Social Media Specialist addition to the team-Micah Lucas. Each of you brought valuable insights which helped me as I continued to hone in on what we needed for this role and I enjoyed working with each of you throughout the process. Jon, congrats on your first hire here at Workhuman. Looking forward to the amazing things this team will continue to accomplish.

title: Supporting the Women At Work ADP webinar
message: Thank you all so, much for the support, help, preparation, ideas, inspiration and so much more in getting me prepared for the Women at Work ADP Webinar. I was thrilled to represent Workhuman at such an important event, and take my responsibility as a male ally very seriously.  I would not have been able to do the job without the support of you all. Amy thank you for coming up with the plan and for trusting me with this - Michelle, thank you for providing me with an education on the area - Reid, thank you for the speaker preparation that you and Bill went through to prepare my comms skills, and Simone and Jenna - thank you for the PR follow through after the event.

title: Hired!
message: Amy - it is always a pleasure working with you on building your team - and this last search was no different. I so appreciate the way you approach this as a true partnership. I'm always a TINY bit sad to fill a job for you - because then we have to cancel our weekly check-ins and I don't get to work as closely with you for awhile. Thank you for your quick action/decisions, your open-mindedness in exploring a variety of backgrounds and skill sets, and for your kindness and energy throughout. Although I'm glad to have one less open req - I"m looking forward to opening new ones on your team again in the future. Cheers!

title: Moving the Brand Dashboard Forward
message: Amy and Richard - thank you for the tremendous feedback you gave Ana and I on the Brand Dashboard in our two sessions together. That feedback allowed us to really hone in on what this dashboard will become as well as make it the best it can be. The sessions are a big undertaking and a large amount of time and we greatly appreciate your putting interviewing at the top of your priority list! We appreciate the discussions, the excellent questions and the breakout session practice. We hope you walk away feeling armed to tackle interviewing at Workhuman! Thank you for your time, participation and support!

title: Bringing it at Baker Hughes!
message: Congratulations to this terrific team!  Everyone brought their "A" game to get the BH team on board the WH Cloud train.  After a very long time of bringing up Conversations and Celebrations, BH finally agreed to listen to all the applications.  Cam, you did an amazing job in connecting with the team.  The demos of the solutions hit right on all of their needs and objectives.  Such a great job!  Lauren, thanks so much for all the information on communications and all the ways we are able to assist them in getting the Workhuman word out to all level of employees.  Christa, thanks for all the work you put into Baker Hughes each and every day.  You do such a wonderful job of keeping Workhuman front of mind at BH.  It was such a fruitful and productive gathering and thanks to ALL for all of your hard work.  Enjoy the long weekend.

title: Lightening
message: THANK YOU team for all of your quick responses and fast action to get our newest hire situated for a quick start date. I so appreciate all of your efforts to make this happen in record timing!

title: WHLO Retro
message: Thank you for completing the WHLO survey within the allotted timeframe. Your feedback is important to help drive improvements in how we work on future events. I appreciate your time and input. Your voice has been heard. Cheers!

title: Global Account QBRs‚ÄîSynergies!
message: Super excited after our two day meeting (i mean, with the time change, it was days right?)! You all brought your A game and applied the WH ‚ÄòMRI‚Äô machine (T Pesch trademark) to our 6 biggest opportunites. We have so much great trouble to get into! Thank you for your energy, professionalism, creativity, ... but mostly for your teamwork and collaboration. I love this oportunity we have to focus and drive big growth.  The impact to the business is gonna be huuuuuge. Bravo!

title: Keys to the Keynote
message: Hey Gang, This year, most of Workhuman Live Online production was tackled by out of house vendors with the exception of Eric's keynote address. Jen, without your artistic brain, and you working directly with Eric and getting the raw direction and feedback, we could never have pulled this off in the short amount of time we had. Jill, not even sure what to say as you are vital and critical to all parts of all things WHLO. None of it happens without you and your hard work and strategic planning. Carrie, you came through in the clutch with assistance on graphics and design as the hyper organized human file cabinet of goodness we all love you for being. Nuvs, you recorded some video of the inclusion advisor to give that section of the keynote a little extra pizazz and you did it, and re-did it in a tight pinch. Jay, you adapted and evolved some production graphics including a fun show opener in the midst of website mayhem. Thank you for making the time. Owen, writing Eric's script and content pretty much consumed your life out of left field for the better part of a whole work week. I know it was very hard on you so thank you weathering the storm and delivering great work in the face of the challenge. Cullen, your first big project for the company and you sa-moked it. You rolled with the inevitable left and right field feedback on anything this large. You brought your original artistic style to the edit and we hit the all the deadlines we said we would. D and Stewy, you were both pivotal in the conversation segment with Ro. Without your hard thoughtful and timely work, there is no chance that section would look as polished and up to date as it does. It was a joy to work with you and I am making the case for more creatived to engage your team on our work. To anyone reading, THIS is is what it sometimes take to make "a video". No one can do it alone, so thank you all.

title: Teamwork can solve any mystery!
message: We were able to solve one of the largest art heists of this century through tenacity, cunning and puzzle-solving skills! Thanks to you all for taking the time to participate in a the team building zoom call.  With a host who had an off-the-charts energy level it was great to take the time to jump in, turn on those creative juices and have a few laughs. And special thanks to Dana for coordinating our host and schedules.  Looking forward to our next team-building meeting to be IN PERSON!

title: Structural Support
message: Thank you for your valuable partnership in preparing for and delivering today's post-WHLO webinar. As I said in our quick debrief, it feels so good to have such a qualified and attentive group of experts propping things up, making content shine, handling logistical details, maneuvering messy technology, and providing smart, just-in-time feedback. It's a pleasure working with each one of you! Let's do it again tomorrow!

title: FUNDING AMAZON
message: Thanks so much for the last few weeks jumping onto the bank and uploading and approving the extremely large payments we have had for Amazon. With AP limited to a certain approval amounts on SVB we were unable to make the payments. You both had to stand in and get these payments onto the bank and approved in record timing ! Thank you we really appreciate this as it meant a smooth running end to end for our Amazon purchases

title: Twinning on Innovation, Collaboration, & Mustaches
message: Amy, First of all thank you for brightening my day with humor and knowledge!  You were a delight to meet with.  You certainly added a 'bow on top' to make the day even brighter!  Also, thank you for sharing your deep knowledge and expertise around how we work with some of the consulting firms from a Comms and AR/PR perspective.  I enjoyed building ideas and the art of the possible together.  Thank you!

title: Conference Planning!
message: Well, where do I begin? We are officially on countdown to two of our largest conferences of the year which so happen to be within days of each other. Easy right? Well, for this team it comes naturally. Thank you to each of you for playing an integral part in the planning phase of this busy season and helping to make it such a success. Angela, you are the dream project manager. As soon as that project request goes through you are on it! Setting up tasks in Workfront and scheduling our kick-off calls to go through the details. Lauren, Alana and Liu each of you are essential to creating the catchy copyright and creative artwork to accompany our virtual booth and profiles at the conferences. Amy, Jenna, Simone and Reid have played a crucial role when it comes to organising and scheduling our keynote speakers as well as our overall messaging. Thank you to each of you for supporting us and here‚Äôs to the kick off of the conferences!

title: Pioneering the Human Workplace
message: Thank you all for your months-long efforts in creating Workhuman Live Online. Together, you showcased the importance, impact, and transformative power of putting humans at the center of the workplace.    Doing that took the cooperation of teams across Workhuman, including Technology, Product, Workhuman iQ, Sales, Customer Strategy, Customer Service, Finance, Legal, HX, and Marketing. It was a tremendous effort, and in turn, I am immensely proud of what we accomplished.   I know there were difficult moments during the broadcasts, so I want to specifically call out the resolve and focus many of you demonstrated in supporting our customers and prospects with rapid-response access to key content.    While I would say, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs a wrap‚Äù the truth is this is just a beginning‚Äîthe response has been overwhelmingly positive, and I look forward to seeing the impact it has our company‚Äôs growth in the future.   Ultimately, the greatest demonstration of the power of working human is all of you. So again, thank you for the commitment, hard work, and humanity you brought to Workhuman Live Online.    With gratitude, -C

title: Making Sparks Fly
message: Huge THANK YOU to all of you for an incredible Quarterly Business Meeting today!  We could have spent the entire 3 hours celebrating all of the amazing work you all are doing. You all are the visionaries leading our customers into the Future of Work and helping them to build cultures that celebrate their employees.  The work you‚Äôre doing is fundamentally inspiring employees to feel valued, included and recognized for their contributions and unique perspectives.  As we continue to drive towards our goals for the second half of the year, I am certain we will continue to make sparks fly in all the right ways.  Your dedication and passion for the work we do is unprecedented and so evident in all you deliver.  I continue to be blown away by the talent each of you bring and can‚Äôt thank you enough for everything you do to support our customers.  Cheers to each of you!

title: Upping our PR muscle
message: Team - these past few months have marked a monumental shift and up-leveling in our PR efforts and impact.  Together with bringing on a new agency, you have laid the foundation for Eric to build a strong relationship with the WSJ among others, and you landed the incredible interview he did with Josh Johnson from MSNBC on Friday night.  It was a fantastic interview and loved how much Josh was engaged in the conversation.  These are exactly the kinds of things we need to achieve, building from one powerful outlet to the next - and you did it with grace, determination, imagination, and grit.

title: More Rewrites than a Hollywood Movie
message: Amy - Thank you for your help crafting a message. Your insights were incredibly valuable. I appreciate your partnership and support.

title: Thinking again...and again and again
message: Team, what an adventure we have been! Diving into our Salesforce CRM from a customer and customer marketing perspective has brought our unique perspectives together to envision a data structure that can support our evolving organization. This week we started the process of mapping over 18 customer contact fields into three streamlined fields that will support our understanding of our relationship with contacts at individual customer organizations and streamline data management. This would would not have been possible without dedicated support from Chris on the Sales Ops side, continuous feedback from Cam and the vision that Jill and Mark have. Proud to be part of this work. Thank you for being great partners in this endeavor.

title: Way to GEt it Done!
message: This AMAZING team of incredible people have successfully moved GE into another 3 Year renewal!  You all have been facing in impending RFP for quite some time and due to all of your determination and perseverance, have made it look easy for Phil Morgan to say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Happy and lets just sign for another three years‚Ä¶ just send over the paperwork‚Äù.  Each of you has played an integral role in keeping this longstanding, not so easy to please mega customer engaged with Workhuman.  You have worked hard to continue to build incredible trust, restore happiness and inspire a bright future together in the partnership.  2020 brought so many ups and downs across different businesses at GE and you all maneuvered through it all with remarkable grace and fortitude.  This reminds me of one of my favorite quotes by Vincent Van Gogh, ‚ÄúGreat things are done by a series of small things brough together‚Äù. In GE‚Äôs case, small things brought together include Strategy Sessions for their 4 IFGs, getting leadership to see the importance of recognition, regaining momentum, supporting GE‚Äôs tough eCommerce requests, aligning the IMPACT program to key IFG initiatives like Leadership Principles and building executive relationships with the likes of Laura Cococcia, Head of HR Strategy and Program Management, who‚Äôs partnering with us to build out GE‚Äôs HR development forums. She‚Äôs using words like ‚ÄúIt would be impactful to have Eric and Kevin (CHRO of GE) do a fireside chat on the future of work.‚Äù These are game changing statements and only possible through all of the small things, initiatives, sweat and tears over the years! I‚Äôm so proud of each and every one of you for making an IMPACT on GE, our company and our movement! It takes a village and the Workhuman villagers are unstoppable!!

title: WHLO Exec Forum Goes Digital!
message: It was a pleasure collaborating with you all on the WHLO executive sessions, boldly going where no WHL exec session has gone before - virtual!  Thank you for your strategic ideas, flexibility and dedication to the success of the sessions.  Thanks also for the timely laughs along the way!  Great work for such an important audience!  Cheers!

title: WHLO Exec Forum Goes Digital!
message: It was a pleasure collaborating with you all on the WHLO executive sessions, boldly going where no WHL exec session has gone before - virtual! title: Leading with Empathy
message: Mihai, Jen and Amy, THANK YOU for sharing your insight, vulnerability, candor, tips/tricks, and so many real examples of how you address the challenges that often get in the way of leading with empathy. As we were prepping for the session I thought, if managers can walk away feeling like they can breathe a little easier because they are not alone, that would be a win. I know they walked away with much more than that. The chat was on fire. Just a few of the comments: ‚ÄúSuch wonderful learnings and so needed, today and every day.‚Äù ‚ÄúThanks for taking the time to reflect, gather your thoughts and for sharing .... really good to have this practical workshop in this session.‚Äù ‚ÄúAmazing job MJ, Amy, Jen, and Mihai!  All of you were so vulnerable and inspiring.‚Äù  You did such a wonderful job providing specific examples, and building on one another. I tied this recognition to "respect for all" - for valuing one another's perspectives, and the perspectives of all of our people leaders listening in. I am so grateful that you gave your time and energy to this discussion. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

title: All the right moves
message: Ladies, I have have been so honored to work with you on the WHLOL Executive Forum. For months, you have all prepared for these two hugely important sessions and every decision has been made with a commitment to an excellent experience, compelling content, teamwork, and respect for the program and to one another. It really has been a privilege to work with each one of you on this.

title: Fastest keynote
message: Team, We just launched the second keynote speaker for Workhuman Live Online. You did it in record time. From negotiating contracts, making quick decisions, developing copy and creative, speedy approvals, building, trafficking, launching, coordinating schedules. We even recorded Common's session before we promoted him. That's a first! Common and Zain were prepped for a relevant conversation to close the event and drive home our messaging. Then on to editing. Oh my, so much editing to filter out the best of all the words. It takes a dedicated team of individuals with unique skills to include a keynote in an event. Thank you for your commitment to Workhuman Live. I recognize all the work you do behind the scenes to make it seem... common.

title: BoD time
message: Jill, the Board of Directors invitations don't fall neatly into any category. Not really Audience Acquisition. Not really Event Production. Not sent through our typical channels. But very, very important. Thank you for owning this work, finding the best way to send them by partnering with our vendor, and staying with the process through tracking to make sure the emails were received. Well done!

title: Impressive
message: Anne and Amy,  In speaking with the PR leader for ATD, she shared that Rebecca (CHRO) was super impressed with her experience on the panel.  Her quote was....  "in all the virtual events I have done, this was the most impressive team I have ever worked with. They take it to a whole new level"    I can't thank you enough for all your hard work on the upcoming WHL event.  You made such a positive impression on her, and I am sure she will share it with her network.  She left the experience thinking Workhuman is first class all the way.

title: Trailblazing Again at Merck
message: To those who Inspire: Sheri, Traci, Joyce, Mark and Nuvs - You INSPIRE Merck, your teams and our company in the extraordinary ways you show up, collaborate and partner with our customers! Talk about modeling our value of Respect for Customers and living the definition of ‚Äúbuilding strong relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions and experiences. Consciously creating ‚Äúmoments that matter‚Äù in a systemic and scalable way! You were the Trailblazers with Merck and our new Inclusion Advisor tool. Your imagination, determination and passion for building human-centered workplaces is contagious. Week after week, this core project team collaborated with the Merck team to define and deliver on these new capabilities to a pilot group of about 700 employees. It was hard, challenging and filled with lots of sensitivities and nuances that absolutely needed to be 110% right. You tireless efforts are paying off in spades. First, Celeste Warren, CDO will be speaking not once but twice at WHLO talking about diversity and inclusion and how it intersects with recognition. And at Merck, recognition is happening every 45 seconds. Second, Merck confirmed they see tremendous value in the Inclusion Advisor tool and are ready to expand to all US employees ‚Äì 26,000+ employees and third, Michaela asked this WH team if we‚Äôd be interested in co-presenting on recognition and it‚Äôs intersection with DE&I at the upcoming World at Work conference this October. As a practitioner, she‚Äôll make the submission through Merck. And if that wasn‚Äôt thrilling enough, the Merck core team got a shout out by their CEO at an internal all hands for the work they are doing to support Merck‚Äôs key initiatives. Talk about INSPIRING!! Thank you all for being brave, innovative and dedicated to making Merck and others soon, a place where everyone feels they work at and contribute to a thriving human-centered workplace.

title: Not Common At All
message: Congratulations on an outstanding fireside chat between Common and Zain. Your speaker prep and emphasis on our key messges came to life thoughout the entire conversation. Recognition, honest and actionable feedback, DE&I, and real life, relevent stories shine throughout this keynote. I cant wait for our company and our attendees to see the result of your great work.

title: It Takes A Village
message: I wanted to thank each of you for stepping up while I was out on maternity leave, and supporting my team and customers while I was out! The saying it takes a village is so true, as you all had to take on a new role, in addition to the every day work you already had on your plates! From having 1 on 1's, to joining customer calls and account reviews, to being an escalation point or just being available to answer a question, you each played an instrumental role in supporting my team.  I so appreciate each one of you, and being able to take off and enjoy time with Jackson, knowing the team was in great hands! So on behalf of myself and Jackson, thank you!!!!

title: GE vision
message: Sheri, Today you found out that all of the many months of strategizing, coaxing, selling, marketing and relationship leveraging at GE has paid off and once again they have opted out of an RFP process into a renewal discussion. It has been over 10 years since they did an RFP and last year they were convinced that it was a procurement imperative. But you have been sowing seeds for years with gratitude summits, offsite meetings at Workhuman Live and many, many hours of executive outreach, education and discussions. Pair that with helping them realize the true value of what they are getting from the Workhuman partnership proactively, socially surrounding them with targeted marketing and custom messaging and Voila! Here we are. I‚Äôm so grateful that you have been leading this jouney for us. On behalf of all of us, thank you for your dedication and leadership. Well done!

title: Launch of Hootsuite Amplify!
message: Today we launched our new employee advocacy program, Hootsuite Amplify! This 8 month long project touched a lot of teams and required tons of communication, collaboration, and attention. I want to recognize all of you for your support along the way that helped today's launch go as smoothly as it did. This is the first and an incredibly important step to becoming a social first organization. Thank you all for your contribution, patience, input, and dedication to the program's success.

title: WE HAVE SPEAKERS!
message: Ladies, I can't thank you enough for getting us across the finish line. We have our two keynote speakers. You two were fundamental in getting our final keynote speaker and moderator across the finish line. You helped get all our speakers all signed, sealed and delivered. Schedules were coordinated. People recorded. Things changed and then fixed. ALL the emotions that come with getting this finalized. You two. Rockstars. The show is going to be amazing because of your respect for customers and sense of urgency and quality. Thank you so much!

title: Interview Crew: Assemble
message: Team, I wanted to recognize you for the time and rigor you put into interviewing final candidates for the content team role.  Not only did you commit to multiple conversations and feedback sessions, you also fostered an authentic and vigorous dialogue that got each candidate excited to join Workhuman.  On top of that, we were able to identify the best candidate for the role and have them sign on!  Thank you for the gut checks, work sample reviews, and candor throughout the process.

title: Incredible Simpson Strong-Tie Client Partners
message: Steen and Cam, thank you both for your support and customer centric thinking as you helped navigate taking Simpson-Strong-Tie to the next level!  This new program is the first step as they get back to their original vision of building a global program.  Hari and I promised them years ago one of our key differentiators is we are committed to helping our clients constantly get better.  I so appreciate how you both have supported and listened to SST and helped them get this new program done.  We can never have too much of that so thank you both for your inspired leadership thru action.

Awesome teamwork all!

title: Life Event Champions
message: A huge thank you for your recent insight and knowledge sharing to help set Life Events at bp up for success and take it to the next level. title: So grateful for your partnership!
message: Cam, today‚Äôs exec presentation was a great reminder of why I am so grateful to have your partnership in driving all things Celebrations. title: Life Events and Community Celebrations
message: Rachel and Cam, amazing update today at the executive progress meeting on Life Events and Community Celebrations! You really embraced our new "incubate" approach to launching new products and the learn fast/startup mindset in finding the winning formula.  The strategy to drive real world value from the product, demonstrate it to customers and surround them with multi-channel marketing resulted in over 50% conversion rate from free Life Event trials to paid subscriptions.  Very encouraging results and the result of months of effort.  Well done!

title: Advancing at Avanade
message: Cam, so great to partner with you recently on Celebrations for Avanade. This is a new client for me and setting the stage for future growth and extended partnership were enhanced greatly with your input. Really appreciate the time you gave this opportunity. title: Adam Grant In Market!!

This team continues to perform at an amazing level.  Every. Single. Day.  It was a chaotic, frenzied, and yes - sometimes frustrating week.  But everyone pulled together to execute.  Thanks to everyone for the teamwork, urgency and top quality work.

title: Speakers and More Speakers
message: Almost feels like an in-person event to have this many speakers! Landing so many speakers is a huge achievement in a compressed digital event timeframe. Kudos. A second speaker announcement was not in the plan. But how could we not shout out about more great names and companies? Game. Changers. Even with an extra twist to get a couple of external approvals you launched the assets without delay. Thank you for rolling with the changes and still bringing your best to the work. It is your determination and dedication that is driving registrations. Cheers to you all!

title: Collaboration
message: Outstanding job creating the Executive Forum experience for WHLOL. This took a lot of collaboration with our speaker to fine tune the content ensuring that it a session worthy of our top customers and prospects. I'm continually impressed by the efficiency and teamwork you've shown in developing this experience.

message: What a week for this team.  Not only one WHLO promotional announcement but two.  We kicked it up about 1,000 notches to get Adam Grant negotiated, contracted, copy written, designs done, approvals all around, and in market.  Within just a few days.  This team continues to perform at an amazing level.  Every. Single. Day.  It was a chaotic, frenzied, and yes - sometimes frustrating week.  But everyone pulled together to execute.  Thanks to everyone for the teamwork, urgency and top quality work.

title: Speakers and More Speakers
message: Almost feels like an in-person event to have this many speakers! Landing so many speakers is a huge achievement in a compressed digital event timeframe. Kudos. A second speaker announcement was not in the plan. But how could we not shout out about more great names and companies? Game. Changers. Even with an extra twist to get a couple of external approvals you launched the assets without delay. Thank you for rolling with the changes and still bringing your best to the work. It is your determination and dedication that is driving registrations. Cheers to you all!

title: The 4 Musketeers?
message: Cam, Ana and Mark! Seems like the last 4 weeks its been the 4 of us in meetings about ALL the things; reporting, lead scoring, contact roles, database discovery... the list goes on! While we have many different projects converging at once and the to do list seems endless, there is no one I'd rather be on this roller coaster ride. This team is thoughtful, innovative and pushes the envelope to ensure we have the best possible experience for our customers! Cannot wait to see what value these projects bring and THANK YOU!

title: Sometimes all you need is human's name
message: When working on the design of our Periscope survey, Sheri asked if we could add end user name before an actual survey question. This is a feature that we, despite being Survey design and Insight wizards, completely forgot about! We agreed that it was a great idea to personalise the question and subsequent benchmark analysis showed that personalisation can increase response rates up to 2.5 times!! This means a) faster data collection and b) smaller audiences can be targeted within our surveys leading to more agile and versatile Insights. This story shows the importance of working together. We shouldn't over rely on your knowledge and experience... People that wear different hats than us, can bring new ideas outside of our comfort zone yielding better quality and more customer centric outputs. Thank you Sheri for helping us improving our surveys!!!

title: You are INSPIRING both Merck AND Organon!
message: Sheri,  This message is on behalf of me and Mark, I think we've been in eight meetings alone this week related to Merck and Organon. I wanted to call out specifically how artfully the crossover between these two influential clients crystalized in two distinct moments this week, due to the your strategic guidance.  First, a lot of careful preparation was needed for Merck's annual review meeting this week as we faced a time crunch and a delicate balance of focusing on Merck's program performance while also acknowledging the Organon attendees. You worked through the right approach with our team and outreach to Peter, and what resulted was a jam-packed meeting where Jeff and Aaron as executive sponsors spoke highly of our partnership and impact of INSPIRE, with Aaron telling how how powerful he found it and the reason he  wants to focus on it to stand up the culture at Organon. The other Organon attendees chimed in and spoke glowingly of our relationship and understanding the "art of the possible" with their new program. Second, we had a financial overview meeting with Organon today to go over contract costs as well as the costs associated with adding new cloud elements. Not the most exciting meeting topic on the surface but I was blown away when Peter kicked off the meeting for a recognition moment FOR US! He congratulated us on hosting a great meeting, and called out specifically how pleased Jeff and Aaron were. Mariel added that not all parts of Organon's implementation are going well but working with Workhuman is "optimal," "what teamwork looks like," and that our hard work "is very much noticed". Two pleased executive sponsors (and new CHRO)? Check. Two pleased PMs? Check! Two pleased project teams that were shown in the best light in front of their leaders? Check.  Soon to be launched client trusting our advice and actively seeking to implement new products? Check. No limits to what you can achieve? Happy Check Ten!

title: Leadership and Guidance
message: Amy- if all of my weeks are as fast as this first one, I'll be in for quite an experience. Thank you for all the time you spent with me this week. Looking forward to hitting the ground running and making an impact. Reid

message: Amy, thank you so much for connecting with me following our onboarding session. You have provided me with an opportunity to put my PR experience into action at Workhuman by connecting me with the team. I cannot express enough how appreciative I am of cross-functional teams!  Simone and Jenna, you were both so friendly and eager to hear my thoughts which left me feeling not only confident in myself but in our ability to work together. Thank you for meeting with me and for openly sharing your insight - you have tremendously helped me understand your approach to work. I am so excited to collaborate with you both!

You managed the stakeholders, activated the vendor to adjust the crew's schedule, and worked with the guest speaker to move the recording while maintaining the relationship. I appreciate you, and thank you for catching this one solo. Cheers!

message: Sheri,  Living our Value ‚Äì Innovation = Imagination + Determination, you have once again sparked the future of possibilities and translated them into breakthrough strategies!  Not only did you get Merck to be the first customer piloting the Inclusion Advisor, you now have taken it one step further and have gotten the CDO to speak at the WHLO conference!
