Way to go Sheri, you really are the Spahk!

title: What a fab group of women!!
message: As I started to craft this award, I quickly realized - whoa, what an amazing and impressive group of female leaders!!!  As I scheduled this recent group of guest speakers to join our e-comm team meetings it never even dawned on me that you are all women, and wow, what a cool way to reflect on the success of this group and the leadership, innovation, and expertise you are bringing to the organization in your respective areas and to celebrate the success of women at Workhuman!  Thank you all for the time you took to join our recent e-comm meetings and for sharing details about your work, initiatives you're leading, ways that you're approaching the opportunities in your areas, and the results that you're driving for the company.  And beyond that, thank you for sharing notes about your career paths, about challenges you've faced and ways that you've managed through those, and how we can partner more closely together to drive success as individuals in our careers, our development, and for the company.  The team came away from each of these sessions with new learnings and opportunities to reflect and take away into their own roles and initiatives, and most importantly, inspiration from such fantastic leaders helping to take Workhuman to the next level.  Thank you and I can't wait to have each of you back later this year to share details on progress!

title: 2020 Audit
message: A massive thank you to all involved in the 2020 EY Dublin Audit. For a second year running, we have collectively closed this audit while working remotely, which is a fantastic achievement. You have each contributed to this through providing everything from reconciliations to substantive samples, analytics, further sample testing, further explanations,  process docs, memos, accounting policies and general support and guidance to EY. The audit ran smoother than ever with timelines on track throughout and each of you embracing the new EY portal as our main point of tracking and communication. This puts us in a great position with confidence in the quality and accuracy of our Year End Financials, and the processes and controls surrounding them. Thank you for your co-operation, determination and enthusiasm throughout, a fantastic team effort!

title: Always Ready!
message: Congrats and well done to this powerhouse team of Strategic Leaders on a blowout Q1! Your hard work and always ready mentality has proven to be our secret weapon. Every week I see you making major chess moves with our Strategic Accounts and teeing us up to win big. So many congratulations on the first of many successful quarters in 2021. Super proud of each of you and your new fabulous leader! Rock on!

title: India & China merch solutions A-team
message: Thanks to you all for the incredible energy given to our India / China steering committee, over the past 6 months.  This group has turned up to each meeting with bags of innovative thinking, strategic mindsets & lots of determination as we've tried to problem solve ways of working in somewhat equivocal market spaces.  Seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies seems easier now we're out the other side but it was taken a lot of patience, time, thinking outside the box, team spirit and being open to bouncing around ideas, which may have seemed radical upon initial view but led to great brainstorming and outcomes.  As we now evolve this process to the next stage, appreciate the journey travelled so far with you all - thank you.

title: The best work is behind the scenes.
message: I do so many presentations about what is going on with the event, what it will look like, how the ads will appear‚Äìbut there should be an entire presentation about how these events actually come together. There is so much that you are doing that no one sees, from managing the vendor relationships and contracts, to arranging all the technical aspects of the broadcast‚Äìas well as the filming‚Äìand so much more than I can list here. You make it look like smooth sailing, but I know how much is going on under the water, the constant juggling, negotiating, pivoting. And amidst all the hub-bub of putting on the event you're also working out how to get locations secured for 2022‚Äìbecause events need to be nailed down SO far in advance‚Äìand always thinking of the long-game: the executive briefing center, the future of tradeshows, regional events, how do we get MQLs and big brand awareness that we can measure? You are a unicorn that is part logistic, part financier, part creative, part experiential, and 100% strategic. I can't do anything that I do, without you doing what you do!!!

title: The countdown begins
message: 5, 4, 3 weeks until Workhuman Live Online. I don't know anyone who works on events who sleeps in the weeks leading up to an event. Especially you, being the Event Producer. This recognition is because I see you tirelessly managing our vendor for this event. Working with a new vendor means building and managing relationships, and setting expectations. You do this in your sleep. This event has been even more complex because of shifting dates and weekly changes to promotional campaigns. I appreciate you asking the team for input so you have all the facts to negotiate with the vendor and compromise as necessary to get the work done. You are always exploring options and open to alternative solutions. You excel at vendor management. Thank you.

title: Visionary for a simpler automated billing future
message: From Martin:   Conor, I want to express my appreciation for the way that you supported the analysis and solution-design for Bill-on-Redemption, not just for Accenture but for redemption fees in general. Our team is often under pressure to deliver quickly and to do only what is necessary, but you challenged us to go beyond that and to imagine a unified fee solution, and then you gave direction, encouragement and time for that vision to formulate and evolve into a solution. You also got ahead of the Accenture shockwave to allow us to prepare and to calmly work through the complexities without the familiar time-constraints and pressure to size work with lots of uncertainty.  You demonstrated great leadership and you lead by example in accepting the possibility that Accenture might sign contracts, and the redemption fees are now a core part of our business, not just for one or two clients, and you took responsibility for that in making time for us all to prepare. I believe we have all seen the benefit of your foresight and leadership in the comprehensive, thought-out, low-risk solution that we have prepared, and it is also reflected in the calm confidence and pride across the whole team in approaching this work. I thank you for your vision, your collaborative approach, your patience and for having faith in the team.  Sincerely, Martin I echo all of that, and also appreciate your willingness not to be bound by the precedents created by earlier piecemeal manual approaches.   Pete

message: Together We Can!! Together We Can!!! Let's scream and shout for Chris, Samar, Jay, Amy and Sarah who inspired and delighted the Global Educators Group at J&J today! Amy, when Jennifer Parungao from J&J's Global Educators Group contacted you about participating in their Learning Series and bringing recognition expertise to this session, you jumped on it with a YES!! What a ROCK STAR session this was with over 150+ participants who were hanging on your every words - Samar, Chris and Jay - participating in the polls and behind the scenes sending text messages to our contacts telling them how inspiring the content is and jotting down the learning moments. title: Picture this

The reason Workhuman is able to have Cy in the May event is because of the professional relationship you've built over the past few years. She knows you, trusts you, and respects you as the leader of our events. Thank you for bringing your expertise and mindful approach to all of our events.

title: Creating a more diverse and inclusive world!!!!
message: A millions cheers to this team!! Changing the world!! It is not easy, right! It always seems impossible until you do EXTRAORDINARY and IMPACTFUL game changing things for the first time. Thank you for your passion, determination and imagination in creating more bigger, brighter, diverse and inclusive organizations and worlds!!  Today marks the day Merck launches our new Inclusion Awareness tools on their Inspire platform. Sheri, your leadership opened the door for us. You pushed and organized a meeting with Celeste Warren, VP Global D&I COE and Jeff Geller, SVP Global Rewards to share the vision, opportunity and possibilities to leverage Inspire in a significant and profound way to support and drive Merck's DEI strategy and goals! Yes, yes and yes ensued! The start of turning the "possible" to reality began. You lead from the front. Your leadership and guidance shaped how we managed Merck from yes to launch! Joyce and Tirrill, coming up with the right messaging, integrating Merck's words into the messages, the internal comms and creating "Reflections" was superb! Plus, your nearly daily support was key! Lynette, the video script resonated from review one! It was impactful. Merck was delighted and called this out in an email. Luke, your sense of urgency for posting and re-posting the various versions of the video on Wistia was incredible! You all live our value of Respect for ALL! You gain the confidence and trust of others through your actions, honesty, integrity and authenticity! YOU ALL ROCK!!!

title: Success with BMS Annual Review!
message: Kudos to an amazing team!  Thank you to everyone for your efforts and insights which lead to an action packed 90 minute review of 2020. Alan - your insights and deep dive into R&D and Sales really put the WOW factor into this presentation.  I appreciate your effort and hard work given a short time frame once we revised the deck and goals.  Meisha Ann - it's always a pleasure to have your input and presence on client calls.  You and your team are true professionals who make the client's eyes light up.  Danielle - You brought great ideas and strategies through the Comms section of the presentation.  I have no fear that the areas for improvement will SEE improvement with these comms and practices in place.  Traci - Thank you SO MUCH for sharing this amazing "Connection" focused deck with our group.  To say this was powerful is an understatement. I plan to use pieces of this presentation with my other accounts, too.   Sheri - you delivered this content like you had seen it 100x before... however I know it was your first time.  You had the group engaged and listening.  Great job!!  Erin - it's always such a pleasure when we have you present to bring your updates and plans for Product in the upcoming months.  Thank you for being a great partner!  And lastly Jay... always a consummate professional and so supportive as a leader.  You hold the longest tenure with BMS out of our group and bring wonderful history and context to the conversation.  Thank you everyone for helping to pull together a FANTASTIC meeting that will definitely help BMS go from great to AMAZING!

title: When the rubber meets the road - for an event
message: It takes a lot of tires. The event dates changed. Within minutes action was taken. Within hours - Vendors were contacted. Logos were created. Assets for marketing and sales enablement were updated and shared. Things were paused. Plans for additional work were developed. Within days - Web pages were updated, email was written, built, and launched, comms were shared, calendars were updated, campaigns were revisited and adjusted. It was a lot of effort by a lot of expert and dedicated humans. Thank you!

title: Supportive Leadership
message: Amy, Thank you so much for all of the support you provided to ensure a smooth internal transition for me. When you learned about the opportunity I had to get back into HR, you were understanding and onboard. In our subsequent check-ins, we discussed everything on the calendar, what I would see through and what you could begin to transition. We left each meeting with next steps, and were ultimately able to March 1 work - in large part due to your willingness to work together and determination to make it happen. I'm excited to continue my journey here in a new role, knowing that I will have the opportunity to collaborate closely with you and your growing team. And I am truly grateful for your support.

title: Raising Live and in life
message: Jill and Jeff,  Raising Workhuman Live - I've referred to you as the co-parents of Workhuman Live in the past. Jill, you are the Producer who builds the event. Jeff, you bring the people to it. You bring complimentary skills and styles that make 'raising' each event possible. In the past year there have been many changes: event formats, leadership, timelines, vendors, dates. The list is long. You remain the constant. The people the team turns to and relies on for stability, advice, and support. Thank you.  Raising teens - while all that is happening, you are also raising teens. The world is driving in the fog right now, no one knowing what the future looks like. Teens are driving without fog lights. They don't have the life experience to understand right now is temporary, and how to see through the fog. Yet as they end their high school journey, teens are expected to make big life decisions. Parenting through this is hard, and heavy, and happens mostly off-screen. I see you.  The combination is a one-two punch some days. I see you managing it and holding it all together. I see you moving from Live to life and back again. I recognize you, and support you, and appreciate that you show up - day after day after day. Keep being awesome.

title: Great GPTW partnership
message: Jim, Conor and Ger - A huge thank you for the great partnership to help deliver the GPTW feedback sessions to our people. We really appreciate your collaboration and support to get the right communications ready for our people leaders and employees which was so important to share before 10th March! We know it was another ask while you are really busy but you were happy to jump in and co-facilitate the sessions. Having a representation of the Dublin Executive team as part of the sessions was very powerful and your messages reinforced the positivity, commitment and passion we all share for our wonderful culture. Another great way to create a positive experience for our people. What a year and what results! It was a pleasure to co-deliver with you and we thank you for the partnership! From Christine, Dermot, Caoimhe, Clare and Rosana

title: #ChoosetoChallenge for Positive Change
message: Leslie & Sheri, sometimes you read a quote, a statement, or a few lines of text and humans that represent those thoughts pop to the top of your mind. This quote from the 2021 Intl Women's Day theme "from challenge comes change, so let's all choose to challenge" immediately made me think of you two! During one our most challenging years ever, you both double-down on promoting diversity, equity and inclusion with some of our largest customers - Merck, GE, Eaton and Corning, to name a few. Bringing new innovative product/solution capabilities - Inclusion Awareness (reflections + award adviser) - to support and compliment these customers own Diversity & Inclusion purpose, mission and goals. You truly lived our value of Imagination + Determination = Innovation to get these customers to where they are today with us!   Imagination was lived as you embraced moving beyond traditional ways of doing things, creating new relationships with Chief D&I officers, DEI ERGs and continually demonstrating your ability to inspire others, pivot when needed and ultimately get to victory! Determination was lived as you stayed focused and composed in stressful situations. WH didn't always have all the answers, "flying and building" out these capabilities at the same time, learning and taking constructive action to navigate difficulties all for the betterment of what WH and customers could achieve together! Innovation and delivering on "moonshots" is now here. Merck will launch the new Inclusion Awareness capabilities on March 17th to an "early access" group. Eaton has said "Let's Do.", Corning is ready for the next meeting and GE is primed and future meetings getting set-up. Thank you for always challenging yourselves, your WH colleagues and our customers to be responsible and take action, call out gender biases, celebrate women's achievements, and collectively build the brightest, most inclusive world for all! YOU ROCK!!

title: Happy Employee Appreciation Day, dude!
message: Cam - I've been thinking that even though we work together the most, I can't even remember the last time I recognized you. In a way, it's a sign of friendship and trust. It's already understood that we appreciate each other...but that doesn't mean it's not needed. I am very thankful for your perspectives, your sense of humor, your drive and passion, and all your amazing ideas. One of the best things about partnering with you is that we can challenge each other to be better, while at the same time you are always there to listen. Whether it's navigating IBM, trying to fix problems or get things done for a customer, or collaborating on the customer webinar series, working with you is always fun and inspiring. On this day of employee appreciation, I hope you know you are valued and all your amazing work is seen. The Dude abides!

title: THANK YOU FOR THANKING
message: Thank you all for your video submission for Employee Appreciation Day! While this day provides a wonderful reminder for all of us to reflect on the efforts and innovation that each of our humans bring to the table - we all know that our spirit of recognition and celebration is one that lives on all year long. There is no greater example of this in action than the recent call for video submissions from people leaders for an Employer Brand campaign. When we asked for some videos from people leaders thanking their team members, we were OVERWHELMED with video submissions - much more than we could incorporate into one or two snippet videos!  Your videos will remain live for all your team mates to see (see slack for link). Thank you all so much for taking the time to show your gratitude and enhancing our culture further. Even in this remote world you are all creating moments that matter, so thank you.

title: Give and take
message: Amy - thank you for your candid conversations and perspectives. It helps me formulate my support for you and others. I appreciate our partnership and collaboration.

title: Thank You for Making My Job Easy
message: In honor of Employee Appreciation Day (yes I am aware that none of you are "employees" of mine), I wanted to thank each and every one of you for not only making my job easier but making it fun. Working with you all is such a pleasure and together, we have created a strong foundation for our digital marketing initiatives. Thank you all for all the tireless work you do, and I am so exciting to keep building with you all.

title: A Team Appreciation Day!
message: Happiest Employee Appreciation Day to this team of badasses! I could not be prouder to work with such a team of professionals. You make work fun! You show up every day, leaning in, supporting each other, raising the bar, and celebrating every moment along the way. I hope you feel the love every day but especially today! Thank you for being such great caretakers of our mission and leaders for the organization. Strategic Client Directors lead the way!

title: Creative discussion partners!
message: Team, thank you for your participation, creative discussion and investment in our process of defining Marketing KPIs as we envision our plan for development. I was inspired and motivated by your expertise and feedback during our session yesterday. This has truly been a team effort held up by all humans involved! I'm excited to see where our imagination and determination take marketing analytics.

title: Women in Tech Sales Bootcamp - Powerhouse Panel!
message: Sheri, Marie, Corbrina and Lauren - thank you SO much for participating in the panel for Women in Tech Sales Bootcamp! It was truly my honor to moderate your discussion and to showcase each of you during the session. I said it then and I'll say it now - you are a powerhouse group and we are lucky to have you all at Workhuman! You shared incredible insight into your career journeys and roles at Workhuman and gave excellent advice - everything from interviewing to how to stand out in your roles and be the most successful in sales. The participants were incredibly impressed and I received such positive feedback on the session. You were authentic, open and welcoming while sharing real-world advice - you represented yourselves and Workhuman perfectly. I am grateful for your prep time, for you sharing your stories and for always being willing to help the next group of women enter the world of sales. Thank you!

title: Onboarding Heroes
message: Hi Michael, Amanda, Casey, Orlagh, Eileen, Mark, Dave, Cam, and Rick! I want to thank you for making time during the past few weeks to participate in my onboarding process for the new Sales & Customer Success Enablement Strategist role. I'm look forward to working closely with you on our customer renewal and YOS / symbolic awards efforts. Thank you again for sharing your expertise to help me transition into this exciting new position! James

title: Energy + Passion = Contagious
message: You were on our eComm call today you did a presentation where your energy and passion for the brand is very apparent. Being a very new hire it was exciting to see and be a part of. Thank you!   Also, the notion of loud kids is something I relate to the core.

title: Visibility 2021
message: It's February 18! We're almost halfway through the quarter! What a whirlwind 2021 has been. Thanks to this team of inspired minds for coming together this week to review detailed individual action plans for our strategic accounts and also coming together to share our biggest opportunities with each other. We all learn and grow so much together and I LOVE IT! Special shout out to our new BFF, Yuri! Thanks so much for kicking us off, inspiring our thinking, introducing us to the best new yogi 2021, and giving us some insight and vision for the future of WHCE. We're so lucky to have you! Thanks to everyone on the team for contributing to our Periscope project and Data Insights project. We've made some real progress on ass kicking and it's 'only' February! I see you!

title: Lending Your Expertise
message: Thank you both for joining today's call with Avantor.  Cam - you did an amazing job walking through Life Events and Community Celebrations.  You really painted an tangible picture of how important these awards are to build and foster connections among colleagues.  And thanks for inviting me to share a picture of my puppy to bring it home!  They are definitely interested and I will be continuing this conversation in subsequent calls.  And thanks for also researching and providing a visual to show the recent approval change that they had inquired about.  Erin - thank you for diving right into a configuration conundrum that we are currently working on with Spend Management.  You immediately put your CSM hat right back on and stepped in to identify the next step needed to bring that to resolution.  And thank you as well for walking through the details of role based reporting.  We'll now move forward to putting this in sandbox so they can determine how to best use this functionality and who to give it to.  Mostly I appreciated the partnership you both exhibited both with me and with the PM.  You were so engaging, so supportive and so helpful.  So thanks my friends, for Lending Your Expertise!

title: Workhuman Listens
message: All,  It‚Äôs been such a pleasure to talk to you all over the past weeks, and to hear how much the voice of our customers matters to you! Over the coming months, we will help you create surveys to tap into the wealth of great things our users have to say about our products, how positive their experiences are‚Ä¶ how they feel using the platform!! We have distilled the conversations we have had into a roadmap, which we will share with all of you next week. Over the past year, we, the EXM team, have seen some heartwarming testimonials from users, and I have no doubt that we are about to open the floodgates of thanks! I recall about a year ago, when we did our first proper ‚ÄòPeriscope‚Äô that the resounding response was a 72% ‚ÄòJust plain THANK YOU‚Äô  and the remaining 28% had some really encouraging and helpful feedback to offer, which we can use to make our product even better!!  All we need to do is listen!  I am excited to start working with you, and encouraged by your enthusiasm for the program.  Let‚Äôs build Workhuman listens!    Brian, EXM team

title: Caring Matters!
message: Z and Amy, Thank you for organizing this Marketing team during our most recent meeting.  Everything was clear, the topics were key priorities and everyone participated.  And you demonstrated how you are about each of us. Thanks you for your exquisite leadership!

title: Marketer or Marketeer?
message: No matter which way you market yourself, Amy and I wanted to thank this entire team for the investment over the last few weeks, leading up to today - our first integrated planning offsite of 2021! You invested your time, energy, mind and heart in the offsite topics and each other. We appreciate the opportunity for transparency, communication and idea sharing around two of our most important upcoming initiatives between the Brand Relaunch and WH Live. We're both excited to be aligned, looking forward to building out integrated marketing plans together, and thrilled to be on this journey with each of you. Onward we go! Z & Amy

title: Team SPARK !
message: Team SPARK - your involvement in this project has been so extremely important as we reimagine our brand, our product, our strategy, our design, and of course our recognition program. Our spark represents our company and our culture and our people - and you have enriched it to come to life for everyone, everyday. Go Team SPARK!! Enjoy!!g

title: "Experience" Experts Unite
message: Wanted to give a shout out to this team for the thoughtful approach, care and attention you put into creating the WH Live session for our integrated marketing planning "offsite" later this afternoon. Would have been easy to default to a never-ending PPT deck and 45 minutes of a traditional presentation format, but you took to heart specific feedback and created what I am sure will be an engaging experience for all. Looking forward to it. THANK YOU!

title: Passing Checkpoint 1
message: Yesterday, IBM Checkpoint launched to over 300,000 IBMers in 93 countries and our largest ever Conversations program took off. When I was choosing an appropriate award reason for celebrating your team accomplishment, the description for Innovation = Imagination + Determination reads: "Resilience: rebounding with courage from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations.  Calm under pressure and positively adapting." What a wonderful description of the journey you all have been on these past few months.  Many people go their whole lives without working on a project like this that touches so many people all over the world with incredible complexity.  Take a breath, take a moment and let it sink in. You did it!  The feedback has been wonderful.  In an internal communication amongst the top HR leaders at IBM, quotes such as ""After playing around with the new Checkpoint Experience I just wanted to say I LOVE IT and it looks to be exactly what I was looking for... I look forward to setting my first goals and soliciting way too much constructive criticism!". And a resounding testimonial to each of you..."We do have a fantastic partner in Workhuman, and they are just as excited to launch as we are."  Congratulations on this amazing milestone and thank you each for your critical role in making this dream real!

title: Partnership
message: Amy, Thank you for your ongoing partnership with the customer acquisition team. Over the last few months, we‚Äôve had multiple conversations ranging from how our teams can work together more closely, how to leverage PR and influrncers in specific markets, where agencies can plug in, what research we need and how to use it, and how to evolve demand gen to support new content directions. Not only do you listen and provide guidance, you take quick action to support the business. I‚Äôm grateful for your dedication to collaboration, alignment, and results!

title: Beyond the Workplace Learning Expedition!
message: Thank you so much for participating in this exciting learning expedition with the Douglas team today!  Cam, thank you for jumping in to fill in and demo the product last minute!  You are a pro, and I am so grateful that I can always count on you - whatever the need of the moment!  Jim, thank you for offering such terrific insights, guidance, and support throughout the call!  I am hopeful that this learning expedition will be a valuable first step in progressing with our mission driven goal of expanding beyond the workplace and into schools!  Great team effort and thank you, from both Kevin and me!

title: Whirlpool Business Review
message: Thanks to you all for the time and effort that went into holding a successful business review with Whirlpool this week (and Cam/Lauren, thanks in advance for the work you will be doing in the follow up meeting next week!) There was quite a deal of preparation that went into this meeting and very clear guidance from the customer in terms of their content expectations. You all did an amazing job delivering exactly what the customer wanted to see. Whirlpool was engaged, asked great questions and is very enthusiastic about the relaunch planned for Q2. With some new blood on the Whirlpool team we have an opportunity to make a difference in how they design their future (glocal!?!) program and I look forward to seeing where these conversations lead! Thank you all for your incredible team work.

title: Pioneer Squad
message: Thanks all for either being the first few people to complete and submit the speaking engagements request form in Workfront or for joining one of our first two speakers bureau office hours. Our hope is that the new process is both simple and useful to all areas of the business. You've helped to kick it all off by jumping in without hesitation and asking all the right questions. We look forward to your feedback as we continue throughout the year!

title: Team Data Grows
message: Adding more humans to the Thank you, for spending time this week outside of your current workload to provide data to help inform decisions for our future event work. I appreciate your time, dedication to teamwork, and quick responses. Cheers!

title: The one with ALL the answers!
message: Amy, thanks (yet again) for dropping everything and helping me out in a pinch today. I was 100% sure you were heads down on many other key initiatives going on, yet we were able to figure out a solution to a mini fire drill in under 5 minutes. I know I can always count on you to either: A) have the answer I need, or B) happily offer to hunt down the answer in record time for us. I continue to be amazed by your contagious work ethic, your team-first mentality, and the speed you consistently operate at without sacrificing quality. Thank YOU!

title: Right message. Right place. Right time.
message: Z, Amy, Moe! On behalf of Patti and myself, I wanted to highlight and say thank you for re-imaging our Marketing Communications approach. You correctly anticipated that what should follow our new brand reveal is a communication template that keeps in lock step with its style guide. Great example of cohesion, and pivoting to a more scannable, mobile friendly, info-graphic"ish" approach. Well done and thank you. With gratitude, -C

title: Moments that matter SUPER USER!
message: Sheri - As I was looking through our moments that matter tracking sheet, I noticed that almost every single email template that we created in Q4 was by YOU! You have been such an incredible partner and have taken full advantage of these email templates to help customers celebrate important milestones. You are consistently thinking about ways to recognize top customers and create special moments to make them feel acknowledged and celebrated. This is what Workhuman is all about and I wanted to thank you for being such a super user of these awesome tools. Keep it up!

title: Team data
message: Thank you for spending time this week outside of your current workload to gather historical data to help inform decisions for our future work. I appreciate your time and dedication. Cheers!

title: Great Collaboration!
message: I want to say a huge 'Thank You'  on behalf of GBSG to all of you who were involved with helping us map out the current process for onboarding new Gift Card suppliers. This is such an important process for Workhuman and it spans so many different departments. You all gave so freely of your time and despite this being a busy time for all involved, you were still available to meet at short notice. We are really grateful for your continuing support! Thank you all...

title: Happy Checkpoint Day!!!
message: Congratulations!!! Team, I must commend you for getting IBM launched. Each of you brought your all and then some to get this completed. From the countless hours testing configurations, translations, emails, eligibility, handling production issues, and not to mention running numerous data loads. The Checkpoint program will be a success for IBM not just because of all the great Conversations functionalities set up for them, but because of the amount of love and dedication put behind it. After many months of careful planning and execution, HAPPY LAUNCH DAY!!!

title: 5,4,3,2,1 - IBM Launch Last Minute Magic
message: It‚Äôs Saturday morning and just like any great NASA launch the behind the scenes last minute is what really makes the magic happen!  Selling this potential direction changing deal was just the beginning and each of you has done amazing last minute work on IBM!  Most of never understand all the effort but we all appreciate you amazing HUMANS for all the extra effort!  Cant wait to hear how much their employees love the new way to Talk!  And to listen!!!  Thanks for urgently giving up your weekend!

title: Biggest Fan
message: Cam, if the customer development marketing team had a fan club (that would be hysterical), you would be our biggest fan, with the foam finger and all! Joking aside, you have been an stunning partner to our team, from day 1. I recall chatting in Dubai conference room with you and Sarah, rattling off all the crazy things I thought we should be focused on. You are always so energized, positive, willing to help and constantly looking for ways to do right by our customers and the teams that support them. Thanks for being such a terrific teammate! I cannot overstate what a pleasure it is to work and collaborate with you!

title: Connecting the dots at Tufts
message: Sheri, thank you for helping our selling efforts at Tufts Medical which will hopefullu open the door to Wellforce as a whole. Your inside track while not a guaranted win for us certainly gives us insider information we can use to better position our solutions and value prop to the right stakeholders. You took the time on a Friday to call and collaborate on strategy even while your phone and computer were blowin‚Äô up. THANK YOU!

title: Problem Solving Wizards
message: Thank you for all of your help solving the technical issues that can arise when working with media outlets.   I know that there are so many variables and details to manage when booking interviews on behalf of Eric.  Amy,  you are always there to jump right in to find solutions, work with our schedule, and be a trusted team member.  Thank you, Simone, for your ability to pivot and find creative solutions to making this process as seamless as possible.   Ray, thank you! You are always there any time, day or night.  It is such a pleasure to have you on our team to solve any problem, big or small, with a smile and a laugh.   It is such a pleasure to work with you guys, thank you for all your support.

title: The Assumptive Close
message: Congratulations, Sheri on the 3 year renewal of our business with Biogen! Without a doubt, Biogen has had an unexpectedly tough year--especially in the press. The one thing that helped them thrive was social recognition. Like the absolute pro that you are, without batting an eye, you turned around a 3 year renewal without any negotiation on pricing. You inspire me with your sales wizardry! Brava to a great kickoff to winning in 2021!

title: ONE TEAM.
message: Amy - Thank you for your partnership and collaborative approach. Every day your actions and words show your commitment and respect for ALL. You just reached out with a meeting request to a cross functional marketing group to proactively form a brain trust around WH IQ. "How do we unlock all that good data and get ahead of it?" Then I went to Slack and you had just shared an HR.com article with an interview with Steve P that you thought would be useful to our team. In our Monday standup yesterday, you took time to ask the right questions to ensure we were all aligned and properly supporting the Product Marketing on the upcoming Community Celebration launch. Not only are you clear, focused and confident, you are consistent with your ONE TEAM approach - and we'll be a better team thanks to all that you do. I see you and appreciate the positive impact you have on all of us.

title: IBM Successful Data Load!
message: Thanks to all of you and congratulations on the first successful load of IBM's data into production as the next step towards launch next week.  This is one of our largest customer files and involved some creative analysis, problem solving, code changes and data sleuthing!  The Dunkin Donuts man would say "it's time to make the donuts" at all hours of the day and night.  Just like him, you have worked TOGETHER to overcome misplaced quotes, ill-formed files, "orphaned" employees and high volumes to get us to that next step along the journey.  This has taken literally dozens of attempts and we now we have success. Thanks to you all for always being positive and creative.  On to our next milestone with IBM.

title: IBM is live in production!
message: Today is the day we have all been waiting for! After roughly THREE months of testing data files for IBM with 350,000+ records coming from multiple sources, we successfully loaded IBM's first production data file! This is no small effort with every file taking hours to load...this team remained focused day after day, identifying and troubleshooting errors, coordinating fixes with the IBM team, brainstorming on creative solutions, and monitoring data loads day and night. Having successful data in production is quite simply THE most important step in getting IBM launched. Thank you to each of you for all your determination and hard work. You are each part of bringing this extraordinary client to life for Workhuman and giving 350,000 employees and new and better way to have a voice in their career journey. And a very special shout-out to you, Shawn, for leading this process in it's entirety. We needed your expertise on this project and you delivered! Congratulations to each of you and take a moment to celebrate this big moment!

title: Life Events ABM Partner In Crime
message: Cam, I can't thank you enough for your partnership the past several weeks with Life Events upsell campaigns. You've been instrumental in considering each opportunity individually in unique ways, asked thoughtful questions about ABM and have been an overall incredible team player. Just reflecting back on the last several weeks, you've pulled & analyzed data, dug into pricing, created pitch decks, successfully rolled this out to the team - and even found time to record a video explaining stats for our customers! I have no doubt that these upsell tactics will come to fruition, thanks to you and the value you are helping Workhuman articulate. Thanks again and I look forward to partnering with you more and more in the future!!

title: Thank You
message: Cam, Thank You for your prompt & professional handling of WH Enhancements DEI & Reporting Privilege's queries received by one of our Clients today, after a quick conversation via phone we agreed to utilize an already existing opportunity to extend usage of Life Event to be combined with new related queries, perfect approach,  Once again Thanks, You Rock!

title: Rowing in the Same Direction
message: Thank you for always being strong advocates for Employer Brand! I appreciate you taking the time to review upcoming campaigns that are happening on the corporate side, and thinking about how Employer Brand can align to these themes as we engage our candidate audience - so our corporate and employer brands are both rowing in the same direction. As we look to make Workhuman a household name - aligning our messaging and themes when speaking to both prospective clients and prospective employees is essential for us to show the whole picture. Appreciate all you do!

title: A big thank you
message: Guys, the last 2 weeks have been unbelievably hard for me. I'm so glad that I work with people that kept checking in on me. Ronan, I appreciate all the advice you gave me from when you went through the same thing. Christine, I appreciate the little chats that we had cause I have been being more detached from the world and it really helped me out! And Conor, I appreciate the support you have given me and how you helped the team get through year-end without me, I appreciate the understanding and the little check ins that we have had. You are all amazing and I just want you to know that it meant more to me than you probably realised.

title: Q4 support
message: Guys,  Cheers for all the support especially in Q4 with the multiple little general tips to help developing files and reports. This has been a huge help in many aspects of my work being able to take these little things and applying these to reconciliations and presentations. The focus on the audience has never been a focus from my point of view but now with the guidance provided I have incorporated this into presentations etc. and this has in-turn (from my point of view) improved the quality and concise nature when for example presenting.  Thanks, Jake

title: Inclusive Conversations
message: Devin and Jill, thanks for the time and energy you put into the first planning session with the agency for WHLO. The team has strong momentum coming off the holiday break because of the work you both put in leading up to these meetings. I greatly appreciate you inviting various voices into the conversation and making the planning process truly inclusive. I look forward to Workhuman‚Äôs most impressive event yet!

title: Huge Thank You!!!
message: Hola Conor, this is massive over due THANK YOU for all the support in Twenty-Twenty. You have been there when needed to progress work and personal side.  Welcome to 2021 :)

title: Entering the Home Stretch
message: Erin, Patrick and Cam, you've been running this race with the IBM launch for months now.  As we predicted, IBM has brought many new requirements, interesting challenges and people to their launch of Conversations.  To date, the project has continued to work so smoothly that the customer has said "I'm waiting for the other shoe to drop", but it never has.  This success to date is because the three of you have created and executed a plan that's gotten us into UAT with our eyes now on a Feb 1 launch.   Through countless requirements meetings, status updates and discussions, you've kept IBM engaged and happy.  Thanks for all this work as we enter the Home Stretch towards our launch.  Thank you!

title: Cisco Workday Integration is Live!
message: A huge thanks to all of you involved in getting Cisco up and running on Workday! Clearly this was a monstrous team effort with hours upon hours of time put in by all of you (and I'm sure there were even more people involved behind the scenes!), whether it was working directly with the customer, configuration, testing, or the intense battle to get spend management up and running. While some parts were quite bumpy indeed, at the end of the day the customer launched successfully and is extremely happy. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

title: Team Updates
message: Amy - Quick note to say thank you for continually pushing us to be better, even with something like our team updates. You gave everyone a chance to weigh in on how we could improve the format and topics during our last meeting of 2020. Then followed up during holidays. And then, a third time, gave us a final chance to weigh in via. email during this first week back in the New Year. I know we're still semi transitioning to this new format but, it was a great first meeting of the year and I'm looking forward to testing out new ways of communicating. And making this year great with the best team ever!

title: Vision, Clarity, and Collaboration...
message: Z and Amy - this award is long overdue. In the past several months, you both have taken the reigns on major marketing initiatives, goal planning, directors meeting agendas, leadership alignment... the list goes on and on. You've supported each of us by pushing ideas, clarifying objectives, and keeping us all focused in the same direction. This is the glue that holds all of our teams together, and helps our our marketing efforts (and ultimately our brand) become greater than the sum of its parts. This is NO SMALL TASK. And my words here don't do it justice. I'm writing this, on day 2 of the new year, where I'm already seeing a further increased level of clarity with our team meetings and objectives, and its so great to kick the new year off this way. Thank you both for everything you have already done, and will no-doubt continue to do.

title: Putting in the work
message: Team - on behalf of Patti and myself, we wanted to say, "Thank you" and recognize the teamwork, collaboration, and effort you've collectively put in to moving our Pulse Survey action plans forward from Q4 2020 to Q1 2021. Together, we've made great quarter over quarter progress due to your efforts. This is an "above and beyond" initiative you've stepped up to lead. In doing so, you are each playing a leadership role for your marketing colleagues and peers - and - making a meaningful contribution to Patti and myself in building an amazing employee experience. This type of work is not the kind you can do "every so often" or "sometimes" and expect to achieve progress. It takes ongoing focus, a solutions-based outlook, courage and candor to build and sustain a great employee experience. Thank you for putting in the work - we look forward to continued advancements as we turn the page to 2021! With gratitude, -C

title: Making the IBM Conversations plan come together
message: To quote The A Team's Col. John 'Hannibal' Smith: "I love it when a plan comes together." I have been extremely fortunate to work closely with each of you on the IBM Conversations launch project these past few months. Erin & Cam, this is the first time I've really been able to collaborate with you - and to say I'm in awe would be an understatement. You've displayed top-notch strategic planning, project management and technical expertise on a daily basis. Oh, and you're excellent presenters and client relationship builders to boot. You've inspired me to match your level, and are setting me up to be successful long-term with IBM. Shawn, Kel & Noah - we simply would not be as successful as we've been with the project without your dedication to quality program configuration and troubleshooting. Your work ensured a smooth UAT process, and the proof is in the praise we received directly from IBM: "This was the most organized program UAT we've ever been a part of." The work is by no means done, but know the great work will continue with each of you on the team.

title: Trailblazin'
message: ‚ÄúOur chief want in life is somebody who will make us do what we can.‚Äù ‚Äî Ralph Waldo Emerson  Amy, as we wrap up the year I would like to recognize and thank you for our continued partnership.  I really like this quote, and while you don't MAKE me do anything, your perspective and guidance INSPIRES me to do everything I can to make an impact at this organization.  Thank you for the early opportunities to do cool video projects, current opportunities unfolding, and the unknown to take shape in 2021.  You make everyone around you better and I am grateful to be along for the journey.

title: Ops & Finance End Of Quarter Daily's!
message: All, Just wanted to take a moment to thank everyone for their input in the daily end of quarter meeting's during 2020. This daily meeting provides an excellent platform for communicating and sharing insights across the teams from... award and redemption volumes trends,  shifting demand patterns, moves to online and merchandise product, forecast tracking, additional funding requests, team awards and associated planning required, inventory targets, shipping restrictions and potential bottlenecks, backlog management,  Amazon and other float accounts funding requirements, customer re-launches, Billings to redemptions Ratios, new client launches...the list goes on!!  This forum enables the right decisions to be made at the right time, to ensure smooth end of quarter management while continuing to deliver an exceptional experience to our clients employees! Thanks again to everyone for your support throughout the year, wishing you and your family a safe and Happy Christmas ..Roll on 2021!

title: Life Events PEPM Prep!
message: Awesome work over the last week building out the Life Events PEPM GTM plans. This team did a wonderful job collaborating on strategy, talking through gotchas and working together quickly to develop a strong plan;  all culminating in a terrific discussion with the customer facing teams this week! Appreciate the strong teamwork and love that we created a model to leverage in the future. Amazing partnership, team!

title: Support and guidance through a challenging year
message: Conor, a long and overdue thank you for all your support throughout 2020. Firstly, on the personal side, you have been very supportive and understanding with this one-off(hopefully) year that we have had, and always keen to make sure we are getting on ok with the trials and tribulations of COVID . On the work side, we have been making steady progress with all things FP&A and it has been super to have you there to test out our new assumptions and forecasts. Much appreciated!

title: Event Planning Master
message: Jill, thank you for organizing and executing the agency RFP for Workhuman Live 2021 and then bringing the team together for the agency reviews.  I know the process was last minute and you did a great job briefing and prepping the agencies for a thoughtful review process.  I especially appreciate you facilitating the discussion for the open and honest feedback on the contenders.  It was impressive to see the work that's being done in the industry and exciting to think about the options we have to consider for Live.  Really looking forward to working with you in the months to come.

title: Celebrations Go-to-Market Go-Tos
message: I could not let this year wrap without saying a heartfelt thank you for the incredible energy and efforts you have put into the Life Events and Community Celebrations launches this year. You 3 have been my "go-tos" for everything customer facing...navigating customer targeting plans, helping to craft compelling stories, delivering demos together, continuously finding new ways to communicate the value, navigating pricing discussions, and so much more. Every challenge you've met with your full commitment and excitement for this product suite. Each phone call was never enough time given the sparks of creativity, insight and enthusiasm for the potential. I loved getting to know the 3 of you more personally and am so, so grateful we've had the opportunity to collaborate.

title: Dream Team
message: Team- what an incredible ride we have had this year!  When I think about all of the work we have done together, all of the groundwork we have laid, as a team, to create the iconic brand we know we are - I am in awe.  Each of you has stretched yourselves, tried new and intimidating tasks and responsibilities, and have never lost your grace and humanity. I am proud to work alongside you and to call you my friends.  Happy Holidays to you all.  Here's to an even better, out-of-this-world 2021!!

title: The Holiday Spirit
message: Amy, thanks so much for organizing a team holiday (virtual) get together. I loved making the flower arrangements and I‚Äôm keeping my fingers crossed that it lasts through Christmas. Also setting up deliveries for 10+ people with all different goodies to go all over the state sounds exhausting! I appreciate you taking the time to tailor these fun surprises to each person plus the holiday activity. Thanks again and happy holidays!

title: On Wednesdays, We Meet, We Talk, We Think, We Act.
message: And then we do it all over again the following week. I am grateful for your commitment to our Marketing Leadership call week in and week out. Sure, we might not have 52 weeks on the books for 2020, but we MOST DEFINITELY have twice that many hours and then some between our regular weekly meetings and our virtual offsite time together. Focus group of 1 here, but I find the time we spend together immensely valuable - hearing about what various teams are working on, gathering different points of view, discussing ways we can work better together, learning from each of you as subject matter experts and awesome marketers and humans...and last but not least, strengthening the connections between us even though we have been working apart since the early days of March. Enjoy a couple weeks off and we'll assemble again before you know it! THANK YOU!

title: Have time for a phone call?
message: Amy, thank you so much for the amazing collaboration this week. With new folks on your team and an evolving content team; I was concerned about the 2021 goals and ensuring we keep momentum. No hesitation, you made time for a call during your morning routine time to collaborate together and walk through concerns, talk through different perspectives and offer some actionable next steps. Thanks for being so willing to partner and just talk it out, you are an awesome colleague and friend!!

Enjoy a couple weeks off and we'll assemble again before you know it! THANK YOU!

title: Ready for a New Year!
message: Thanks to this very focused team of experts and leaders for creating something out of the tough 'hand' 2020 dealt us. Through all we've maneuvered through, I've consistently heard nothing but determination, strength, support for each other and for others, and a fierceness to overcome that is burned in my memory forever. As we 'close' out this year, you've once again dug deep and positioned us for more growth in 2021 though insightful planning and visionary thinking. Spending as much time as possible making things happen leaves little time for planning so all the more impressive how thoroughly you prepared to review action plans for each of your accounts. Thanks to our badass team of magicians, Traci and Rebecca for helping me pull off one of our greatest QBRs to date. Cheers to you all and to many more years of success together! You are all the magic of Christmas!

title: A Brilliant Refresh!
message: Thank you all for your collective efforts in refreshing the look and feel of HARMAN's Be Brilliant recognition site.  These changes have been pending since March and were finally revealed to employees on Monday as a kick off to their designated Month of Gratitude.  The hard work that goes on behind the scenes for something like this certainly does not go unnoticed and definitely deserves to be recognized.  And thank you especially for pivoting to accommodate the change to the image that came from me asking the question if what they were planning to use was the best representation of what they were trying to convey.  The site looks absolutely fantastic and will be a great backdrop for HARMAN as they get ready to turn monetary recognition back on in a few weeks.  So thank you all for an absolutely amazing and Brilliant Refresh!!!

title: Boldly going where no one has gone before
message: Thank you for your Enterprising collaboration on our IBM engagement plan. We've never gone anywhere quite like this before, and your bravery and creativity is just what we needed for this voyage! We had a key milestone this past week - sharing with IBM what we believe will drive engagement for them. Your collaborative effort was key to us putting our best foot forward. Thank you!

title: Lights, Camera, Action Groups!
message: Team - Z and I want to thank you all for your work getting the Pulse Survey Action Groups kicked off. Your ideas we so thoughtful and well crafted for the short window we gave you. We are beyond impressed! As Chris said, this is hugely important work and it is ongoing. We are excited to continue our partnership with you as we build and develop out these programs! We are grateful for you all!

title: Continuing to set the standard for greatness
message: I wanted to thank all of you for the amazing work you've done honing our message and user experience on the Workhuman Certified website. As we move forward with this initiative we are gaining so many insights through our data collection and market testing, and having an agile team ready to respond to these learnings is vital to our success. Each of you has shined in so many ways under a tight timeline to get this site ready for re-launch, not to mention having a major holiday right in the heart of our development timeline!

title: Grateful for all you do!
message: As this time of thanks rolls around, I wanted to express sincerest gratitude for you. Having worked together on recent projects I have seen how you go above and beyond for every task, which shines through the end results. Have a wonderful, happy and safe Thanksgiving. I'm looking forward to continuing to work with you in the rest of 2020 and beyond!

title: Fearless Captain
message: I am so thankful for your mentorship, leadership and direction. Things move quickly here and you're always available to answer questions, provide feedback and give guidance. I'm constantly learning new things from you and I am so grateful for everything you do. Thank you.

title: Grateful for the 'A' Team
message: Sending a heartfelt moment of thanks to this team of fierce friends. 2020 has been a test in many ways. The one thing that it has cemented for me is that the bonds that we make over time are clearly revealed in times of struggle. Thank you for your unwavering support of each other and the business through these many, many months of stress and hard work. Wishing each of you a day of rest and some time to reflect on your achievements thus far. I continue to be inspired by you and by the possibilities you see in yourselves and each other!

title: Fearless Planning!
message: Z and Amy - thank you both so much for the amazing work putting frameworks from Patti and Chris into action in our marketing planning process. This has been an immeasurable amount of work, and being remote without whiteboards and flip charts makes it all the more difficult. You both have taken this on and helped us all prioritize and make the time, all while developing a process that keeps us engaged, collaborative AND productive! I'm so thrilled for the alignment and stoked to see what comes in 2021 as move into hypergrowth-mode. Cheers to you!

title: Thanks for your commitment to this journey!
message: Huge shout out to our esteemed colleagues on the inaugural Experience Task Force team!   Thank you for all of your support, patience, persistence, passion, participation, and continued commitment to the journey we're on together.  We know that the road hasn't always been clear, and perhaps a little bumpy while we've figured out how to navigate, but we've gotten to our first set of priority ideas to tackle for the buyer journey, which is awesome progress.  And choosing ones for the end-user journey is within sight!  You are part of this team because of the perspective you bring to the table while still always having the customer at the center, and we couldn't be more grateful.  This image captures the spirit that this team has - and can't wait to see the fruits and nuts of our labor!  Thank you again for being on this journey and foraging ahead!   (And may you always appreciate our corniness along the way üòâ)  Sincerely,  Meghan and Alice

title: Lights, Audio, Action on the Big Stage!
message: Kevin, Amy, Jenna, and Jon - the Brene Brown webcast is a tremendous win for all of us.  The stage this represents for our brand is global and beyond the walls of industry.  The conversation topics are so right on and do a magnificent job of telling our brand story, starting with our founder. There is no better B2B tech company on the market than us.  You and your teamwork are instrumental in paving the path to let everyone know what it means to Workhuman!

title: Truly Excellent GE Meeting
message: Truly excellent call today with our partners at GE. You both brought your typical 'A game' and helped our buddy Phil and his new boss, Craig, really understand the value proposition of merchandise as well as the incredibly detailed data driven decisions we are making on behalf of their employees every day. I was so impressed as this conversation naturally unfolded to see Craig smiling, nodding, and gaffawing especially once Phil confessed that we had put his idea of S&H fees 'being too high' to bed. I also believe that by being prepared with the Brazil data on merchandise redemptions that we've opened the door to getting merchandise turned on GLOBALLY in the next year. WELL DONE! TGIF!

title: Customer Meeting
message: Cam & Steen,   Thank you for taking time to meet with one of our customers to help them understand the T&C's of their program. You both were extremely helpful, solution focused and Customer focused to ensure we were doing right by the customer.   The customer went away with a renewed appetite to get the most out of the program and we have some clear actions and plans to help them deliver on this.   Appreciate the support and help - Enjoy the award!!

title: Moonshots and scaling for growth
message: Thank you for bringing your whole selves - passion, creativity, focus, personality and intelligence - to our series of customer growth offsites.  Starting with moonshot thinking and doing the impossible  (the way appears as you start on the way), through investment prioritization and ending with business scaling initiatives, these past three sessions have uncovered many great ideas and plans. To gain this type of alignment and progress requires everyone to participate actively and to do so in the spirit of inter-dependence and collaboration.  You all definitely delivered on that and it sets us up well for 2021.  I'm proud to be alongside you on this journey.  Onward and upward!

title: 2021 Marketing Planning Pros!
message: So, we didn‚Äôt quite spend 6 hours together today but pretty close to it! Add in previous working sessions, the pre-work PLUS the work to come, and we will easily surpass that. BUT in the end, we'll be poised and ready to execute a solid plan for the new year. We appreciate your commitment to the 2021 marketing planning process. We‚Äôre taking a different approach this year and we‚Äôre coming close to the 10-month mark of working remotely during an epic year of CRAZY. With so many players involved, different points of view, and known foundational gaps like solid messaging ‚Äì (YES, we know, we know!)‚Ä¶it‚Äôs not an easy task. We are optimistic about the progress we‚Äôre making together. We are grateful for your focus on the end goal and how we'll get there. Thank you for partnering with us to sharpen our strategies and set our teams up to properly support the business in 2021. Onward we go! Z + Amy

title: Stepping up our PR game
message: Jenna and Amy, Amazing work in identifying 3 potential new PR agencies that can get us to the next level of brand exposure.  Your respect for urgency without losing your sense of value, perfection, quality, and raising our game is so appreciated. PR is the hardest of all Corp Comms jobs and it's only getting harder.   The two of you do the work of a team of 5. You help us learn and get better every day.  As a result, you are setting a solid foundation from which our brand will propel and excel.  THANK YOU!

title: Amazing Work on IBM Conversations Project
message: Team -  I wanted to take a moment and reach out to thank you all for the amazing and detailed work that has been done on the IBM Conversations project to date!  Even though we have a long way to go the client has already reached out and stated that this is the best project team and most smoothly run project by a vendor they have experienced in their time @ IBM!  What amazing praise from Simone!  Being on the semi-weekly calls and hearing the client enthusiasm as well as the Workhuman team knowledge and joy means that even though many of you are spending dozens of hours on this per week it will be worth it when we have an ecstatic client once the platform goes live!  Keep up the great work team!  So well done to this point!

title: Internal Community Celebrations launch!
message: To the Kool Gang who helped shape the vision of how we'd use Community Celebrations here at Workhuman, THANK YOU! Starting with ourselves as the earliest of early adopters means a lot of thoughtful decision making on everything from how our reasons and configuration will work to how we can communicate and support our humans to embrace this new offering most effectively. You embraced the opportunity to learn as we go and then you rolled up your sleeves. You configured, you provided insightful product feedback, you came up with great communications, and most importantly, you demonstrated terrific excitement, flexibility, and support for this new product launch. Thank you for being such a delight to work with on this exciting new milestone for the company!

title: Picking Up What They Put Down
message: Cam, I'm watching the recording of one of IBM's design session and I'm really impressed by the way that you take the information the IBM team provides, digest it, and send it back to them in a meaningful and strategic configuration option. You did this a few times. What we have consistently heard from them is the need to "slim down" options and ensure "behavior change". In talking about their Feedback and Goal types, you reminded them of this need and had them choose 2 options. When talking about nudges, you reminded the team of the purpose of nudges - the behavior changes they are looking for. I'm learning a lot from reviewing these recordings in how to ensure the client feels listened to and that we are meeting their needs!

title: Boston Chamber of Commerce Rock Stars!!!
message: All, I just wanted to express my gratitude and extreme pride in our performance as a panel for the chamber‚Äôs All in For Advancement program.  I am always proud of WH but it never ceases to amaze me what superstars we have as employees, how we are all aligned in what we feel is important and the warmth and authenticity we bring when we describe our mission as a team.  Terrific work all!

title: Supporting the Epicor AWS Migration
message: I wanted to thank each of you for supporting the migration of Epicor to AWS. It takes many folks to clear the way for a project like this, and this really was a cross-functional feast! Whether it was part of our Executive Steering Group, hands on support for the go-live weekend , or supporting key members of the team, you all played an important part in supporting the team to a successful go-live this past weekend.  Thank you for your continued support and commitment to our wonderful cross-functional team,  its very much appreciated.

title: Testing Testing Testing
message: Hi   I just wanted to say thank you so much for all the time and effort you have shared with the Epicor AWS Migration. Thank you for testing, logging in and verifications done on different environment. Also huge thank you for those employees who logged in over the weekend.  Enjoy

title: 5 Year Anniversary Video for ADP!
message: I wanted to thank you all for participating the video montage we created for ADP's 5 Year anniversary with Workhuman. The video came out AMAZING and we could not have pulled it off without all of you! We received such great feedback from the folks at ADP and it just goes to show the impact that human moments that matter have on our customers. Way to go team!!

title: Hello, it's me.
message: I was wondering if... you ever get sick of my emails? Since 2014, when a group of us first started planning this thing... Workhuman, I've created folders and spreadsheets in an attempt to track all the details. Fast forward to 2020 and I realize that was a good idea but would be an attempt at achieving the impossible. I would need humans to help me remember it all. (And, btw... when i say "ALL" - I mean the things in my world. Ha!) Well,  those humans are the two of you! Thank you for answering every random email with questions dating back to the beginning of Workhuman time. The latest one will be used in a meeting with new members of LinkedIn's leadership team - including the CHRO! You are the best!!!

title: Making Big Impact at GE
message: Sheri, it is not lost on me how much it takes to manage our GE relationship. It's basically 4 customers. So, when I see feed back from the Hd of People Operations, a very big voter, I'm blown away at how you are mindful of all the little details that make big impact. An incredible thoughtful video message with a celebratory tone that he'll be experiencing the new modern anniversary program that we've launched for them. Well played, my friend! His response "Now that is a nice touch, Sheri. I really appreciate you going out of your way to do this. It means a lot and you exemplify what it means to provide a world-class employee experience in a moment that matters! Thank you and have a great weekend."  You remain remarkable!

title: Link to the Weekly Activity Report
message: Conor,  thank you for your quick response last week in sending a sales team member the link to the weekly activity report ! Each quarter I send out the commission statements to the team, and they always  come back with challenging questions about the billings.  The hard part for me is that I can‚Äôt provide them with the level of detail they need in order to prove out the numbers for themselves.  By you providing the link helps to solve the problem (for the most part anyway)!  These reports have been a hot topic with the outside sales team lately and your willingness to provide it to him so quickly is appreciated!  Thanks for stepping in and lending a hand! I appreciate it very much!

title: The O-line of WHLOnline
message: Jill. When physical events were a thing, I don't think there was a single doubt in anyone's mind much you did, how hard you worked, and how high your bar of quality was. However, in the time of digital events......(where's he going with this)......NOTHING IS DIFFERENT. All your same amazing skills and talents were the offensive line of WHLO20. That means you do a lot of the hard dirty work to make things happen, but are not as often celebrated as such. Well allow me to take a moment and clear that up. You have a unique talent in that with high stakes, large budgets and costs, and complicated interpersonal relationships, you are un-phased. You do not panic. Your ability to stare down intense massive tasks and overcome with quality is translatable to damn near any industry. This company is so lucky to have you and for anyone who may not work in marketing or directly with you, HEAR THAT. Thank you for your work and being you.

title: Appreciation for this great team
message: Thank you all for your expertise in leading an important conversation with the OTIS program team.  We have been working with their team over the past few months on some open program questions, culminating in a call with their program leaders this week.  This involved a number of internal discussions as we've been looking at their program activity and how we can continue to lift up their recognition program.  Each of you were so helpful participating in the conversation as we are working to expand our relationship with the customer.  Thank you for your thoughtful expertise in navigating a few different unique topics in the client conversation, as well as working through some specific follow ups from the discussion.   It was a true team effort in showcasing to the client the power and expertise we can continue to bring as their recognition partner.   I thought this picture was a true testament in how our customers are at the heart of all that we do and you all clearly showed that.

title: A moment of surprise & delight for Sam!
message: Erin, Cam and Yvonne, thank you all so much for the thoughtful gift that came through the post this morning for Sam! When he burst into the room the other day asking me for a lollipop during our IBM steering group call, little did he (or I) expect a big bag of them to arrive at his door a couple of days later. To say he was thrilled is an understatement. I am worried though, that this has set a dangerous precedent of him just shouting his demands at the people on daddy's zoom calls and expecting the postman to follow through üòÜ Really thoughtful of you all though, thank again!

title: Inclusive of Merck
message: Sheri, we just got off an amazing call with Celeste Warren the CDO at Merck.  It was a fantastic meeting and we are already talking workshops and launch dates for them to use our Inclusion Advisor.  And you set it all up. Meetings like this don't just happen all in one 30 minute session.  It has been over a year that you were doing brand awareness with Celeste. And pre-positioning a "next stage" step with other Merck leaders.  You made sure we teased the value proposition for the Inclusion Advisor and recruited Aaron and Jeff to bring in Celeste. You coordinated all the pieces and our own executives to support today's meeting. Well done.  Textbook top account management.  It was a great meeting with clear next steps and you were the reason.  Excellent!

title: Congrats Workhuman Live Team!
message: Team ‚Äì A HUGE shout out to each of you for helping deliver a fantastic event yesterday. It truly was amazing! Your hard work and dedication to excellence have set a NEW example for everyone in our organization. I‚Äôm inspired by the ingenuity and creativity of everyone‚Äôs contribution ‚Äì planning, marketing, storytelling, vendor management, customer support, technical execution, and so much more.
