title: Calm and quality under pressure
message: Jill, as we quickly had to pivot from physical to digital events, I wanted to give you a shout out for never getting rattled and always finding the best solutions for the situation at hand. From agency and budget management (under the tightest of deadlines), to locking down major venues in record time, you always instill confidence in the team, helping to bring unique Workhuman stories to life on all the right stages. Thank you for being the consummate producer!

title: I'm not scared anymore.
message: Let it be known your presence is real. I remember thinking...I'm kinda scared of her. Not sure why. Maybe it was your ability to be so calm when everything is chaotic around you. Now I realize that is who you are.....when the there are 50 things flying around...you trust your team to get it done. I love that about you. Thank you for all the strategy, determination, and thoughtfulness you put into so many projects, efforts, life.

title: Office Hour Owners!
message: Amy & Jess, It's been so helpful to attend the recurring office hours you've both scheduled! Thank you for fielding everyone's questions (including a number from me:)) and ensuring we all have a good understanding of the book KWH book, WH Certified, and the new brand positioning! Love working with you both and look forward to continuing to see you at office hours!

title: Leading the Way to Certified Launch
message: Where would Certified be without you, Amy and Brian? Not launched today, that‚Äôs for sure!   Heaps and heaps of gratitude to you from me and Melanie for making this the success we know it will be. We appreciate that you both took this project so seriously from the start, believed in what it could be (showed us just how big it could be at times), and poured your hearts and souls into it. You‚Äôve worked tirelessly for months on this effort almost exclusively. For us, you‚Äôve been anchors, guides and champions at every turn.   We imagine that taking a new product to market might normally be equal parts product and marketing. With the nature of Certified, it‚Äôs fair to say that the scales might‚Äôve been tipped a bit in your direction. In truly unorthodox fashion, we even leaned on Marketing to help build part of the product itself, and you had the added nuance of stepping us through our first-ever go-to-market experience. I didn‚Äôt even know what GTM stood for when we started! We‚Äôve both learned so much from you and it‚Äôs been an absolute pleasure sharing the journey. The volume of tasks you‚Äôve managed, hurdles overcome, strategies brainstormed and executed, priorities juggled, stakeholders accommodated, and hours put in ‚Äì too many moments, too much output to mention, where your immense talent and commitment made good things happen. You guys are really, really good at what you do. Workhuman and the Certified team are fortunate to have you.  This has felt like a true partnership where we‚Äôve all been playing on the same team, aiming for the same win. We‚Äôll miss our 8:00 am Tue/Thu routine (or maybe not?). Thank you for being a highlight of the experience for us! Congratulations, Amy and Brian, on the launch of Certified!

title: GTM elevated to a new standard
message: Team, to say I am proud of each and every one of you for the work you did to bring Certified to market - well,  it would be an understatement.  In bringing this program to market, your commitment to success, to each other, and to our customers was visible. You drove never-before practiced approaches including taking integrated launch to a whole new level of collaboration and stakeholder management, you delivered incredible market research, a beautiful web experience, and so much more.  Congratulations to you.   I will miss our 8 am's!

title: HARMANizing Our Approach
message: What a great team effort this morning as we met with HARMAN to strategize on the approach to help them refresh the Be Brilliant program.  Sheri - thank you so much for pitching the idea to hold a Gratitude Summit which completely resonated with the HARMAN team and fits in nicely with their vision of declaring December a month of gratitude.  Your ideas, energy and flexibility during the call where fantastic.  And Maggie - thank you for sharing your perspectives having been part of the initial refresh conversations with the team and sharing all of the amazing templates that are being built out for the upcoming season of giving and the 2021 fresh start as well.  Both sets of slides were very well received by HARMAN and provided them with some tangible visuals to give shape to the conceptual ideas that they had started to formulate.  So thank you both for your teamwork and partnership.  We'll got a bit of work to do over the next few months & I look forward to diving into it with both of you!

title: Great virtual offsite!
message: Thank you for planning and managing a great virtual offsite yesterday. I know you all invested a lot of energy into making sure it was a good use of our time, and you created a great agenda for the day. It was informative, productive, interactive, actionable, and fun!  Looking forward to the next one!

title: Offsite virtually, but totally productive day IRL!
message: Team ‚Äì Thank you for your active participation in our 2nd planning ‚Äúvirtual‚Äù offsite. The energy level was high and the level of engagement and strategic thinking was strong. Patti and I are excited about the united approach to not only long-term marketing planning, but building a strong culture for the entire Marketing team where different points of view are embraced and we are continually testing new ways of working to optimize our contributions to overall business results. I‚Äôm genuinely excited to build on this shared momentum to bring our 2021 plans to life. With gratitude ‚Äì C.

title: New hire tips that resonate
message: Amy- I just wanted to tell you, that you new hire tip the other day about getting dressed for your work day really stuck with me. One of the hard parts of coming out of maternity leave into a WFH world is that its been harder to feel like ME again - without getting dressed and out of the house, and socializing in the office. I never left the comfort of sweatpants, that comes from being on leave with a newborn. I've started to make more of an effort to trade in my sweats for jeans (pre-baby jeans that FIT!) and hoodies for cardigans recently, and I can definitely feel a difference. Thank you for inadvertently helping me navigate through the identity crisis that comes with becoming a mom!

title: IBEC Diversity Forum
message: I wanted to thank you for taking the time to secure me a spot on the IBEC Diversity Forum. I know this can be very competitive, and I appreciate your support and endorsement. I 've already had my first meeting and chatted to key contacts. This was on my to-do list for 2020, as they have a great program with wide-reaching membership. Its a superb opportunity to showcase our thought leadership and innovation in this space. Thank you x

title: Encouragement for the Journey
message: I want to thank you all who have been involved in my recent filming for WH Live.   The content of this event is already remarkable, and the logistics of arranging online shoots that cover not only many states, but continents too, must I‚Äôm sure be quite a challenge!  But, in working with you all I am inspired by your cool heads, your co-ordinated teamwork, you‚Äôre we‚Äôll figure it out attitude, that‚Äôs OK we have options attitude‚Ä¶. I am assured that this is going to be great.  So in offering encouragement for the journey, look inside that word.. and I say - have courage!  I am confident the final result is going to be truly magnificent and will inspire many thousands of humans to make work more human.  Thank you Jill, James & Lauren, its always a pleasure to work with you.

title: Doing the dirty work
message: Let's face it, data clean up is no fun.  But, it's worth it!  Thank you for taking time out of your insane schedules to comb through data, find missing pieces and populate our tracker.  Becasue of your efforts we'll be able to get this into a centralized place - allowing us to work smarter and faster from here on out.  Thank you for rolling up your sleeves and getting it done!

title: What a Team, What a Q3!
message: Biggest of shout outs to this team of strategic thinkers and leaders! After a much needed 4th of July breather, this team came roaring back and starting blasting moonshots right out of the gate...securing meetings with some of our biggest customers to recruit them to be early adopters of our next gen DEI functionality, recruiting Pioneers for the WHCE, leading SO MANY strategic customer reviews with senior leaders, and killing it with multiple major deals! A team of super heroes! So proud of the work that you're doing and WE STILL HAVE ANOTHER QUARTER TO GO!

title: Inspiring INSPIRE
message: Sheri, Mark, Joyce and Erica,  We have just finished our briefing with Merck and what a wonderful job this team has done in partnership with one of the world's great companies. It's hard to believe how much the team members and executives gush about their relationship with all of you.  Not only did they nominate Workhuman for an Inspiring Workplace Award (which we won) but they called us out as the ideal kind of partner for Merck.  Here are a couple of direct quotes I noted today: "Of the 70 vendors we deal with, Workhuman is easily in the top 3"; and "deciding to work with Workhuman and create a recognition culture at our spinout Organon was by far the easiest decision we had to make of the 10,000 decisions we're going though".  Those are not just polite compliments.  Some companies don't get even one comment like that in their entire existence.  You inspired two in 30 minutes! It is a testament to the amazing work you are doing every day.  On behalf of all of us on the Workhuman team, thank you for representing us so well.  Great ambassadors. Well done team!

title: Best bandmates, evah
message: Brian, Amy, and Brenda, thank you for your partnership and collaboration as we work to bring all the moving parts together with an aim to change workplaces for good with the launch of Workhuman Certified in less than a month. Day in and day out, through the multiple meetings, emails, slack messages and hard work, your respect for teamwork - and good natured laughs and smiles - are unwavering. I couldn't ask for better bandmates. Now, fingers crossed we've got a hit record on our hands!

title: Momentum is Building!  Charter of Workplace Rights
message: Thank you all for your enormous contributions to making the Workhuman Charter of Workplace Rights a reality!   Over various starts (well over a year ago), pauses (CV-19) and re-directions, today was truly a unique moment where so much great progress and momentum was on display at our steering committee!    The logo, design standards, tone of voice, advertising styles, landing & welcome pages, application forms, why now, double clicks for more details by type, FAQ‚Äôs, links to the HUB, messaging live in the field being tested, a go-market-plan with dates set, 3 customers locked for interviews and certification celebration‚Ä¶and more!   On so many fronts, I see the momentum building and its building FAST!  This was always going to be a rush to the finish line as Covid upended all best laid plans!   But I sense we‚Äôre close‚Ä¶ more to do yes, but a final push now, and we‚Äôre ready to start charging the world of work for good, and our societies will be changed for the better too.  Thank you all for your role in this important mission!

title: The A-Team delivers for Cardinal Health
message: Team- when we found out, on short notice, that we needed to put together and deliver a formal RFP presentation to Cardinal Health, it quickly became apparent that we needed our best and brightest on this critical call. From strategy sessions and walkthroughs to the meeting itself, each of you delivered in a huge way. Jay, you provided a smooth and confident opening. Traci, your infectious energy and deep knowledge of Cardinal's history brought home our partnership with the customer. Cam, your targeted and detailed demo brought home key aspects of our platform. And Chris, you came over the top and brought the executive gravitas and passion that tied it all together. Through two plus hours you all crushed this presentation, and it was obvious that the customer was impressed. A huge thanks to all of you for this epic "A-Team" effort!

title: Let it shine. Let it shine. Let it shine.
message: What a week!  You both did an outstanding job, against A LOT of odds, to get some really good national coverage last week despite so very many limitations.  Thanks to you, not only is our brand name getting more and more play, we are also learning a tremendous amount about where we can really start to maximize our story to break into the news cycle.  Go team!  We have only just begun!

title: Looking both ways
message: We've got less days ahead of us than behind us on the journey to Workhuman Live Online. But there's no coasting downhill for this team. Some of the work is ramping up, some of it is continuing to speed along. You've all been putting forth your best efforts,  and many extra hours. The shared experiences build not only the event but also keeps the department strong. Cheers to you!

title: Crunch Time
message: Jill, thanks for helping to fill in the blanks and keep us on track when it comes to Sparks and their production requirements and deadlines. We‚Äôre handling each interview and video differently, which has added more moving parts. We‚Äôre also working with several different schedules and time zones. We‚Äôre at crunch time so I know it‚Äôs not easy to be making daily changes at this point. I appreciate your flexibility and keeping us aligned with the Sparks team.

title: Setting up camp on the Moon
message: The biggest of shout outs to this group of badass teammates! Talk about taking Moonshots! Each of you came together to influence directly, support, and create an lane for us to present the WHCE movement directly to the most senior executives at some of our most influential customers. While we have certainly had opening in the enterprise communications groups at customers over the years, I believe this opportunity/offer to amplify their employee brand with Workhuman is being met in a very different way in 2020. The reactions at Board level executives is 'absolutely!'. While some of their calendars could not support the October timeframe, I believe they will be clamoring to participate in on-going events. We're going to have to start reading up on Beyond the Moon Shots! We have created incredible relationships with Executive Communications leaders through this process...relationships that will make us unstoppable. Thank you for your collaboration, support, all-in attitudes, and LEADERSHIP! To the Moon and Beyond!

title: Do you sleep?
message: Amy, this appreciation moment is for you being a wealth of support at all times and hours. While I prefer not to Slack you or reach out after normal business hours, it happens and you‚Äôre always available. I greatly appreciate you taking the limited time you had today in between calls to walk through the flow of a deck with me only to rejoin the conversation once your calls wrapped for the day. Thanks for making the time.

title: It's TV Time!
message: Team - I wanted to celebrate your great teamwork, innovation, and sense of urgency to get our TV contracts over the goal line yesterday. This is an exciting new "first" foray into test two new media channels for us: Tradition TV and Streaming "OTT" (ya you know me). Thank you for your speed, openness, and willingness to work quickly with each other and network partners to hit our deadlines in advance of our first TV commercial tomorrow. With gratitude, -C

title: Amazing teamwork!
message: Thanks Martin for taking the lead on this and helping out a specific client case for Schneider-Electric on the returning of gift cards from Indonesia. To say it was complex would be putting it mildly but with your expert analytical skills they were put to the test, but you were not alone on this, you had a great team behind you, namely Conor and Tara advised about Rev Rec and clarified the process to minimize accounting entries, Sarah provided details about the returned cards, identifiable redemption order and the stock adjustments, Roberto refunded the identifiable redemption orders and cancelled the credit notes (and was very helpful with good information throughout!!) and finally Elaine created the credit note and checked with the Financial Accountants about the GL coding to use... So I just want to say thankyou to all of you for your great teamwork.

title: Re-Imagining What's Possible with Relationships!
message: Wow, Sheri you are a girl on fire! I feel like you have a poster in your office that says "Showing up in thoughtful, meaningful ways builds trust, trust builds relationships, relationships build business, and succeeding in business happens when you build connections and make others feel seen, heard and appreciated!" Yep, it's probably right next to the photo of your girls and dogs!   I've witnessed first-hand the phenomenal job you are doing with your laser-like focus on building strong relationships with Laura Cococcia, Head of Strategy and Program Management at GE corporate and her direct reports Megan Newhouse and Michelle Hafford. It's super impressive! You continuously create moments that matter for GE's senior leaders that are positively saturated with connection, value, insights and guidance.   Laura recently shared with you she was hosting two critical internal meetings 1. for GE's Leadership team and 2. for the HR Community of 250+ strong. You proactively identified ways for WH to help support these initiatives and organized a meeting to discuss. In advance of the call you spotted it was Laura's anniversary and arranged for the WH team to have a customized Happy Anniversary background. Laura was blown away at the start of the call, saying "No one remembered it was my anniversary except you." And it was obvious from the dialogue and her body language, you are someone she trusts, respects and looks to for strategic guidance! A major breakthrough at GE as we've been clawing for senior leader champions for years!  Talk about experience, you developed a meeting agenda to cover what was most important at this time as well as what's possible in the future. Two opportunities (1) Supporting critical internal meetings and (2) Sharing GE's story with the world. At the end Laura said "The presentation, content and examples were so customized, as if we sit next to them every day." What a testament to knowing our customers!! YOU ROCK!!

title: Supporting the AWS Analyst call
message: Thank you all for the support, answer edits and keeping me between the lines on the AWS Analyst call.

title: High Praise from GE!
message: Well done team for delivering a phenomenal customer experience for GE.  When speaking to Kostas recently, who was thrilled to be asked to talk to IBM by the way, he shared high praise for the work of this team!  He shared that he felt that you have demonstrated amazing partnership!  You have come to the table with ideas, data analysis, proactive recommendations to move the needle on their program, incredible flexibility, and unyielding support.  He asked me to please give a "Big thank you to the team" from him!  Thank you for delivering the Workhuman Experience!  I LOVE getting such high praise, especially when unsolicited and from such a great partner customer!  Well done!

title: Hello Workday!

title: The book is here!
message: Thank you, Amanda and Amy for quickly connecting with me to get the word out to employees about the book being out in the world and ready to share. You both quickly reacted and helped get a message ready to share with employees. Many thanks to you, Amanda, for collaborating in record time and posting the news to employees. As you can see from the reactions, a happy bit of news that people were excited to hear! Thanks so much.

title: Leading the way forward
message: Amy, your efforts around the Making Work Human book launch have been impressive to witness first hand! I admire what a good leader you‚Äôve been as I was onboarded to the project, which was full steam ahead! This launch isn‚Äôt to be taken lightly. There are dozens of moving parts and you‚Äôre on top of it all! I googled what it means to be a good leader and felt this was very fitting for you. Thank you for continuously providing clarity, being decisive, keeping everyone informed, being responsive, putting your trust in myself and the team, and doing it all using good energy which fuels others in a positive way.

title: Partner in Crime
message: Cam- this award is long overdue! I have to say, the team and myself would be lost without your constant and ongoing support! You have played such an instrumental role on so many customers, whether it be for contract negotiations, contract questions, new opportunities, saving businesses...the list goes on and on! You have been such an amazing partner, and I truly don't know what I would do without you. We have such a great rhythm going, and I look forward to partnering on many many more projects with you in the future! Thanks again for all that you do!!

title: Overdue gratitude
message: Cam, this recognition is sorely overdue. It has been a sincere pleasure working alongside you these past few months on countless new initiatives.  Life Events adoption. Subscription mix renewals. Center of Excellence. You grasp concepts right away and always, always make progress. No excuses. You find ways around, over or through obstacles and always bring positivity and creativity to every discussion. Thanks for all the great work and for keeping it fun along the way.  I'm grateful to be on the journey with you.  Well done!

title: Making it all about THEM
message: Thank you for meeting earlier this week to wrestle with the eternal question: "What matters most to senior leaders at our top accounts?".  The thoughtful, candid and creative ideas you brought to the table are going to help immensly as we develop the Insider Insights session for our key accounts.  And when we put customers at the center and consider their perspective, we guarantee success!

title: Masterful planning
message: We don‚Äôt often work together, but I have to say it‚Äôs been ‚Äúeventful‚Äù so far! Being a part of this team who are dreaming up new ways to create classy and engaging experiences while keeping it all virtual of course! You‚Äôve been very thoughtful ensuring you have the right program name, messaging, cadence, budget, timing, gifts, topics, and speakers. Great job thinking through all of these aspects on multiple events/series and working on things that are outside the box! People are eager to connect and take part in the topics you‚Äôre going to deliver. Way to make Workhuman a connection point for C-Level audiences. Can‚Äôt wait to hear how they go as they start rolling out!

title: 7 Habits ‚ÄìFramingham Graduates ‚ÄìClass of June 2020
message: ‚ÄúMOTIVATION is what gets you started. HABIT is what keeps you going." - Jim Rohn.   To appreciate and recognise our Framingham based humans' commitment, hard work and valuable participation, please join me in congratulating each of them for investing in their personal development and successfully completing ‚ÄòThe 7 Habits of Highly Effective People‚Äô programme this week.  On a personal level, it has been a genuine privilege to have guided you all through this course and I wish to THANK YOU for your determination, innovation, collaboration and above all, the kindness you showed to one another and to me.  In turn you helped create and nurture a positive environment of trust and respect, where everyone‚Äôs uniqueness was truly valued.   Habit 7 - YOU are your single greatest asset so continue to invest in your 'Four Dimensions of Renewal' because when your Body, Mind, Heart and Spirit are nourished, all four will flourish!  Thank you FRAMINGHAM :) Donna

title: Virtual Offsite - but 100% Productive IRL
message: Team - On behalf of Patti and myself thank you for a tremendous Q3 strategic planning and execution offsite last week. Both presenters and discussion partners excelled in their roles to communicate and strengthen existing plans. Your engagement and participation was locked in for the full session. And it's exciting to see this team rally around a new way of working that is oriented toward connecting business results to the strategic objectives of all our 2H initiatives within Marketing and across partner stakeholder teams. Thanks for leaning into the process - it's becoming a difference maker for us and helping us cut through our own noise! -C

Both presenters and discussion partners excelled in their roles to communicate and strengthen existing plans. Your engagement and participation was locked in for the full session. title: "Recognizing promise and progress"
message: Teamwork makes the dream work. There‚Äôs no "I" in team. Together everyone achieves more. The cliches are all true! Brenda and I heartily thank you for your tremendous partnership these past several weeks as we worked through and finalized the go-to-market assessment and integrated marketing plan for Workhuman Certified. While a tough process at times, you all persevered to ensure we had the right answers to why are we doing this; why should others care; why now; and the most important of all: is what we are doing really ready for prime time? The three of you have truly been the driving force, asking the right questions, choosing the right words and setting us down the path for success. I know our work is far from over, but we‚Äôve achieved a major milestone that will pave the way for so many other work streams to begin. Thank you your collaborative spirit and respect for teamwork. Brenda and I look forward to continuing this journey with you to help change the workplace for good!

title: With colleagues like you...
message: Z, Amy, and Chris - thank you for your leadership, preparation, and delivery of the amazing first Marketing Leadership Team offsite.  The agenda, format, pace, and time keeping kept us all focused on what is important: cutting through the noise so we can grow our customer base, our share of wallet, and our brand. Your dedication to our team and our mutual and individual success is inspiring.  Thank you for all you do for us.

title: Always willing to lend a hand!
message: Amy, you're always willing to make time to give advice, listen to ideas, help with questions and ensure we're putting our best foot forward. Your guidance is extremely appreciated and valued!

title: The Two Day ZoomBR Bonfire!
message: Thanks to this amazing team for two days (well, half days) of inspired thinking and planning in preparation for an amazing 2nd Half! As much as we missed the personal interaction and late nights, we managed to reconnect in a way that we really haven't been able to pull off in a few months! Special shout out to our Queen, Traci Pesch! She really knows how to inspire, engage, and fan the flames of success! Between Traci and Rebecca's creative minds we've got a great plan to find s'more ways to connect and create incredible experiences for our customers! And, looky here, we've got ourselves a marketing team! Thanks ever so much to the gods who sent us our fierce team in customer marketing, represented with the incredible Kristen G! A thoughtful, workable plan to bring our friends into the many cool streams happening in marketing. And lastly, thanks to all of you badass SCDs, always bringing the big ideas, shaking things up, pushing beyond your comfort zones and helping our customers do the same! I'm humbled and impressed every day to get to work with such a powerful group of people who do nothing but cheer each other on! Let's go light this thing up!

title: You are Certifiably AWESOME!
message: Team, this award could be given under any one of the Workhuman values. Despite set-backs presented by COVID-19, the mixed levels of Workhuman institutional knowledge, and with the advent of new GTM and Integrated Launch approaches, each of you lended your passion, your insights, and your voice to the holistic GTM Assessment phase.   The world's best and most innovative teams truly do Workhuman!  Onward!!!!

title: Yang to my yin
message: In Chinese Daoist thought, the yin and yang are used to think about how seemingly opposite forces may actually be complementary, interconnected, and interdependent. The yin embraces the moon, the passive, the emotional, and creativity while the yang represents the sun, the active, the rational, and planning. In a workplace, yin is all about learning, knowledge, discovery, and playing with ideas while the yang is brilliant with establishing markets and putting strategy and structure in place. Working more closely with you over the past few weeks I've seen how critical you are to taking the ideas and putting them into a structure that makes sense. You are the yang to my yin and I‚Äôm truly looking forward to our continued partnership to take all the ideas and learnings to the next level.

title: For supporting the IASA Web Summit
message: Thank you so much guys for all the help in promoting the IASA global conference. Public speaking at industry tech events is so important for everyone, and your support and guidance makes it 100 times easier.  Thank you for the social posts, the copy and all of the help and advice.

title: Measurement for success
message: A bit late but I wanted to thank you all for your dedication, collaboration, and teamwork as we solidified measurements for Awareness, Perception and Preference. Learning and listening to each other through every meeting, I saw such great passion for accuracy and full transparency in the unknown. We worked together to present solid recommendations, and received great feedback. With our next steps to operationalize, use Q1-Q2 2020 as litmus on measurements, and prepare for QBRs together we'll create the best measurable Brand marketing we've ever had. I couldn't be more proud of this team.

title: Listening Post
message: Amy, I wanted to recognize months of collaboration.  I know in your role as one of of the MSOs, you hear many voices every day. With that in mind, you take time to reach out and ask for input. (Even when you probably think I won't agree with you!)  I'm sometimes not the loudest voice in the room (call?) and sometimes I don't speak, even if I think I have something valuable to contribute.  As I continue to find my voice, your approach makes me feel valued, respected, and helps build the confidence I know I need to bring to everything I do.

title: Dig out
message: Conor thanks for all your help with fixing the digital cert issues I had with ROS. We had an important compliance deadline to meet and you went out of your way to ensure the return was filed and my access issues were resolved. I really appreciate you taking the time out of your busy schedule to help me.

title: Trusting the process!
message: Team - thank you for buying into and committing to the new process and approach we're using to develop an integrated and collaborative 2H Marketing Plan (ie., offsite, collaboration, data-driven goal setting, etc.). Because of your willingness to lean into this new way of working we've been able to advance new creative, powerful, innovative ideas for 2H digital programming, virtual engagements, and WHL-S that tap into the zeitgeist, create urgency, represent that Companies that thrive Workhuman, in a way that is unique to our Brand and business. With gratitude, Chris & Patti

title: Making an IMPACT Every Day!!!
message: Sheri!! Your tremendous imagination + determination has lead to extraordinary amounts of IMPACT with GE. It's not easy working with large, complex, multi-national companies in-constant-change but you grind every day and make great things happen!! I think you've morphed into GE's company mission of 'building a world that works' with an ending of 'for humans.' That's right every day I see your commitment to building a work that works for the 275,000+ humans at GE! A few impactful milestones in the last several months span most people's entire careers! Design Labs for every IFG to reset on philosophy, what good looks like, how to get there, and actionable next steps. These efforts resulted in an immediate relaunch of GE Healthcare's program aligned with their new Leadership Behaviors and enabling new program features, GE's attendance at the Unilever event in London, a Gratitude Summit for GE Renewables Total Rewards team, then a training for Renewables 10,000 People Leaders, meetings with Laura Cococcia (Head of People Strategy) from GE Corporate, migration of GE's traditional 16 year old year service program with us to Service Timelines! Say what?? Yep, finally after doing the hard work, consistently reminding GE leaders of the value of Service Timelines, sticking to the every day grind, GE migrated to Service Timelines!! A huge milestone. Do you know a pandemic is happening in the world? You're unstoppable!!! GE can't guzzle enough of your high energy drink called "lower value awards given more frequently" ... or let's call it a Sweet Social Sensation by Sheri!! GE's HR executives are ordering doubles and wiping out the mindset of recognition for 'above and beyond' efforts only and rallying the troops around every day gratitude mantra! I'm in awe of how your imagination and determination is your "True North". You work with purpose, you dream big, you set high standards and you make an IMPACT!!! You Rock!!!

title: The future is now. The future is working human.

Yes, we've been grinding the last two weeks, but we are on the precipices of exciting concepts that will propel our brand and business forward. Keep pushing, we're nearly there. With gratitude, -C

title: Pioneers Unite!
