Thank you for 100% commitment to this session and the ensuing outcomes. Lots of powerful thinking and actionable next steps to fuel our high growth, marketing making, and bleeding edge tech company and brand. With gratitude,  -C

title: The future is now. The future is working human.
message: Team - this group has been the nucleus for "what's next." You've ripped up and thrown away the rule book for what was. You've embraced the freedom, liberation and inspiration that comes from having a blank sheet of paper to operate from. Yes, we've been grinding the last two weeks, but we are on the precipices of exciting concepts that will propel our brand and business forward. Keep pushing, we're nearly there. With gratitude, -C

title: Pioneers Unite!
message: Team - Thank you for your unyielding focus and energy in our "first ever" digital planning session for 2H '20 and Oct WHL-S initiatives. This was an epic-ly long virtual offsite that uncovered and unlocked critical new and innovative thinking for representing our solutions as "essential" and "compelling". Thank you for 100% commitment to this session and the ensuing outcomes. Lots of powerful thinking and actionable next steps to fuel our high growth, marketing making, and bleeding edge tech company and brand. With gratitude,  -C

title: The firsts!
message: Ryan and Sheri, hats off to you both for being the first to try out our new award templates with your customers. Being the "first" always carries some risk but you both got a hold of these new asset and immediately saw the opportunity and took action. I LOVE THIS! Awesome job! I can't wait to hear what their feedback is!

title: Smooooooth transition
message: Katie, Amy, and Dario - thank you for making the transition of paid social to Customer Marketing so seamless.  You came together to create a solid plan that sets us up for continued success and exponential growth.  Although our structure is now different, our opportunity to grow together and create magic in our market is better than ever before because of the three of you.  THANK YOU for all you do.

title: Such a great partner!
message: Amy, thank you for looping me in early on the momentum press release and for getting me up to speed on all that was happening. You were a great collaborator with me in finalizing the internal comms plan to share the news. I'm thankful for your review, advice, and support in finalizing all the messaging. And, for all the laughs along the way!

title: We will have Customer Success opportunities...
message: Team, I wanted to thank you for all your time, insights and iteration to get us to a point where we can start to outline pipeline management in Customer Success. As they say, our ideas together are better then anyone‚Äôs individual thoughts and this is just another great example of this mindset in action. You all had ideas which where built upon to build a foundation of the ‚Äúthree stages‚Äù we will be able to capture in SFDC and broadcast automatically via emailed dashboards. Thank you for all your ideas and open minds to bring us to such a place. Together we can and will change the world one employees, one program and one opportunity at a time!!!

title: The July 4th event: Email Edition!
message: Thank you to this incredible cross-functional team for all of the work that went into producing our first ever cross-company email promotion!  Leveraging all of our learnings from our marketo redemption reminders from the first half of this year, I'm thrilled we were able to pull together this first ever "promotional holiday" campaign and learn about the opportunity to market a retail event happening on the store across a number of our customers.  From build the content, to building out the assortment on site, to securing promotional pricing, to coordinating with customers and gaining their buy in to preparing the data and lists for this massive send, it would not have been possible without your dedication to this next phase of email testing.  I'm super excited to track results, and look forward to next steps.  Thank you!!

title: Press Coverage
message: What a great first week of the Momentum release! Congrats to you all for an incredible level of coverage and interest. It certainly feels like a real breakthrough in the Irish media. We‚Äôve never had this level of recognition and depth of coverage. We also covered all the basis with meangingful coverage in all the right online and offline publications, subscription services and radio stations. Well done!

title: Audit committee meeting a success!
message: Thank you for all the efforts over the last month(s) to get through all the work to gest us to the cusp of issuing our 2019 financial statements.  The audit committee was very pleased with the progress and results.  It has been a team effort to accomplish this and we will all need to celebrate (virtually for now) when the final audit sign off comes shortly!

title: Cutting through the noise
message: PR Team,  I am so proud of the work you have done for the transaction.  Your maturity, persistence, and commitment to excellence despite the many speed bumps and challenges that we know as the reality of PR, demonstrates perfectly that imagination, determination, and resulting innovation that is so critical for our amazing brand. The sky is the limit for what we can do together.  Thrilled with your work and honored to work with each of you!  Congratulations on a great release week!

title: A to Z and back again
message: Amy - this has been a long time coming but I wanted to say thank you for your partnership. I value the collaborative relationship we've built over the last several months as we have linked arms to lay the foundational groundwork for our MSO functions. We still have a long way to go but I am grateful that I have the opportunity to be in this role with you by my side. It feels good to know you have my back and I have yours and when we can't both be involved in a meeting, project or task, we can count on each other to "cover" and run with it. I had a rough April with two major losses in my family and you were there for me...checking in to see not only how I was feeling but asking what you could take off my plate, insisting that I lean on you so I could heal. I can't tell you how much that meant to me. As we start to put more disciplined marketing planning in place, we constantly ask ourselves, how can we streamline the process, become more efficient, tell a more cohesive story, future proof our programs? I appreciate the iterative approach we're leading together and am genuinely grateful to have you as a partner and friend. Thank you!

title: Day in the Life!
message: Cam, thanks so much for taking time out of your day to join the customer marketing team call. With some new folks on the team, hearing about a 'day in the life' of some of our stakeholders is so helpful. Appreciate you sharing your background, focus areas and taking time for questions! Thanks for being such an awesome teammate!

title: M-S-Oh ... My!
message: Amy, Z - Thank you for leading an outstanding Marketing Strategy and Ops discussion today. I know Patti and I are excited to have your leadership and organizing skill set to help drive transformation. By anchoring around KPIs, Key Initiatives, and a Prioritized Marketing Calendar you are helping us build necessary rigor and discipline to unlock the full potential of our world-class Marketing engine. Thanks for leading from the front. Excited about what's to come. With gratitude, -C

title: Doing Great Things
message: Amy - There is so much I want to say in reflecting over the last two weeks of getting to work with you but, I will focus on this: YOU ARE AWESOME!! Thank you so much for taking the time to listen, to learn, and above all else to guide me in the right direction with a growth mindset. I've already learned so much from you and feel empowered to do things.. GREAT things that will take our social media presence to the next level while contributing to business objectives. Looking forward to the future and so grateful to have your support and leadership!

title: Warrior Ethos
message: Sheri! So many congrats on yet another hard fought victory at Synchrony. It's not just that this was a hard fought competitive win vs our very aggressive competitors, it's that it is your 3rd since December! The scenario is always tough, new decision makers, no experience with us, no idea what their strategy has been or really any history with the program at all. Now throw in a pandemic, stay at home stresses, GE and the various projects you are juggling, and several other strategic accounts. Very few people could handle the pure insanity let alone be successful at every turn. I've been so impressed with your ability to connect, inspire, and close so many senior leaders and procurement people. Congratulations on this battle, you are one bad mothah!

title: #WeWorkhuman
message: Amy, thanks so much for putting together an eventful team day on Friday. We started off with a strategic meeting to align on priorities and metrics as a newly formed global comms and social media team. We ended the day with a (global) scavenger hunt that allowed us to get outside. With kids, parents, and pets in tow we discovered and shared our most scenic views and more. During my adventure, I even found a community garden that I had no idea existed. I guess that‚Äôs what happens when you get outside and explore! On behalf of the entire team, thanks for an impactful day!

title: Customer insights
message: Thank you for joining SLT today Conor and sharing the analyst's view of the world. When I reached out, there was no hesitation, even though it would be 5pm on a Friday. The team found it very enlightening, and based on all the questions they asked, they were very engaged. It was helpful to go through the information hearing your point of view...what you look for, what are signals to call out, why you look at those. For many, it was new information, and it gave great insight into the health of our business.  When you popped on the screen in the suit and tie, it was the ice cream on top of the cake. Game, set and match! Thanks Conor!

title: Successful start to our DentaQuest
message: Cam & Erica, we made an excellent team over these past few weeks as we prepared for DentaQuest's first ever program review - and it resulted in a powerful, effective meeting with the client. We had the rare opportunity of being able to meet with their CHRO and other key executive stakeholders to learn more about their initiatives and perception of their program, educate them on what we're seeing in terms of the impact of recognition and share insights around how program is performing. Cam, you did an amazing job of compellingly detailing the Workhuman story, outlining our various solutions and promoting all of the insightful analyses we're capable of conducting. Erica, you piqued their interest with your analysis around the clear turnover reduction they've enjoyed via the program, and how employees with the most diverse mix of giving and receiving across colleagues and managers resulted in an increased likelihood of DentaQuest retaining them. Thank you both again for all your hard work. With your help, we delivered an effective message they they were clearly engaged in, and I'm excited by the potential of growing this relationship with them further!

title: Partner in Crime
message: It seems like not a day goes by where I am not reaching out to get your opinion or collaboration on something.  Jill, thank you for your partnership.  We‚Äôre making a lot of difficult decisions these days ‚Äì often with more assumptions than hard data because everything is in a state of change and uncertainty.  You always have such great insights and a ways of evaluating a situation that helps us create scenario options and puts us on the best possible path forward.  You help me be better at my job ‚Äì and I could not have asked for a better partner in crime.  Thank you!

title: Wow
message: Team, I was reviewing all of your progress updates for top accounts early this morning and I have to say that the work this team is doing is fantastic.  So many different variables are involved in these huge, complex accounts but each of you is on top of your accounts in such a strategic way.  Whether it is new growth in thriving accounts like bulk uploads, new sales incentive programs and retirement/milestone awards or just the right amount of surrounding for those accounts in temporary suspension.  This "in the trenches" work is so critical to the health and growth of both our business and the lives of the employees at your customers.  They need it more than ever right now.  Bravo and well done!  And special call out to your fearless leader Eileen who is leading from the front with a huge dose of imagination and determination.  Happy Monday!

title: A calendar a day...
message: ... Might not keep the doctor away, but does help us be organized as a leadership team! Amy, Z - thank you for being relentless in your pursuit of our shared marketing calendar for town hall today. This is the critical example of discipline and organization we need to accelerate progress and balance smart trade offs in the ever-evolving market we exist - thank you for leading the way and setting a great example for the team. With gratitude, -C

title: Valuable Leaders Share Knowledge
message: Amy, I wanted to say thank you for all of the knowledge you've shared with me over the last few months. Even as we transitioned to remote working, you never missed a beat to identify areas where you can lend support. You‚Äôve taken my 6:30 p.m. calls to help review work even though that‚Äôs vital time with your family and girls. You have shared media interview tip sheets and training so I can ensure important conversations stay on track around our messaging and main points. You always keep an eye out for interesting speakers and call for papers forms to send to me. There are too many examples to list but thank you for always sharing your knowledge and experiences so that we can all continue to grow.

title: Monthly Reporting
message: Well done on another great monthly report Conor! I have to say, it's been wonderful to see these evolve over the years. It used to be a dump of data, but these days we are getting a little of the Conor personality between the numbers. It's getting more like a fireside chat with an analyst! I love it. Thank you!

title: Telling a Cohesive Story!
message: Amy and Z - wanted to thank you both for the great work you do each week to roll up the director updates into a thoughtful and cohesive story for Chris and Patti to share with the larger leadership team. It's not easy taking all that content and weaving it together quickly and efficiently; making it look easy!!!! Thank you for all you both do!

title: Shepherding Thank You Healthcare
message: Amy - You have done a wonderful job steering the Thank You Healthcare program, developing cross-functional plans with all of our marketing stakeholders. The program has been a unique one, targeting consumers for the first time in Workhuman history! This has not deterred you and you see the opportunity in every turn. Thanks for your leadership!

title: Cut the cord!
message: Thanks Rich, Lauren, Cam and Hari for your all the quality work, help and assistance each of you provided to get us to this momentous day.  We received official notice today that Lam Research officially shut down their old program as part of the schedule to turn on their new and improved Above and Beyond program in June.  Cam and Hari you were pivotal in getting us into contract and Rich and Lauren you took the ball and seamlessly put our client on the path to delivering their vision for their 10,000 employees around the globe.  Thanks so much for all of your efforts.

title: Making a BIG Impression
message: Sheri, Traci, Erica & Maggie - thank you for your partnership over these past few weeks on our Biogen Site Refresh Strategy presentation. While upgrading their BIG recognition site was the original impetus of the meeting, this was also a crucial opportunity to get in front of Justin Fossbender, the Executive Sponsor and owner of their BIG program and share our latest and greatest insights on the positive impact of social recognition. We hadn't been able to speak with Justin and other key stakeholders for quite some time, and the hard work you put in enabled us to deliver the key data and ideas that will grow Biogen's already high-performing program. Sheri, you expertly laid the foundation for the day's discussion by allowing Justin & team to communicate their 2020 people strategy, and then layered that into your outline of our current insights and solutions. Traci & Maggie, as always you impressed with your convincing content and enthusiastic approach towards explaining the philosophy of working human and how it's changed (and continues to improve) the way we work. Erica, your Biogen-specific insights around turnover and how organic recognition has seen some positive post-pandemic growth was crucial to the meeting, and clearly caught Justin's attention. It's data like this that will help us keep a strong foothold with him and drive our initiatives forward - running deeper analyses, refreshing/relaunching their site and then hopefully adding items such as Life Events and Service Timelines. Team, everything's on the table thanks to each of your contributions. Thanks again.

title: Supporting external speaking engagements
message: Amy and Rob. Thank you both so much for the support you have given in both presenting and helping prepare me for external speaking engagements in the last month, both with Atlantec Festival and the upcoming opportunities in Dublin.

title: Board slide prep
message: Thank you for pulling together all the board slides in a timely manner with all the other priorities going on.  In the middle of the switch to the new revenue recogntion standard it is a challenge to report under both the old and new accounting policies while keeping the auditors happy (if that is even possible) and busy so we can get through the final stages of the audit.

title: Strategic guidance at its best...
message: Team, on behalf of the Here to Help Team I wanted to thank you for your strategic partnership during the initial phases of scoping, outlining and ultimately standing up a pilot we now refer to as Operation Here to Help.  Each of you brought unique perspectives, questions, challenges and guidance to ensure we have a robust plan in place with qualitative metrics to measure success during this first phase and beyond.  We are excited to cautiously move forward knowing that we have a great Team supporting us throughout the journey.  Thank you so much for your time, attention and thoughts as we navigate through this "gate" and many more to come!

title: Dream Team
message: I just want to take this moment to pay homage to this team of fierce, talented leaders for their focus and resilience during what is sure to go down in history as one of the most stressful times in world history. It's been quite an experience for each of us during this pandemic both from the work perspective and the 'outside of work' perspective. Each of you has been laser focused on the opportunity this situation created for our business and each of you have created opportunities out of this situation for the business! I'm so humbled by the never-quit mentality that you have lead with and continue to lead with in this environment. The impact you have made on our business at this moment is astounding. Thank you for the sacrifices, determination, support for each other, humor, and grace you have shown these past few months. It's pure joy to work with you!

title: Master Level Skillz
message: Sheri, I just want to call out the master level pricing conversation you lead with our customer last week. I was in awe watching you work your strategy and 'the room'. Your experienced positioning, messaging, determination, and poise were at a 10! I witnessed the full transformation of the customer from defensive to educated and gracious. We have a ways to go but I am confident that you are the kind of leadership that inspires the best thinking and decision making at our customers. Bravo!

title: Hey, how are you with v-lookups?!
message: Ha. Cam. I think you might actually block me on Slack! Thank you for ALWAYS being there to offer a helping hand, no matter what RANDO question I might have for you. Today's feature at 7:30 AM, v-lookups! I sincerely appreciate your help, ability to talk through challenges and always come with a solution mindset, you are the best teammate, thank you!!!

title: Fierce commitment to urgency
message: "We are now faced with the fact that tomorrow is today. We are confronted with the fierce urgency of now. In this unfolding conundrum of life and history, there IS such a thing as being too late. This is not time for apathy or complacency. This is a time for vigorous and positive action." - MLK JR.   Team, since I started just over a month ago, I have heard from many of you and our stakeholders who have talked about the misfortune of joining Workhuman during a global pandemic that has changed every thing about how we live: from how we interact, to what we spend our time and money on, what we value, and how we work.  The truth is, there was no better time for me to be able to witness the magic that is Workhuman. We already know what is important and that is human connection. What you have demonstrated is humanity during a time of extreme urgency - a rarity in life and certainly in business. Thank you for your passion for your and your commitment to each other and our stakeholders.  I am honored to work alongside each of you.

title: Moodtracker Launch success!
message: Team ‚Äì Thank you for delivering our brand new Moodtracker product. Thank you so much to everybody for the amazing work on the Moodtracker product. Hard to believe this was just an idea at the beginning of January. Since then a team has formed, the product designed, architected, built, tested, branded, communicated, marketed and launched. Whew. The speed at which the groups collaborated is a tribute to the sense of camaraderie and positivity we have at Workhuman. The energy, imagination has shone through in every way. This coupled with the determination to deliver a world-class product means that today we have a sixth edition to our Workhuman Cloud suite. Welcome Moodtracker. On behalf of all of the humans in the company, thank you. Eric.

title: The Social/PR Powerhouse behind Moodtracker GTM
message: Amy, Jenna, Katie, Holly, Max, Roshni and Dario, this was my first chance getting to work with a lot of you, and I can‚Äôt thank you enough for the amazing work you‚Äôve done getting our message out to the world for Moodtracker and the Workhuman Livestream post event strategy. I feel like I learned a lot from each of you about the process and best practices for getting these ads into market on a variety of platforms, and I‚Äôve been so impressed with your creativity and professionalism during these campaigns. I know this is only the beginning, but I can‚Äôt wait to see what we‚Äôre able to pull off in the weeks to come!

title: Leading The Way...
message: A big thank you Conor for your strong leadership in the last few months, particularly given the turbulent times we are now working through. To begin you have allowed for the flexibility that myself and each team member need personally, and while doing so making sure we are all supported and connected in these times. You have led us through our busiest time of year, what with closing out both the year end audit, and (for my team) the 606 project. In particular for 606, you guided us as team through a 2 year long project that has now crossed the finish line. Your vast knowledge of the US GAAP process was a key contribution to making sure the model operated correctly, you constantly challenged us in terms of the whys and potential gaps, supported us with clear guidance, and kept us in check for timelines and milestones throughout. You allowed the space for us to step away from other areas, which was key to ensuring we had the capacity to make sure this was executed to plan. I for one look forward to when we can toast these achievements back in Dublin some day. Thanks again for all your support in these times.

title: Quick reaction and support
message: Team: Thank you SO much for all your help in getting things sorted yesterday and today with the demo site. Brian: you quickly reacted to a ticket when I needed some site clean up of an image which I was unable to rectify myself. Dan, you helped make some quick configuration changes to support my talk track and helped loading enough content to show off the richness of the experience. Cam and Erin, you both jumped in with advice from when you did it and also were happy to lend a last minute hand in adding comments and content.   These things take a village...and I'm happy to be surrounded with such great coworkers and support!!

title: 43 slacks in 19 minutes - that's some data
message: Yes, that's what you did together. Members of the whl-stream-tech channel - between 1:00 and 1:19 you urgently yet calmly worked together to troubleshoot, problem solve, implement, and communicate a workaround. I was watching you. You saved the day because you worked together and responded decisively. Sweat and tears, and a whole lot of teamwork.  Not to imply there were not many backup plans and scenarios discussed in advance because there was no shortage of that. But when the moment came, decisions needed to be made, action needed to be taken... and you did all that. Kudos.

title: WHLive Stream Core Creative
message: Team, I gotta say when this project dropped on us with the deadline it had - I was shitting my pants.  But after a few days of early conversations and landing on some form of a concept - you started bringing it to life.  Early keynote graphics, scripts and show flows, injection of entertaining segment that made/didn't make the cut,  locking down speakers and schedules, communicating to the execs our executional needs, and the list goes on and on.  It started coming together piece by piece, hour after hour, and then we started figuring out how to steer the project.  I started to feel confident about it.  Live stream vendor was locked.  Content was getting locked.  Filming was locked.  At 12:30pm on 5/12 I hit the equivalent of a big red button and we were broadcasting to the world.  In less than 6 weeks you created a F^*$ing movie. And we didn't want to fight each other after!  I have never done anything this big in such a short time in my career, and I am a grizzled veteran of this world. What a team.  Wouldn't trade it for anything.  Thank you.

title: Keeping Humanity Alive with Live!
message: Team ‚Äì Thank you for delivering a high quality, compelling, on brand, and ‚Äúof the moment‚Äù digital event. In less than six weeks you expertly pivoted from the cancellation of our physical events in San Antonio and Dublin and leaped into bold new thinking that resulted in our Workhuman Live Stream event. You were fearless in pursuit of our audacious goal of 10,000 registrants and charged furiously at it ‚Äì obliterating the goal and achieving more than 15,000+ registrants. This level of success took thoughtful planning, decisive and quick action, creativity, and relentless outreach to secure exceptional guest speakers, high profile customer stories, and new sponsorships. There was clear demonstration of teamwork, resilience, grit ‚Äì and quite a bit of ‚Äúgood cheer‚Äù across this group. It was an example of Workhuman at our best. This is a significant achievement in the company‚Äôs history and will continue to pay dividends in the following areas: Social reach; The launch of our new products like Moodtracker; Deepening existing customer relationships; Establishing strong new footholds with future customers; And growing profitably. My hat‚Äôs off to you all ‚Äì when Humanity needed us most ‚Äì you all rallied to give Humanity the company it needed now more than ever. On behalf of the Leadership Team and myself, Thank you - Eric

title: All the right things in all the right places
message: The Workhuman Livestream is going live tomorrow!!! There have been so many moving parts, who is involved? where will it live? when will we have approval? what about follow up? is that contract signed? This group has kept up with every turn, crazy leap, and last-minute "yes, and..."! I cannot thank you all enough for how on top of everything you have been. I feel like the whole team was kept in step and it has been because of your constant communication, reminders, and check ins! We are in the home stretch!!! Thank you!

title: How to Build Connection 101
message: When a customer doesn't 'do' video, how do you show them who you are? Talk about a game changing powerful idea! Shouting it out to this GE dream team for inspiring us all to make the connection and unabashedly share who we are no matter the technology! What an incredible Moment that Matters!  I JUST LOVE IT!

title: Our Survey Says - You are Fantastic!
message: Colleen, Amy & Niall, I wanted to thank you all for all of the support you gave me recently with my dissertation research. I really appreciate you taking the time to review the survey, it was great to get all of your input, and and I'm really thankful for all your help in getting this approved. Thanks again :)

title: Spotlight Speaker Success Stories
message: Team - thank you for stepping into the spotlight during our last three marketing town halls. You‚Äôve shown at an exemplary level of innovation, determination, and grit amidst our new normal. You‚Äôve conveyed your success stories (Merck webinar, Keeping work human series, and WHL) with an awesome combination of humility and accessibility. Thank you, thank you, thank you for being leaders of the moment and in the moment. The best practices you‚Äôve shared and modeled to achieve such high levels of success are great guideposts and shining examples of a high performing culture ! Well done and with gratitude, -C

title: Wait! Was that really only 90 days?!
message: Team - Thank you for making this next phase of our journey and evolution together as a team so successful! Lets just say the first 60 day together were much different than our last 30 days together(ish)! Wanted to celebrate all we‚Äôve done together in our first 3 months as a team. Attached is my quick recap and where I see us delivering results in Q2. Thank you, I‚Äôm truly appreciative of all you do!  With gratitude, -C

title: Leadership, Guidance, Support
message: Amy - I am grateful for your leadership, especially over the past weeks. Thank you for checking in with me every week and for bringing the team together to make sure we all stay aligned. You've managed to keep us all informed as priorities shift, you've kept it real and kept it positive - which I appreciate. Most recently, you provided helpful guidance to help me navigate a couple of challenges I was facing and provided a helpful bigger picture as well. I know it can't be easy leading others while balancing so many big initiatives, but you've stepped up to that challenge and I'm so appreciative. Thank you!

title: Closer together than ever before
message: This might sound crazy, but, somehow I feel that Although Covid-19 has put distance between us, we seem to be working closer together. We have had 3 meetings a week for 6 weeks now, where, there is no real agenda. Instead, we utilise this time to hear what is going on with each of our teams, HR and executive level. Every decision we make, we make it as a team, this means we are aligned quicker. Each task we complete, we share templates, have discussions, figure out how to put our best foot forward and seem to stay ahead of the game. I have benefited so much from our meetings and wanted t take the time to thank for all for the contributions.

title: Finally across the finish line
message: Guys, I want to thank each one of you for your contributions in the recruitment process for the AR collector role we have had open since October. We have seen over 120 CV's had about 25 first-round interviews and maybe 5 or 6, 3-hour interview slots. We brought it down to 2 candidates both with strengths in different areas and finally, we have selected a candidate that we believe will be not only a culture fit but also really enhance our stakeholder relationships along with everything else. Your continuous feedback helped us to get across the line. I appreciate the time that you all put into this as I know it can impact your daily tasks. Thanks all!

title: Audit Over
message: A huge thank you to everyone involved in the 2019 Dublin audit. This is a key annual deliverable of the finance team, a 5 week process that is one of the busiest and most demanding times of year for us all. Each one of your has contributed to this, in collating schedules, reconcilations, support documentation, analysis, detailed explanations, walkthroughs, memos, attending meetings and calls, answering queries and much more. Whatever EY asked, Finance answered. In particular this year, we had the added challenge of corona virus disruption, and performing a number of these weeks remotely. The face to face in the office with EY was removed and replaced with emails, skype calls and catch ups. As a team, each of you rose to the challenge showing perseverance and determination, providing all necessary requests, as per original timelines, with no delays. This is quiet an achievement as is a balancing act in itself to manage this, all the while keeping day to day activities running smoothly. And doing so in these challenging times, shows that as a team, when we all work together, we achieve success. Well done to you all. May we celebrate in person some time together in the future!

title: Livestream Launch!
message: I was going to find an image of a nice stream for this recognition, but the way this team came together and launched ‚Äì with immediate results (more on that below) ‚Äì a rocket made more sense.  We have been in a hurry up and wait, start and stop process on bringing a digital/live stream event to market for a bit now.  In the past few weeks it all started to come together, and this past weekend it all really came together.  Our band of weekend warriors once again rallied to pull everything into place and then dragged many more souls into the battle for a rapid Monday launch.  With Dianne at the helm providing impeccable project management and, might I say, a few beatings we were all kept on task.  Jen, Chris, Kevin, and Jay ‚Äì you were right there every step of the way on design iterations and animations.  Owen, you‚Äôve been a master of the nuanced wordsmithing we‚Äôve needed on this.  Matt, Biz, Geoff and Mark ‚Äì you built, staged, tested, and launched all new site pages and elements in almost no time at all.  Your work set-up for a great launch ‚Äì where we dragged in Anthony to build, test, and deploy our emails with about an hours time from asset to release.  Rob and Roshni jumped in to iterate social/digital and bring us live globally.  Colleen, Anne and Jess pulled the enablement tools and comms together and put them in everyone‚Äôs hands to help us all share and promote the program.  Mike and Lauren working the external networks to amplify and extend reach.  And Jill.  Maintaining a calm presence, helping align priorities and strategy, and ensuring we‚Äôre on track for the overall business goal.  We‚Äôre really just a the start of a 3-week journey.  Much work is yet to be done, but you put us in the best possible place to succeed.  So much so, that within hours of launching, we already over 1000 registrants.  Impressive!  I so enjoy working with this team and knowing that together ‚Äì we can and will deliver!

title: Questions & Answers = Crushing it
message: The questions were: "Are you there?" "You working?" "Can you come inside on this beautiful Sunday?" The answers from this group were "Yes!" "How can I help?" "Be right there!"  Thank your dedication, time out of your weekend (or your whole weekend), and flexibility. For answering your phone, responding to texts, jumping on calls, endless Slacks, and using Workfront ;-)  Multiple communication channels are needed to launch a promotional campaign in 4 days, over a weekend, while working remotely. I am proud of you, to be a part of this team, and for what we accomplished together. Thank you.

title: You can‚Äôt get more ‚ÄúLive‚Äù than that!
message: Chris, Jeff, Jill - I‚Äôm so impressed with the leadership, speed and agility you‚Äôve demonstrated to wrestle a plan for our first all digital WHL event to the ground. The campaign is of the moment relevant, the creative feels on brand fresh, and the determination of your efforts comes clearly through in the Day 1 results. Where others might say ten thousand what?! You‚Äôve said - got it! ... And here‚Äôs the plan! Some folks see a countdown clock and say ‚Äúyikes, pressure.‚Äù This group of event and marketing pros says, ‚Äúpressure makes diamonds!‚Äù Excited to see this team shine bright like a diamond and be heads down on execution. Keep up the great work, and keep leading to show the impossible is possible! With gratitude, -C

title: Making us stronger together - every single day
message: Team - what a week! I am blown away by your collective and individual innovation. These are the experiences that can give us the best learnings and insights - not only in terms of skills, but more important, learning just how much awesomeness we are capable of bringing to the world. Thank you. Onward!

title: All systems go!
message: This group rallied mid week in an incredible pivot from soft launch to just LAUNCH within hours. I cannot thank you enough for the commitment to urgency for launching media campaigns.

title: Quick Response Team!
message: Amy, Dianne and Lauren - thank you all so much for your quick work helping out with some content for the customer launch of Thank You Healthcare! You all have the fullest of full plates and still sprung into action to help the customer team. The content for the message was excellent and just what we needed to help the team get messages out quickly. You are all awesome teammates!

title: Gratitude for the Merck Story
message: Sheri, Jay, and Mark, thank you all for your help bringing the Merck webinar to life. Sheri and Jay, we really appreciate the guidance you provided around the Merck story and some of the specifics around our partnership with their team. Thank you reviewing content and providing feedback. Mark, thank you for arming us with the latest and greatest metrics, and also for reviewing content to ensure no stone was left unturned. Customers stories like these only exist because of the work you do day in and day out to deliver a truly "workhuman experience" for our customers. I‚Äôm so grateful for the strong relationships you‚Äôve built that create these opportunities for the larger team. Thank you!

title: Creating A Human Moments That Matters!
message: Erin and Cam, I want to recognize you both for creating a wonderful human moment that matters for your colleagues across the company!  Seeing this come to life made my heart sing!  Your inspiration, care and passion for this project is fantastic to witness!  Thank you for taking the time to create this magical human moment, from thinking about how to make the connection for team members who are not customer facing as to the impact and value of their work.  From sharing information about our customers impact during Covid 19 to heartfelt messages from their employees using our platform! To recognizing the cross-company contribution to life events and conversations and the amazing feedback we are seeing from customers embracing this across their companies!  You creatively brought your vision to life and the end result was a powerful, authentic and very thoughtful display of your care and compassion!  Thank you ‚Äì you are an inspiration!

title: Lifting us all as you rise
message: Without batting an eyelash, you both jumped in with your hearts, your brains, and your brawn to create an integrated plan to help us elevate the spirits of the healthcare community while giving each of us an opportunity to share our deepest thanks.  Watching you each lead, bring out the best in each other and the rest of us - it is a thing of beauty that is making a huge difference.

title: Insightful Collaboration
message: Shout out to this team of creative geniuses! Getting in front of our strategic accounts with the impact that recognition is having on their employees (and more broadly, employees all over the world!) is of the utmost importance right now. Making it memorable and actionable is next level! Thank you for coming together and creating such an inspirational package for the whole team to leverage with the 'right' people! Bravo!

title: A Warm Welcome and A Supporting Hand
message: Amy, thank you for all you've done in the past couple weeks. You've answered every one of my questions, helped me prioritize activities and gave me space to complete onboarding. Even though starting a job from home isn't ideal, you've made sure I'm in the know and connected to the all the right people and are doing a great job supporting me as I navigate this new role. I could not be happier to work for you.

title: Best. Team. Ever.
message: Thank you for a great Zoom meeting to align around our short term priorities while daring to dream and proactively plan for longer term priorities. Not an easy task to do when the "here and now" is all anyone of us can think about lately. I was so impressed with everyone's willingness to think about team resources in a different way and also our shared commitment to the good work and strategic thinking that we already did together pre COVID-19 crisis. This was my most productive meeting of the day and an awesome way to end the week. I am grateful for this awesome team. Thank you!

title: Checking In, Checking Success!
message: Amy, Dan, and Katie - Every morning at 9 since we've been at home due to COVID-19, we've checked in together with our video calls.  You've shared not only amazing ideas and suggestions but also worries and concerns as we navigate so many interesting paths as a company, culture, and team. Thank you for your willingness to be so open, as it's a critical ingredient for trust and ultimate success.  And boy, has there been success!  Incredible achievements across PR, content, and social.  Anyone looking at our social feeds can see your work and leadership on a daily basis and see how it's propelling our brand and company higher and higher. Thank you for all of your work (and teamwork) as we continue to show how Workhuman can help elevate human connections across the world!  Kevin

title: Great Partnership!
message: Cam, thank you for all the hard work you do in helping us move along strategic priorities with our customers. Specifically, with Momentive, you have had to get involved in the not so fun conversations but you do it grace and ensure you have all your ducks in a row before getting on any calls. I am excited to continue working together to help our customers thrive, hopefully with more fun priorities going forward :)

title: X-Team GTM Collaboration Success
message: If you would have asked me at the beginning of March if we could bring a new product to the market in a few weeks I would have laughed. If you told me we'd all be doing it remotely because of a global pandemic I would have told you that you were crazy. Despite all the challenges this team was able to rise to the occasion and do what I would have thought was impossible. Coordination is always challenging, but this team managed to do it all in sweatpants (I hope we've all given in) on Zoom, which is remarkable. Thanks for the amazing work team!

title: World class walk through
message: Cam - so impressed with your professional, personable, and skillful walkthrough of our ever evolving WHE free products deck with Eric just now. Big moment for the company and brand - pumped to have such a talented leader in you bringing this message to customers. With gratitude, -C

title: Sincere & Authentic Participation!
message: Thank you all for collaborating on the Thank You video for healthcare workers around the globe!  Each of you took the time to record yourselves over the weekend to provide us with enough material to create the video.  The response from those asked to submit videos was so positive that we could not fit all of your wonderful selves into the video, but we would like you to know that we appreciate each and every one of you who stepped up and delivered!  Thank you!  I appreciate you!  The response thus far has been wonderful, and it could not have happened without you!  Well done!  Thank you!

title: CREATING A WAVE of GRATITUDE
message: Can you feel it? It's a soul lifting, soaking you to the bone, crashing wave of gratitude and joy that is emanating from this group of people. There are SO many ways this team of people is banding together, ideating, taking action, sharing, and LIFTING our customers (and each other) in this incredible hectic time! I just want to take a moment to say thank you for working through this time of uncertainty with your hearts on your sleeve. For reaching out to customers and giving them strength and light and the power to do good. If there was ever a team meant for the right now, it's this team. Thank you from leading from each of your seats and for creating incredible opportunities on a daily basis for our customers, for our brand, and for our business! You're ALL HEART and I'm loving it!!!

title: Excellent Support
message: Cam, I reached out to you last Friday for help with some positioning for the broader team regarding changes we were making. Little did I realize that you would turn my request around in a matter of hours! Incredible support and really appreciated. I am glad Chris suggested I reach out to you!! Cheers

title: Bring in the contract closer
message: Sheri, I wanted to recognize the amazing job you've done in getting the Bristol-Myers multi-year contract signed.  This has been quite a testament to the quality of work you provide our business and customers on a daily basis.  Not only that but you were brand new to this account and it seemed like contract questions were coming within days of being introduced to the BMS team.  This has been an interesting process in getting through a number of specific questions with the procurement team and helping to show our value to a new program team.  You were a maestro in orchestrating a number of different internal meetings and helping to tell the right story throughout all the contract discussions.  Thank you for all the great work, diligence, effort and grit you showed throughout the entire process.  We now have an even longer relationship in tact with BMS as a result of all your incredible work!

title: It was a moment!
message: A huge and sincere T H A N K Y O U to this long list of amazing humans. It seems like an eternity but just a short few weeks ago at the Executive off-site down in Florida, Eric and his team were all seated for a session. Each person was handed a sealed envelope with their name on it. Inside were the private letters each of you wrote. Some vulnerable, some filled with humor but all filled with how that person made you feel. It was a moment! Silence, smiles and even tears. It's not every day you get the chance to silence an entire Executive Team and remind them of how much they also matter and how they have influenced your day, week - or career. Thank you for being at the heart of what made this moment come to life.You all are amazing!  -Rebecca & Alice

Thank you for being at the heart of what made this moment come to life.You all are amazing!  -Rebecca & Alice

title: Delivering the Human Touch
message: When the COVID-19 pandemic began to accelerate, our marketing instinct immediately went to providing a human face on our content. There is no more powerful thought leadership than humans speaking with humans ‚Äì sharing experiences, emotions, and best practices on how best to craft a path forward in these unprecedented times. That was the inspiration for the daily video series, ‚ÄúKeeping Work Human,‚Äù which launched last week amid the flurry of everything else we are working on. James and Matt ‚Äì you stepped up and deftly handled the logistics of turning a Zoom video conference call into usable, shareable video. Pam ‚Äì you project-managed the overall logistics, setting up the invites, and showing agility when we had to pivot. Amy ‚Äì you immediately energized your team to schedule guest speakers. Mike ‚Äì you were at the ready to transition the videos to Workhuman Radio podcasts. Sarah and Jess ‚Äì you stepped up to write the question frameworks and provide a content resource. John and Diane ‚Äì you saw what was happening and introduced better discipline and process. Jen ‚Äì you were our first guest and dazzled our viewers with unique leadership best practices to manage remote teams. And Steve ‚Äì our host ‚Äì your ability to set the tone, and keep our guests at ease with your authenticity and humble heart, is what makes it all work. We‚Äôve only just begun ‚Äì and we have a busy few weeks ahead ‚Äì but I couldn‚Äôt be prouder of this team and the messaging we are bringing to market.

title: Top Notch Leadership
message: Thank you, Jill, for your leadership over the past challenging weeks.  These are unprecedented times and you continue to lead our team with a steady hand.  I appreciate your expertise, your constant communication, your collaboration and your support.   Thank you for all that you do!

title: It‚Äôs a Balancing Act
message: Amy, I wanted to shout out your incredible leadership during these ambiguous times. I‚Äôm not sure how you fit as many meetings into the day as you do but at the same time you‚Äôre helping to keep the rest of us afloat. You took the time to understand how each of us prefers to communicate and receive feedback prior to the COVID-19 crisis. This started with ‚Äúhow I like to work‚Äù probing questions you provided to the team as early as Ignite. Fast forward to now where remote working is the standard but luckily we‚Äôre not starting from scratch. I feel 100% supported and in the loop on all new projects even if I‚Äôm not directly involved. You‚Äôve checked in daily to get a pulse on my workload and how I‚Äôm feeling in general. While these are challenging times for everyone, it also brings out the best attributes in people. Thank you for your support, transparency, and leadership. You‚Äôre a master balancer of all the things!

title: Life Events for All
message: In less than 24 hours, this team of A-players was able to pull together all the tools we would need to offer Life Events to all customers.  Configuration guidance.  Check.  Proposed design. Check. All the supporting communications our internal program managers would need. Check. A pre-configured template in sandbox. Check. 3 amazing colleagues able to make magic happen in an instant...priceless.  Thank you for approaching this with an action bias, urgency and a commitment to excellence.  Amazing work!

title: It's Go Time!
message: Team - I wanted to first say thank you for your rapid response to the business's need for a COVID rapid response campaign. I also want to acknowledge that working at this pace and with a level of uncertainty may be new and/or uncomfortable, but that has not stopped this group from leaping into action, mobilizing, and being agile and responsive to rapidly evolving priorities - including stopping existing work, pivoting planned content, and being open-minded about new ways of working team together and team apart (as we leverage remote technology for the next while). Still lots to do, and I'm confident with the cohesion demonstrated this week we will do great things that help our current and future customers navigate uncertain times and that we will unlock new approaches and agility as a cross functional team. Thank you all. With gratitude, -C

title: It's Go Time!
message: Team - I wanted to first say thank you for your rapid response to the business's need for a COVID rapid response campaign. I also want to acknowledge that working at this pace and with a level of uncertainty may be new and/or uncomfortable, but that has not stopped this group from leaping into action, mobilizing, and being agile and responsive to rapidly evolving priorities - including stopping existing work, pivoting planned content, and being open-minded about new ways of working team together and team apart (as we leverage remote technology for the next while). Thank you all. With gratitude, -C

title: All action
message: I never cease to be amazed at how fast you move into solution-mode. While I  am processing the now, you are 12 steps ahead. I have never seen you get ruffled or reactionary ‚Äì¬†through any of the ups and downs we've had with this event over all the years we've worked on it! This was no exception. The way you worked to keep our event in San Antonio within hours of making the decision to cancel was amazing. You put us in a position for success. This ensures our attendees a consistent experience, honors our contractual agreements so that we won't lose the investments we have already made, you have saved all the San Antonio-specific creative that has been worked on‚Äìand can be reused‚Äì¬†as well as made it so that we can reach out with a message that we already have next year figured out. No other conference that I've seen has been able to do this amidst all these cancellations. Your work on this has given us a huge advantage. Thank you for all that you do!!!!

title: A tough day, a great team
message: Each one of you exhibited all of our values today but I chose Respect for All because we had a lot of decisions today that required us being in agreement and with a path to move forward very quickly and everyone did it in a respectful, efficient way. This was not a fun meeting - we all love WHL and are dedicated to it being perfect. Today, though we were taking it apart, was no exception. Everyone concentrated on the right message for our audience, thoughtfully went through all affected segments, and delivered a great plan. I'm so proud to work with each one of you and hope we are back together very soon planning '21!

title: Team Corona
message: Coronavirus.  Covid-19.  A giant headache.  We all call it something different ‚Äì especially because the situation with it has been changing minute by minute and making our decision making process so challenging.  When we made the decision to create new content and FAQ‚Äôs for our Workhuman Live site and audiences at 8PM on a Friday night, I crossed my fingers we would be able to activate.  We needed to get information out to our audiences that was clear, consistent, and valuable to ensure they felt informed and at ease.  No surprise ‚Äì every single one of you stepped up.  Dianne was slacking me almost immediately with project set-up details and timelines.  Lauren had copy in my hands before 6:00 AM (you actually sent it at 1:30!?!)  Chris and Amy were both there to review, edit and get on the phone to talk it through.  Jon had site pages staged and new pop-up functionality built and staged Saturday morning.  Jen and Anthony had layouts and content ready to deploy.  Jill was providing copy strategy and reviews.  Holly and Anne were standing by ready to act as needed for our audiences.  And Lauren ‚Äì our guiding light and champion of strategy supporting the whole process was as responsive as ever with reviews and feedback.  This is such an evolving and fluid situation, but the team never ceases to amaze me.  You gave up family and weekend time to help ensure our customers had the information they needed, when they needed it.  Your continued dedication and respect for customers, urgency, quality, and teamwork is amazing.  Thank you ‚Äì and Cheers to Team Corona.

title: thank you
message: Conor, thank you so much for your time earlier in setting up the keycode on my phone.

title: Parental Unit
message: Jill and Jeff, Over the past week I've come to think of you as the parents of Workhuman Live. Parenting an event is rewarding and hard. The event changes and goes through phases. Sometimes the event keeps you up at night. Some days you don't see eye-to-eye on the best approach to raising an event but you respectfully work together to figure it out. You each bring unique and valid perspectives to the role. Sometimes it is hard to watch your event go through a rough patch but you believe the event will make it and grow from the experience. Thank you for being the parents of Workhuman Live. The event is in good hands because of your dedication and exhausting efforts. Be proud of the movement you are raising!

title: First Class Collaboration
message: Team! I wanted to say congratulations and celebrate the collaboration that infused our FY20 Marketing Strategy Board. As of this past Friday we have an aligned, crisp, and clear plan for Marketing's focus and KPIs that sits perfectly between the Company's goals, objectives, and major priorities. I also want to recognize the diligence that went into to making this be a plan that effectively spans Customer + Brand Marketing and reflects alignment with our key partners (SLT, CS, CX, and Finance). It is metrics driven to ensure accountability and through it's more streamlined nature, now infinitely more shareable with our teams and partners. Look forward to rolling this out to the teams through all hands these next two weeks and continuing to revisit it for focus, alignment, and relevance to the business's needs as our business evolves. Love to see the positive momentum and teamwork modeled to produce this output - lets keep it going. With gratitude, -C

title: Warm Welcome!
message: Cam and Sarah, thank you both for such a warm reception into the customer success family! I cannot tell you how much it means to me to have a support system willing to answer questions, help collaborate and are as excited as I am to embark on this journey. The last few weeks have been drinking from the fire hose to learn the team, the opportunities and how I can dig in to make some progress, but not get stuck in perfection mode! Really appreciate the support and can't wait for the success to come. Cheers to you both.

title: Thank you!
message: Cam, it's been great to work with you on multiple clients lately but I have to call out today's meeting with AIB. You delivered a fantastic presentation to them on our D&I analytics capabilities. While at the moment they are in a tough space and under pressure to make cuts across the business, I feel like what was delivered really showed them and got them thinking about the value their program and WH can bring in this space. I could tell the team were really engaged with what was presented. I love how you already got them looking forward to Eric's keynote at Workhuman live Dublin. Let's get a team of them there! Great work, thank you!

title: Action and a Plan
message: Z, Amy - I wanted to recognize your rapid response to the needs of the business and the people needs of our marketing team. The new approach you brought to our wkly Dirs+ meeting was powerful. I found it to be agenda-driven, aligned with our FY20 goals, and hyper-focused. Thank you for quickly evolving away from "old ways" of doing things and demonstrating leadership around taking a new approach while being open to feedback and continuing to iterate as we fine tune the format. Keep up the great work - it's making a difference that matters. With gratitude, -C

title: Now that... is a meeting
message: Amy and Z - I am so impressed by the work you both have done to get our directors meeting into a really great place. We had an awesome agenda, kept on time, the team was focused and we all walked away with good info. Collaboration at its finest. Thanks so much for taking this on and making it the best meeting I have had all week! Cheers to you both!

title: Last minute ask
message: On top of your day jobs, I asked each of you to present in our weekly marketing directors+ meeting today - without a ton of notice. You produced slides, shared great content, and kept the team engaged during your sessions. Thank you for embracing the new format for our weekly meeting which we tried for the first time today, and contributing to what felt like one of our best meetings to date!

title: Helped me find my voice, quite literally!
message: Publishing my first article in Forbes was big moment for me and ironically, all the things I shared quite literally were a part of how this came together. Amy, thanks for the steady push to share my voice. You have been a staunch supporter guiding with a firm yet gentle hand. Lynne, you got the ball rolling, talking with me, helping make sense out of my myriad thoughts and seeing a story, putting them in writing in a great cohesive way. Dan, you steadily provided guidance and resources. Dave, you leaned in immediately when you heard my frustration, rolled up your sleeves and channeled my voice through rounds 4, 5 and 6. Sarah, you are just magical with your editing style. You took version 6 and over the weekend edited for crispness and polished in a way that made me feel eloquent and clever. I am grateful for this agile team that came together to ironically help me find my voice in print! Thank you all for helping me take my own darn advice: taking that first step. Here's to many more!

title: November 21, 2019
message: Assuming Outlook is accurate, November 21, 2019  was our first official "Marketing Directors meeting." Sixteen weeks later, I wanted to take a moment to personally thank each of you for ALLLL the time and energy you've invested in our time together. We've been meeting on a weekly basis  to establish more visibility, create more alignment across functional teams, collaborate on short and long term planning, negotiate budgets, brainstorm core marketing themes, discuss better ways of working together...the list goes on an on. And while I know we all cringe at the thought of another meeting on our calendars when we are starved for time, I strongly believe if we come together on a regular basis and focus on the right things, we'll all be smarter for it. I have so much gratitude for each of you! Thank you and see you next Wednesday!

title: Thought Leadership Excellence
message: It‚Äôs one thing to discuss thought leadership and it‚Äôs another to deliver it ‚Äì which each of you has done with editorial aplomb. ‚ÄúThe State of Humanity at Work‚Äù not only showcases results of a provocative survey of 2,613 full-time workers, but takes the data and brings to life some of the uncomfortable issues that companies are facing in the new decade. Core human needs like safety, fair pay, work-life harmony, growth, inclusion and belonging, and recognition are covered here ‚Äì with startling results.  Sarah ‚Äì your storytelling ability is outstanding, humanizing the data in a way that brings the issues to life. Greg ‚Äì our resident Einstein ‚Äì your data-carving skills and guidance to ask the questions in the right way set the tone. Carrie ‚Äì your design ability is always worth pointing out. The report is simply elegant. And Amy ‚Äì you had the idea to go beyond the annual report and deliver research in time for Employee Appreciation Day ‚Äì leveraging our agency to augment internal efforts. Well done to each of you and thanks for your commitment to outstanding thought leadership.

title: Rockstar Persona Actors
message: Team-Thank you for playing an integral part of the Customer Success New Hire Certification process. I have updated the process in the Demo Certification and you all embraced each persona you were given with full integrity! Each of your perspectives with customers has allowed us to develop a comprehensive and in depth certification process. Playing the persona you were given, each of you were thoughtful in asking questions you have heard from customers in the past to prepare Melissa with what the world will look like soon. I appreciate that you have given myself and Melissa thoughtful feedback to consider injecting in the future. Cheers!

title: Determination + Grit = Growth
message: Team - I was very excited to see the latest projections for WHL double down on Sunday. This is hard and important work you are doing to drive human moments that matter globally complicated by worldwide challenges above/beyond our control. Your consistency, determination, and unrelenting drive to succeed are paying off based on the +14% YOY increase vs. same time LY with a projected 3,721 registrants. Keep pushing. And in words of Bruce Springsteen, ‚ÄúGetting an audience is hard. Sustaining an audience is hard. It demands a consistency of thought, of purpose and of action over a long period of time.‚Äù  With gratitude, -C

title: Shoutout to all my Saucy Aunts
message: Thank you all so much for bringing great energy, enthusiasm, and attention to the kickoff with Influitive! This was a true cross-functional effort with representation from CX, CS, Strategy and Consulting, Marketing, Sales Operations, and Design ‚Äì an awesome demonstration of the power of collaboration. As we heard, even our Influitive consultant was impressed with how much involvement we had. You all brought unique perspectives on how we can engage with and deliver value to our customers through this community platform. I‚Äôm still riding the wave of excitement coming from our kickoff and am so excited to engage with each of you further in executing on the strategy we developed together. And not only were we productive, but we got to have some fun in there too ?. I‚Äôm so grateful to work alongside each and every one of you. Looking forward to the amazing things to come!

title: Constructs for success
message: A few weeks ago we took on a herculean task, gathering a small cross-functional team to create a rubric for consistent messaging heading into 2020. 19 core narratives, from themes to products, and the building began. Each of you played a part, both large and small and we are off to a such a strong start! Next steps are culling these down even more to get them over the finish line but I couldn‚Äôt have done any of this without your help and support. GO TEAM!

title: Interview dream team
message: A sincere THANK YOU to all of you for your participation in interviews over the past few months, for our Director of Product Marketing. Someone of you met with 5 candidates - which adds up to a LOT of time out of your schedules. Some of you only met with a couple of finalist candidates, but helped us to wrap up the search and make important decisions about who we were hiring. Overall, you all were so responsive, flexible, open-minded and just a pleasure to work with throughout this process. Thank you so much for the part you played in getting this fill across the finish line!

title: Booksellermania
message: Jill -  You can't turn a corner right now without someone asking about the WHL staff list.  Thank you for initiating time to meet with me yesterday. As I unravel and learn all the bookstore parts, I appreciate having the staff list in my brain so I can schedule the humans to provide a pleasant experience for our attendees. Moving forward every day - Cheers!

title: Umbrella gratitude
message: Thank you all so much for your collaboration with our Dublin based Umbrella project. From the messaging to the design, you were always there to help and enthusiastic to lend a hand wherever needed. Thank you all.

title: Testing 1, 2, 1, 2
message: Thank you for giving part of your Saturday to come into the office to test Workhuman Live session selection. We needed to test at a time when minimal people would be on the site and you were willing and able to help. Because of your participation we are able to provide a quality session selection experience for our attendees. I appreciate your commitment and time. Cheers!

title: Site Visit Specialists
message: Team, just wanted to take a moment to recognize all that goes into planning every aspect of an event like WH Live, the site visits are no exception.... multiple threads, tasks, logistics, decisions and lots and lots of walking.  You are all my heroes and I thank you (on behalf of all the folks that will receive the benefit of enjoying the beautiful result)!  Well done!

title: Full Speed Ahead
message: #weworkhuman #shootthemoon #theinstitute  What a revitalizing day and a half! Thank you to this team of great big thinkers and risk takers for a deeply challenging few days of daring to reach for BIG ideas and creative paths to accomplish our mission. It was a great way to kick off our ‚Äúproject‚Äù for 2020. I believe this team, in this partnership, can achieve new heights. Thank you for giving yourself to this with your whole self! Cheers to the Dream State! Special shouts to Becky, Traci, and Jill for helping nail down our process and making sure we paused to drink and eat!!!

title: Chief negotiator
message: Conor, well done on negotiating improved licence pricing for our new financial reporting tool. It was an education to be on the call and see how you worked with the vendor to secure a very good deal. You approached the vendor with a clear strategy and positioned it as a win win for both sides. The overall outcome is a cost saving to the business and we now also have the licences in place to support scale in the Finance Team.

title: Knocking out two birds with one stone
message: Sheri, what an amazing job you did with two recent meetings with the Bristol-Myers team...all in the same day!  First, I have to recognize all the effort you've poured into the contract discussions with their procurement contacts over the past several weeks.  You continue to build an incredible story around the Bravo program and the impact it is having across BMS as well as why we continue to be the partner to align with over the next several years.  You have worked with a number of internal teams in orchestrating the story we are trying to tell with truly compelling data.  Not only that but you continue to show a resolve and focus with all the conversations around a new contract.  The meeting with the procurement contacts was managed so well, where you provided a deep level of insights which really helped set the stage as we were moving forward with the proposal conversation.  Then we jumped right into an account review with the new program team that really helped build momentum as BMS is working on bringing Bravo to more employees.  You were able to share a number of stories that resonated with the new program team with some really exciting follow up items.  Thank you for jumping right into this account and some of these deeper conversations.  It's been like you've been working with this client for years.  I always enjoy working together on any account and this was just another example of the strategic direction you're able to share and lead with our clients.  Nice work!

title: Respectful Candor
message: Team, I wanted to thank you all for your open minds and hearts as we shared so many personal stories and moments that shaped us all...the good, the bad and the lessons learned. We laughed...I personal got a little choked-up at times but it was all in the interest of building trust among colleagues/friends. I truly believe our session on Tuesday has opened our two way doors to ‚Äúrespectful‚Äù candor in alignment with our  Workhuman values. We may disagree from time to time; however we have the tools and language to find the middle ground and move forward.  Here‚Äôs to open candid tough and honest conversations in pursuit of changing the world together!

title: Sheri Riter is having a WEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!
message: Sheri,  nothing makes me happier than a great story, except 17 great stories! To say that you have had some 'stuff' going on is an incredible understatement. We have this spectrum of engagement on our team and it ranges from something like "moving someone to the cause" to "get the right data/insights in front of the right person" to "break all former understood standards and MAKE SOME SH*T HAPPEN". And, there is literally 100% of our time and energy committed to every stage...which is at times death defying and humanly physically impossible. That is why, seeing all of the work come to such beautiful crescendos is such a gift! Getting all the things right along the way to position our CEO to have an incredibly productive meeting with the Hd of HR Strategy at GE---GOLD! Pushing hard on Hershey's 'new' procurement team to hold the value of our contract---GOLD! Positioning our work at BMS to their hired guns 'take no prisoners' procurement consultants in such a way that they immediately agree that THIS work must continue and that they've missed the biggest part of the picture---SOLID GOLD! Delivering sweet celebrations to our partners at Merck on their 1 millionth recognition moment---and for Jeff Geller to send you a very meaningful thank you note, speaking about our partnership, I mean.....CHOCOLATE wrapped in GOLD! And those are just the things you've managed to highlight! Congrats on all of your masterful work producing such sweet sweet rewards! Cheers to you, Sheri!!!

title: Elevating Customer Success
message: Cam-Thank you for sharing your vision and goals with me today from a strategy perspective. I am impressed with the innovative plan on some of your key projects which will be so impactful and fresh for the Customer. We both have overlapping priorities and strategies along with different view points into each one. Bouncing ideas and initiatives off of each other is going to elevate the strategy and execution one priority at a time. I am excited to be partnering with you to push these initiatives forward as we deliver the best in class insights and knowledge to the Customer Success team and Customers!

title: Guidance on Financial priorities
message: Steve and Conor, thank you for all your help framing the company's financial priorities and how to present them at the Fin Dev roadmap review with the Product Steering Committee. Your advice was invaluable in keeping the discussion "out of the weeds" and hence up at the appropriate level. Louise, thank you for providing so many supporting statistics to help make the case for change.

title: PCI Compliant
message: Keeping the organisation certified as PCI compliant involves a lot of moving parts ... from meeting with auditors, to providing evidence to auditors, to signing attestations and registering those attestations with our provider. All done now for another year and I thank you all for your input which you each provided in a true spirit of collaboration!

title: HIRED!
message: Amy - thank you so much for your partnership on the PR Manager search! It took longer than we anticipated, but I so appreciate your flexibility, candor, and timeliness throughout the entire process. You were always quick to reply which is so important in a tough market like Boston - and you were always quick to offer words of encouragement - even when things weren't going our way. Thanks for sticking it out with me, and congrats on your new hire!

title: The dream team does it again
message: Before too much time gets away from us, I wanted to thank each of you for your incredible work on Ignite Dublin. Within one week there were a LOT of moving parts. LIKE... TONS. And never did this team flinch. Everyone stayed focused, helped in any way possible and kept on top of those million details to deliver an incredible event (with handwritten notes being adjusted just in time... I'm looking at you Mrs. Grady!). Such an awesome undertaking and I loved working with you all on it!

title: Setting the stage
message: Sheri,   Excellent work with the exec preparation for the upcoming GE executive meeting.  I encourage  all reps and SCDs to reach out to you to understand how you went about helping Eric prepare for his upcoming meeting.  Not only did you gather all key information about the account, the current situation, issues and opportunities, people and goals for the meeting, but you made it all accessible in one easy to find place, added an excellent executive summary to bring it all together and delivered a personal briefing to walk through it with support from other leaders.  A how-to manual for helping us get the most of this unique opportunity.  Well done!

title: High Scores for Content
message: Amanda & Amy, during today‚Äôs Evanta lunch & learn, the representative from Gartner showed a slide that shows Workhuman speakers at Evanta events score higher than their average session score. That shows firsthand that the messaging and presentations you're putting together are truly resonating with the c-suite audience. As always, great work!

title: Great panel questions!
message: Thank you so much for your excellent questions for the panel.  Very thoughtful questions each, thank you for representing the audience so well!

title: MSO for the win!

title: Certifiably Great Marketing Deck
