It also involves strategic thinking - with an eye towards what will be most impactful for the business. It also involves pushing for the right elements and ensuring alignment across a team.  It can often seem like an uphill climb but the progress is quite evident to all involved in the project. There are great things ahead in the market.  Thank you for all your efforts!

title: Great Marketing Team Meet and Greet!
message: Jill, Z -   Thank you for stepping up to coordinate a well-executed team meet and greet yesterday. This was an important forum to create and hold quickly to help define whole team success! Through the Q&A session and ice breaker of "what would your walk up song be in the soundtrack of your life be" (excited for that playlist to be released! :) you helped me and the broader team understand more about each other's unique background and personal style. It also helped identify that across the team we have over 75 years of marketing experience - impressive! Feedback has been super positive - that it helped bring us all together quickly, that it is clear there is respect for what the team does, and that it helped provide important transparency to my excitement and desire to advocate for the team, ideas, and progress.   With gratitude, -C

title: Content team rockstars
message: Can you be our team on every project? Seriously, MJ and I had the dream team of collaborators when it came to working on the content for our ambitious agenda. Amanda ‚Äì we really don‚Äôt know how you do it, you‚Äôre some magical unicorn of creative genius mixed with speed and quality, and always quick with a smile and a joke to keep us all humming along. You created the on-screen visuals for a huge portion of the event. From all of Derek‚Äôs material to the awards, and both Alice and Jesse‚Äôs presentations, you were a force! Thank you for the incredible work. Amy, Clare, and Kristen ‚Äì a huge thank you for being there at every turn with ‚Äúhow can I help?‚Äù, ‚Äúwhat can I do?‚Äù and then making things happen. From helping select and assign panel questions to supporting our main stage speakers and breakout session leaders, creating and delivering desk drop surprises, and sharing great feedback on the event, you played a critical role in what was a great couple of days in Boston. Next, on to Ireland! Thank you for everything!

title: Ignite Solutions
message: Thanks to all of you for being so willing to serve as facilitators for the Ignite Solutions activity!  We were trying something a bit different and were not completely sure how it would work out.  However, you were all willing to step-in and give it a try with energy and enthusiasm.  Your level of participation and preparedness for this activity was so impressive!  You delivered a great experience for our humans and provided some valuable feedback on how we can offer these types of collaborative activities in the future.

title: Video stars!
message: Jay, Sheri, Brian, and Nicole - MJ and I would like to thank each of you for participating in the creation of the customer story videos for Ignite Boston (soon to be shared in Dublin). There was a quick turnaround on these videos and you each made yourselves available to the video team and shared your personal experiences with our customers so all could better understand the ways in which our people and the work each of us does is making a difference in the world. The videos were impactful and we so appreciate the critical part you played in making them a reality! Thank you.

title: Keepin' it Legal during the dine around

From stories about marathons in far-off lands, adventures in New York city, the sights and sounds of India, the wild hills of Pennsylvania, safaris in South Africa - this is a well-traveled bunch! title: Taking the workhuman rocket to new highs!
message: Amanda, Colleen, Mary Jo & Amy, I am fortunate and proud to work with you this past few weeks.  Congratulations on the part 1 of 2, great success that you delivered in Boston this week!   You were the foundations to my presentation and mc work.  Without your guidance, direction, ideas, detailed content, slides, notes, cards‚Ä¶. I certainly could not have done it!  With great appreciation for being right there at all the stages (sitting beside me too!), it‚Äôs a real honour to work with such professionals, and a high performance team as you all are.

title: Teamwork at Ignite Solutions!
message: Sheri - thank you so much for presenting our groups findings with me today during the break out session! With a full room of people I was a little nervous, but you helped everything run smoothly! So great to partner with you along with everyone else.

message: Amy & Z - Shout out for shepherding the marketing leaders along the 2020 planning process. It's hard to create a format which can fit everyone and everything we do. There are always nuances. But you listen to feedback and make wise decisions as to what is needed and what is not needed to build a well-structured plan. This is especially difficult since there are 2 new VP leaders on the horizon. You've stepped in to fill the need!

Without your help, I would still look like this cartoon (ok... to be honest, I would look worse).  I am so happy to be part of a team where our leadership is ready and willing to roll up their sleeves and work through an issue when needed.  Thank you!!

title: Hidden Heroes, Team Focus
message: All - I wanted to thank you for all of your collective work on an upcoming keynote announcement for Workhuman Live 2020. I greatly appreciate your focus and diligence to getting the package complete and ready for speaker approval. As we all know, approvals can often take more time than we'd like - but your ability to get this package done in a timely and high quality way is amazing. Well done to all of you and thank you for your efforts. Can't wait to see it out in market!

title: A New Horizon
message: Thank you for taking the lead to get us together in Dublin, updating us on the latest thinking as to how the brand strategy is evolving, and for exploring opportunities for how we capitalise on that in the local market. We are big supporters of the work you and your team are doing, and keen to be advocates for brand alignment. Thanks also for turning us into fantasy characters, in order to build new skills and awareness.  I really appreciate the trust and openness you show towards us, and how you listen to our needs, which incorporate the local market, and the cultural differences between Ireland and the US. I'm very excited about the potential and benefit to be derived from stronger partnership between the Marketing and Technology teams.

title: Yes and has come to life...
message: Team, I know it is difficult to take two mornings out of your week while you have Customer calls, emails and launches happening to attend a knowledge share workshop on some of our trickiest topics.  I must say it was impressive to see everyone sharing their experiences and knowledge building upon each other thoughts.  The collaboration among such a diverse group of people and roles  was simply amazing to be a part of and witness among a group of 40 strong.  If you were wondering what Respect for All looks like...you were just a part of it and each of you made it happen!  I would be remiss without calling out your contribution to moments that matter by agreeing to be present in our workshop and any other meeting moving forward.  We all know how it feels when someone/s is multi-tasks and I was so pleased to see laptops closed and true focus and attention on the subject and task at hand.  Thank you all for a great two days, I cannot wait to see what this Team does next.

title: What we are all about
message: Amy,  from Oran, Niall, Rosana, Rob, Shane and myself- "THANK YOU" for today.   Your session was informative, insightful and very helpful.   You took what could have been a tough topic and helped make it fun and engaging.  I have never seen such active participation in role play :) and it is attributable to the quality of your training.  We are all incredibly glad that you practiced to your taxidriver audience,  despite him almost driving you to an alternate venue where you might receive the help you need :) I leave you with famous words(slightly altered)  that sum up how we all feel  "...Watch and you'll see....Some day we'll be....Part of your world"

First and foremost, with Ignite around the corner;  there is no shortage things to get accomplished, GREATLY appreciate the time taken out of your busy days to help us crowdsource ideas and think differently to capture the excitement AND carry it forward, even when WH Live 2020 comes to an end. Nice work being respectful brainstormers and challenging one another. I am so excited to put these ideas in action against our personas and a timeline. We have never been in better shape to make the most of Workhuman Live and it's because of this group, Cheers to you all!

Stacey, Cara, Tamra, and Jill: Awesome work ensuring the team was well hydrated and full of snacks to draw out all of the brilliance of the group in the room! Holly, Mark and Anne, appreciate your willingness to lend a hand bringing supplies over to 100, arriving early to help setup and staying late to help clean up. And last but, not least, a HUGE call out to Jeff, for the endless hours of prep work that went into ensuring the afternoon had a great flow and would be productive for all of those involved, really amazing work team!

title: Hackathon for the Ages!
message: Amazing team, I cannot thank each and every one of you enough for your brilliance during the second Workhuman Live Hackathon this week! First and foremost, with Ignite around the corner;  there is no shortage things to get accomplished, GREATLY appreciate the time taken out of your busy days to help us crowdsource ideas and think differently to capture the excitement AND carry it forward, even when WH Live 2020 comes to an end. title: Perspective
message: Amy - I wanted to let you know that I value your support in helping to develop the next wave of leaders here at Workhuman. You have taken many people under your wing (both at the direction of the HR team and on your own) and provided them with a valuable lense on the organization, how to manage through it, operate in it, and how to grow themselves. Even though this work is focused on developing others it does come with learnings for you as well, both good and bad. The work you're doing is important. Keep it up.

title: AIM'ing High
message: It is always a pleasure when we step into a room with a singular purpose and see such diversity of thought and collaboration with the sole purpose of propelling our people, our organization and our company mission forward.  That was quite evident during our brainstorming session last week to determine what our Q1 AIM's should be and how to best drive cross departmental collaboration.  We all had ideas and a voice to ensure we came to the table with the best possible solution.  Well done to all...and a special call out to Erin for taking the lead to ensure our thoughts were captured real time; that made all the difference to highlight the gaps so we could close them.

title: Thank you for all your support in 2019!
message: Frank & Conor, I believe this award is well overdue! I want to thank you both for all your support and taking the time to attend the many float meetings and continuously giving me constructive feedback to help me grow in my role. It‚Äôs been an exciting year and a massive learning curve for me and I definitely wouldn‚Äôt be where I am now if it wasn‚Äôt for all your support over the past year. So thank you again, it‚Äôs a great honour working with you and learning from you! Happy new year!

title: Keeping the Water(s) flowing
message: Cam- Great work on the Waters RFP and the finalist pitch. I could tell that you worked hard on the RFP document and the presentation, and did thorough research about the customer, which was evident to all of us. It was great to see you in action in person with this customer, and to learn from you throughout the process. As mentioned before, you are truly impressive with customers and remain poised and confident the whole time, which instills confidence in customers. Hoping that we hear good news back soon!

title: Giving it your all
message: Amy - I‚Äôm recognizing your for all the work you put into this year‚Äôs holiday card email. From the initial brainstorm, to charities, to expanding this year‚Äôs card beyond customers only, to gathering feedback from Alice, Kevin, Kristen, Eileen, Pam, Jill, Mark, Anthony, Stacey, and the list goes on and on to ensure the execution covered all parties appropriately. We realized the benefit of versioning it out for prospects and set it up through Yesware for reps to send individually which allowed them to personalize it just as customer success did the year before. The customer list needed to be reviewed and cleaned up and you stayed right on top of it! You shared feedback from the reps about how great their experience has been utilizing the email rather than handwriting cards that people throw away. This is a gift that keeps on giving! Thank you for truly owning this and working so hard to make sure it went off without a hitch!

title: Hershey hero
message: Sheri - I wanted to call out all the hard work you have put into Hershey over the last few months. Since I‚Äôve joined the account you have been hard at work trying to find ways to wow at the executive level, despite some  challenges Hershey has gifted you with. You have utilized relationships outside of the core program team to get us in front of their procurement team and give us a chance to show them what amazing partners we are. You have put a lot of time and energy into getting their ‚Äúpesky‚Äù procurement team what they need as soon as they need. Internally you got all the right players involved to help present to Hershey in an hour long meeting. Some may think an hour long meeting is a piece of cake, but not when someone else is setting the agenda for you. As soon as we walked out of our most recent meeting with Hershey you were already mapping out next steps. Your dedication to your customers is amazing! Thank you for all your help, support and leadership on Hershey!

title: 28 this quarter!
message: 28 humans. That's how many people assisted in one way or another with the Q4 year-end, last meeting of the decade and for each and every one of you, I am grateful! It's pretty incredible to think about the village that comes together to make this meeting happen. From confirming our speakers, creating slides, providing content, answering my many questions, testing and testing and testing (yes, 3x) the technology to provide a great experience for all, to ringing the gong - each of you receiving this award was integral to the overall success of the meeting.

message: Conor, thanks so much for taking on the task of MC'ing the Christmas Raffle this week. You made it a fun experience for everyone and the feedback has been fantastic (next year I promise to take you through the prizes with more than 5 seconds to go!).

title: Bite-sized marketing updates, Buffet-sized results
message: Great job all on your collective sharings and updates during our full marketing team meeting this week. Thank you!

title: Progress not perfections...
message: Team, I wanted to call out the time and attention each of you had in support of rebuilding a resource planning tool for 2020 and beyond.  We started with a lot of questions about what this foreign spreadsheet was...to having a descent understanding of what it was saying...to rebuilding a new one.  We battled tested our assumptions, changed a few calculations and learned a whole lot about where we are and where we need to go.  Thank you for keeping an open mind and providing your knowledge and perspective to put our best foot forward.  We are all better off using our collective thoughts verses one individual.  We have just begin this journey; however I am excited for what's to come.

title: All together we succeed
message: Everyone, I wanted to recognise each of you for all you do when helping out the production support team. It has been another busy year, I for one cannot thank you all enough for everything you do to help out team out. There are countless small things that you all do that really make working here easier. There are countless things that are greatly appreciated and for those things I want to recognise you all. I still find it amazing how despite working across an ocean we have such a great comradery, friendship and can share laughs. I find it phenomenal just how much work we get through and the things we can achieve working side by side are incredible. No matter what we get the support we need and I know that together our team can give our customers a truly world class experience. Thank you all for being you and the teamwork you have displayed over the year. You are all the best :D

title: Tech champions support
message: I am deeply grateful for the support I received from each of you in preparation for speaking at Dublin Tech talks Meetup recently. From help with slides, distilling the many topics in my head down to something digestible, to help with my LinkedIn profile..You made a huge difference. Thank you

title: You did it!
message: Earlier this week, our speaking proposal was accepted for the 2020 Recognition Professionals International (RPI) Conference. While that might seem like a no brainer to some, for years, the style and message of the conference didn't fit our brand, so years ago we stopped going. Chris & Corinne, you both kept it on your radar, and listened when future customers talked about it, and pitched reasons for us to relook at going. You both committed to do field research, and came back with feedback that not only should we have a presence there, but we should be speaking. Amy, you openly took in their feedback and experience and pursued it, put the the presentation proposal together with Corinne committing to speak and here we are, Success! Each of you maintained an open mindset for change and went the distance to make it happen, Congratulations!

title: The value of leadership
message: Amy, while selecting the value for this award, I was wishing there was one specifically around leadership, because that‚Äôs the one you deserve. I‚Äôve been waiting to write this recognition for some time because it‚Äôs been clear in the months after your return just how impactful, insightful, and inspirational you are as a leader, colleague, and friend. You approach every project with a strategic lens, logic, calmness, and humor. You intrinsically see where people‚Äôs strengths are, what value they can add, and you empower them to do it with a mix of resolve, positivity, and kindness that‚Äôs truly motivating. To say I‚Äôve enjoyed working with you and benefitting from your guidance would be a gross understatement. You are, in a word, a powerhouse. And this place is so lucky to have you as one of its leaders. Thank you for all you do.

title: For some amazing hand holding, prep and more!!!
message: Amy, you are an amazing partner in all of our outreach and I certainly have leaned on you these past weeks.  You have all the details to hand and are always a consummate professional.  I am extremely grateful that you are part of our team!  Thank you!

title: 2020 Digital Prep
message: Amy - Thank you for taking the time to meet with me to discuss the Digital/SEO/External Comms strategy in 2020. It was a great conversation, and it gave us both action items to accomplish goals both in the short term and deeper into the new year.  With what we were able to in just a few short months in 2019, I know we'll be able to raise Workhuman's web presence even more so in 2020.

title: For a LinkedIn 101 1 on 1!
message: Hey guys. Thank you so much for the work with me on the thought leadership platform. It has made a tremendous difference and it is so reassuring to have experts like you both as supports as I navigate Social Media 101 material

title: For lending an ear
message: Amy, thanks for taking the time to touch base not just today but on a weekly basis. Upward and onward!

title: Accelerating into 2020
message: What a year of surprises! Thanks to each of you for bringing your insights, ideas, and energy to bear on our top 5 accounts. We've been meeting quarterly to review from every angle how we can from every perspective, impact the business. So many great ideas were uncovered and put into action immediately from these conversations. And each of us, learned something big about how with some focus, we could more directly impact big opportunities as an organization. Thank you for early and late meetings, for staying focused, and for caring so much about excellence! This has been an incredible 'test' of the WH network! Bravo!

title: Interim Audit Success
message: A well deserved shout out to all the Finance Team who got involved in this year‚Äôs interim audit. Overall we have received very positive feedback from EY Dublin, with no issues or concerns identified. The dedication and workload management demonstrated by all of you has been outstanding, along with a meticulous attention to detail in the quality of data provided. We are now positioned to hit the ground running for year end, a massive well done to you all!

title: Increasing the possibilities with Biogen
message: Team, we had a very successful on-site strategy and program review meeting at Biogen last week - and it absolutely would not have been possible without your contributions.  Erica,  you pulled together such comprehensive and compelling analyses for the client. You illustrated the tangible impact their program has had on employee retention and provided insights on where the specific opportunities are to increase employee engagement with the program. You were also a pleasure to work with as we refined the presentation.  Jesse, you impressed as always with your overview of what your team has accomplished, and the possibilities of the insights we can provide Biogen with going forward. They were clearly impressed and subsequently open to working more closely with us on leveraging data to increase their program's reach and effectiveness.  Sheri, on what was an extremely busy week for you, you still came through with a very effective Workhuman update and overview of the impact of recognition. It set the table perfectly for Jesse, Erica and I to talk about Biogen's specific program performance.  Thanks again to all of you for your hard work on this. We're in a great position now to grow their program further with the addition of Service Timelines, and getting more of their employees actively recognizing their colleagues.

Special shout-out to Sarah for the writing of the whitepaper (the final version which is coming soon!) and Dan for his foresight and strategy behind the people coverage of the forums, ensuring each one had a content lead to roll-up into the whitepaper output.

title: Cyber Monday!
message: As I sit here looking back on the past 2 ¬Ω days, I am in awe at what this team has just pulled off.  It's one thing to think about rolling out a massive multi-day / multi-touch / multi-channel campaign with weeks of planning ‚Ä¶ but we decided to do so much more.  In just these 2 ¬Ω days, we have managed to launch housing to all audiences, which included segmented email deployments, multiple site updates, platform updates, rebuilding every confirmation email, design, social, and more!  Buy why leave it at that?  We also pushed out the Justify your Trip content.  Custom letters by audience, site updates, design changes, functionality tweaks.  And even took the time to redesign and rebuild Eric‚Äôs Keynote page.  On top of all this ‚Äì Cyber Monday went out the door today.  I started doing the math on the executional elements we have for this one campaign, but ran out of fingers, toes, and strands of hair to count on.  We basically crammed week‚Äôs worth of work into just two days, like it was nothing.  But it was everything!  This was no small feat, and every one of you played a role in pulling it off (almost) seamlessly.  The results are not in (yet), but this could not wait because we have completely set ourselves up for success thanks to all of you.  I so appreciate your focused commitment to the success of Workhuman Live.

I'm looking forward to seeing the results come in and using this data to build a compelling report that will drive leads and media inquires.

When you told your first person story about why recognition matters, and incentivizes you to tell your fellow female thought leaders to join Workhuman was AMAZING. It was authentic and moving. I can't wait to have you join more meetings in the future. Cam, your THOUGHTFUL support was felt in today's meeting and put Shiamalee and the entire team in a place to be selected as a partner for Twitter. We have work to do, but we are off to a strong strong start! Thank you #Tweeps!

title: A great plan for success with HARMAN 2020
message: Thankyou Sheri, Erica and Erin, we certainly made an impression over the two hours we planned for! Despite a dip in this year results with the Be Brilliant Program! we could not ask for a better turnaround of events in this meeting. When Erica presented some insightful results into what WHARI is telling us which sparked the topic about building back trust and empowering employees to own the culture by nominating more frequently but encouraging the smaller awards, you could hear the AHA moment in the room where the HARMAN team simply stated we have to use this budget even more so based on some of those findings that WHARI highlighted!!! It was great to hear Lori (HARMAN‚Äôs VP Reward) make those comments and openly ask for our guidance and how we best execute a 2020 plan of action that includes a turbo boost in comms, manager training, educating division leaders on the fact that Be Brilliant is an investment and not a spend, holding leaders accountable to nominate more frequently!! And there was more, with great interest with the PENDO project, thanks Erin for bringing them through this impressive initiative which they really liked and can see the benefits of it to help improve further adoption. Finally, thanks to you Sheri for making the trip down to Stamford to be the face for Workhuman and for making sure we addressed all the topics we prepped for!!   It‚Äôs always a great sign the meeting was a success when you get an email from the client saying "just left the meeting feeling energized and ready to bring BE BRILLIANT to the next level‚Äô! Roll on 2020!! "Well done everyone!!

From my initials pitch you both were very welcoming and open to the idea and straight away provided feedback and direction to myslef and the team for how to progress forward with the idea. title: #MakingImpact #DeliveringResults
message: Sheri! Sheri! Wow, I feel like I just finished a Master's Class in advanced Business Strategy and Execution thanks to you! Talk about formulating a strategy, changing perspectives on what's possible, and aggressively mapping steps to clearly accelerate program growth and sustainability in the most challenging times ... you nailed it! GE has been in the news for years with headlines like 'Will GE Survive?, Will GE Ever Bounce Back?". In true Sheri fashion you saw this as an incredible opportunity to help GE rethink the power of recognition to transform culture, boost morale, increase engagement and keep employee's feeling their work had a purpose and is valued.   You put your strategy into motion! First, creating connections with senior leaders/decision makers. You secured a half-day slot for WH at Kosta's HC HRLT meeting to share the Future of Work, what's possible through recognition, and how to invest properly to achieve desired talent and business outcomes. They quickly understood the value of increasing peer to peer recognition moments, lower value awards given more frequently and embedding this mindset change into communication strategies and tactics for managers and individual contributors. Kostas even stated "We need more recognition happening daily. There is enough budget to spend $10-15M on this program this year".    Second, you urgently brought WH thought leadership to all GE's Businesses - HC, Power, Aviation and Renewables - knowing investment next year will be decided at this level. You relentlessly pursued setting up Design Labs with decision makers, strategized on 'Quick Wins' and Long-Term Goals. This resulted in 30+ new connections, renewed excitement about social recognition, mindset of more peer recognition and lower value awards given more frequently and how to fund. 1st 10 months of 2019 vs. 2018, GE's spend increased by $6M, or 27%. Can't wait to see what 2020 brings with the new foundation in place! You Rock! #MakingImpact.

But that is the kind of effort required to change the world.  We have to always do things that have not been done. And we have to take risks.  I wouldn't say endure failure but rather learn from all our experiments.  Bravo for stepping up to take on this challenge and for helping us learn a new approach.  So far so good!

title: Making Magic at Merck
message: Jay, Sheri and Erin,  It's not often that I'm privileged enough to walk into a two-year account review and see the conversation flow so smoothly with so much cause for celebration. The level of trust and respect in the room is a testament to the close partnership that's been cultivated over the 2+ (really 3+) years by you three. Some of the magical moments that come to mind: Jeff, their SVP of Global Compensation & Benefits, congratulating us on a successful launch of their "peers" J&J, and telling us that it's a close-knit community in human health sciences, so word spreads fast when things go well.  Aaron, another executive program sponsor, telling us, "This partnership has made this company better. We've been able to touch clients' lives in a positive way." Michaela, our program manager, describing our common sense of purpose and symmetry in our businesses, we both focus on humans. Erin, your involvement at both ends of the Merck journey, as LSM and now the critical linkage to Product has been invaluable. As Jeff states that he's asked Outlook integration every year, and he's going to ask for it for the third time, it was perfect timing to turn to you and have you be able to provide a glimpse of things to come. Even with slight changes to the Merck team, we've been able to maintain the open conversation and evolution of the program. I'm excited to see what the next four years (and beyond!) bring.

message: Team, I know this is overdue but wanted to thank you all for your preparation, presentation and great work at the recent Merck onsite meeting where we covered a number of important topics with their program team. Thank you all for your teamwork in helping to support each other in the course of the client conversations as we continue to find unique ways to grow the Inspire program across the organization. title: 'Healthy' Start to Day! Design Lab w/GE Healthcare
message: I am go grateful to be a apart of this amazing team taking 15 years with GE to the next level of greatness and true imagination at work, Workhuman style! Sheri, our strategic leader and thinker. GE is experiencing lots of business challenges. You continue to position the WH Cloud as a critical component for culture transformation, modern day leadership, exceptional employee experience and connectedness which translates directly into talent and business outcomes! Getting GE Healthcare to think 'Quick, Impactful WINS, in the short-term and Bolder, Bigger WINS post-Workday launch.' You educate on what's possible. Last week Kostas said 'I love the microsite you created. Lots of valuable information in there.' Talk about getting a new heartbeat at Healthcare! Kara, you continue to shine with your deep knowledge and expertise around the platform, out of the box thinking on what's possible in the short-term and always strategizing on the long-term goals. Your demo today, the added color, story you were telling was so impactful. Greg, after a 4:30am start to drive 3 hours, your presence alone up-levels any meeting (the Dr  is in the house) ,you presented Healthcare's data, what story it told, highlighting the opportunities, showcasing what great looks like, weaving in other customer stories had them coming to all the right conclusions - mindset change is needed. More peer to peer recognition, managers and peers, giving and receiving at about 1 per month resonated well! All of our voices will be in there heads tonight hearing "lower value awards given more frequently." The most beautiful cheer of all! Award reasons that matter, mindset change program is for everyday efforts, both big and small, increase in investment, proper comms rollout strategy and continued excitement!! New Life, New Heart!

title: For Immediate Release: Amy Rice is a PR Superstar

I have a tendency to dive into the deep end on projects, and you let me figure things out then suggest areas to look into that I might not have thought about. You also are more than accommodating when I have a question or a finding. It seems like you might have like 15 minutes a day when you're not in meetings so I really appreciate you taking a couple minutes to listen to things that I found.    I'm really looking forward to our continued partnership, and I think you and I can accomplish a lot of awesome things for Workhuman with our joint efforts.

title: One Step Closer
message: A well overdue thank you to everyone involved in the 606 Breakage Systemisation to date. This week we have reach a significant milestone in the project with live up to date data, clearly defined inputs, accurate customer lists,  and a revised report... all bringing us one step closer to our end goal. Where we still have a long way to go to go, this milestone launches us to the next stage of testing, walkthroughs, controls and data analysis. Thanks to everyone involved for their time, patience, brainstorming, guidance and dedication in keeping this project constantly moving. It also means I am moving further away from my manual spreadsheets, which can only be described as a welcome relief to my eyesight! For that, a sincere thank you!

title: Bottling the Experience!
message: As a parent, I have heard (and used) the phrase ‚ÄúIt takes a village.‚Äù  I believe that same idea applies to many of the business challenges we encounter.  Being asked to develop a marketing approach to Bottle Workhuman Live ‚Äì I knew right away it would take a village.  And WOW ‚Äì did you all step up. Yet, every one of you jumped at the change.  You even took the time to do some homework in advance and help formulate the direction of the workshop.  You changed schedules to be there.  You came focused and ready.  You gave it your all!  I now have a 20 page deck of ideas to leverage ‚Äì to create some fun, exciting, bold and disruptive marketing from.  All thanks to you.  I have a deep appreciation for every one of you.  Thank you!

title: Aloft in Alpharetta with McK
message: Marcy, Josh, and Cam,   McKesson's stock price, following our finalist meeting with them, went aloft!  Coincidence?   Just think how great they'll do when they really start working with us! title: Is there a better example of teamwork? Nahhh
message: TEAM! I cannot express enough how much I appreciate you all jumping in to help me reel a candidate back in. However - this was the first time I had multiple people on the interview team immediately jump in and offer their assistance in trying to save the day. With your help - we are back on track with this candidate. Regardless of whether or not this ends in an offer, I want you to know how much I appreciate your support in making this happen. You are all true partners and I'm so lucky to work with you.

title: Relationship building and more at SHRM 19
message: Great job at SHRM Annual Conference this week!  This conference is a great relationship building opportunity ‚Äì for us to continue to leverage the relationships we have and make new ones.  All with the intent of creating new business and thought leadership opportunities.  Mike ‚Äì excellent work with the SHRM Foundation.  This year‚Äôs format was different than past years ‚Äì but it remained a great way to connect with industry leaders and show Workhuman as a brand that cares. And the dinner with Cy Wakeman was amazing fun!  Dan ‚Äì great job in leveraging the show to get competitive intel, industry information to help our content strategy and new ideas to help our future messaging. Amy ‚Äì this was your first SHRM conference but you jumped right in!  You spent time at the booth, got some great media interviews and made new connections for Workhuman. Can't wait to see what comes of all of them. Well done all!

title: Inspiring Hearts & a New Mindset @ GE Healthcare
message: Sheri! Sheri! Sheri!! What an amazing and transformative 2.5 hours with the CHRO and Senior HR leaders of GE Healthcare last week! You truly orchestrated one of the most educational, inspiring and impactful sessions that's probably ever happened at GE's Global Learning Center in Crotonville, NY. A learning session for the record books, for sure! It all started with your leadership, commitment and dedication to ensuring the 2.5 hours with this group would be maximized with the right blend of rich content, personal 'surprise and delight' moments, and human connection! Get these nay-sayers, low participating givers to really understand the impact of gratitude, how recognition transforms culture, why it's important to empower the masses, more peer to peer recognition, coming from a larger pool of givers, utilizing all available tools to broadcast and amplify what good looks like and the right level of investment to make the IMPACT that GE Healthcare is looking to on the organization. An organization that's undergoing massive change! You not only wanted to show the science behind gratitude but bring in the emotional and human elements, too. You sourced a video from a colleague, Petra that was shared on the day! A HUGE moment during the meeting! Bringing together the heart and mind to show the whole picture. What's good for business is good for HUMANS!  The IMPACT you've had on the GE account has been tremendous! This quote is YOU ... Leadership is not about a title or a designation. It's about IMPACT, influence and inspiration. Impact involves getting results, influence is about spreading passion you have for your work and inspiration is helping team-mates and customers think bigger, do bigger and achieve more!! Well, you NAILED IT, Sheri! GE Healthcare is about to get a new heart beat thanks to YOU!! Congrats on putting together a winning strategy for the GE account overall, the GE Healthcare Senior HR leaders meeting and the new horizon  that's coming for all!!!

title: The Right Strategy

That balance may also mean getting creative to see how to get to the finish line for a critical timeline. You‚Äôve demonstrated all these skills recently for Endurance, Cognizant and Fisher. Your enthusiasm for ‚Äúlet‚Äôs do what we have to do then‚Äù no matter the challenge is just who you are. Thank you for all you do for our customers and for just being you!

title: What a Brainstorm
message: There‚Äôs nothing like a three-hour meeting, sandwiched between the company meeting, a marketing vp meeting, and countless other commitments.  Yet, every one of you came with your A-Game ‚Äì ready to brainstorm a whole new approach to the Workhuman Live website experience. title: USGAAP test environment
message: Thank you all for the effort in the you've made in the past few months to address the lack of a usable test environment for USGAAP. This will be invaluable to the Financial Development team, allowing us to update and streamline our revenue recognition software.

title: Mind Blowing Experience for 39 Global SE Execs
message: "A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions" that's what our goal was from the beginning of this journey and I'm thrilled to be able to say BRAVO BRAVO BRAVO to you all for absolutely crushing it!! At the end of their full day Learning Expedition, I had asked them to think back on the day and share an inspiring moment(s) that resonated deeply with them and think about what they can take back and action in their organizations. With regards to the experience, here is what they had to say "One of the things that we can learn from this Learning expedition is that we should invest more in the human experience and how impactful that is. What a fantastic day this has been from the very beginning even before we arrived. From the hotel room drops, to the hand written notes, to the welcome party, the thoughtful gifts of resources and the charger in the reusable tote bags and charges as well as the personal videos that brought the voice of our employees to us... such incredible attention to detail... We need to do a much better job at thinking about this and putting the human equation into the experience". All the hard work and coordination and putting humans in the forefront has made such an impression and has inspired 39 SE Executives and their CHRO to aspire to emulate what we do! The infinite ways in which we thought about the details has brought about admiration in a way we never thought we would actually heard vocalized so explicitly and sincerely! They didn't just say this once either! So many thank yous with similar elaborate specifics were shared by the likes of the CHRO of NAM, VP of HR, SVP of Talent, SVP of Global Rewards and their Global CHRO! To think that this was our very first one and with 39 Executives from all across the globe too!! Cheers to you team and I cannot wait to see how much more we will learn and grow from this fantastic kick off!

title: Merck dream team
message: Jay, Joyce, and Sheri - WOW! Another amazing account review at Merck. Yesterday we had the chance to sit down with both the core program team and our executive sponsors and review the last 18 months of Inspire. In the meeting our executive sponsors said that Inspire has created a phenomenal transformation within the company. They also said the data itself shows they hit an unmet need and proves that Merck has truly created a culture of recognition. Aaron couldn't stop talking about the amazing anecdotal feedback he has received all across the globe. These praises are a true testament to the hard work you each put into this program every day. Jay- you are the glue that keeps everything together. You go above and beyond to keep Merck happy, and have truly earned their trust at all level. It's not every day an executive sponsor says he's not worried about the spend... Joyce- your ongoing communications continue to help Merck capitalize on areas of opportunity. You have worked hard recently to help them target managers and increase their manager reach. Not to mention you always bring the human element, whether it's celebrating Cheryl's birthday with a cake or bringing gigantic Whoopie Pies to celebrate a 30 Year Anniversary. Sheri - it's clear that you have gotten executive buy in across the organization and the team was so impressed with your suggestions on utilizing WARI. Michaela and Aaron were huge fans of the scorecard idea yesterday. Congrats to you three on an amazing partnership and another great review!

title: Great work with Fannie Mae
message: Team, I wanted to call out your great work prepping for the on-site meeting with Fannie Mae today. They've been a great customer over the past 3 years, with best in class program metrics. But with their business type, they've also been on cruise control with a strict budget. Their interim CEO is now their official CEO, and they have a new CMO and CHRO. Reviewing their program metrics isn't enough. Greg shared some great slides that showed they have gender equity in recognition along with great manager and p2p participation. They were most interested in the information that showed that the current allocation of funds is directly impacting some of their most important departments and might not be the ideal way to distribute the funds. They also started to think about ways they can celebrate 'moments' within the platform and want to setup a brainstorming session soon. You all did great work prepping for and meeting with them today. I am looking forward to the next steps!

title: Inspiring Greatness
message: Thank you to this incredible team of strategists for an impressive two (very) long days of concentrated best practice sharing, ideation, mind blowing progress on our dream state goals, and overall pure stamina. I was reminded again these last solid 48 hours exactly how much work you are doing and magic you are making at our most strategic customers. It is truly mind blowing what we can do as a team to impact the business. Thank you for your teamwork, your commitment to make the best of our time together, for helping to find the humor in some tough situations, and for being downright badass leaders. Each of you brought a perspective to our two day marathon that helped someone move an idea or a strategy forward. Each of you contributed your unique voice. Together, you make up the greatest team I‚Äôve been privileged to work with. Onward to victory! Bravo!

title: SO. MUCH. FUN!
