title: Minimally Viable Presentation
message: MVP TEAM! WOW! What an amazing feat pulling together one of the best narratives we ever had presented at the ELT meeting today! The information flowed, they were wowed, they laughed, it showed our strengths and highlighted our successes. You ALL were integral to making this come to life, especially during the last minute crunch hours (YAY BRUINS!!!) I was so honored to re-pre-sent all that Marketing has been working on what's to come. You are a fantastic group of humans, so grateful to work with you.

title: Client champions!
message: I wanted to give a heartfelt thank you to each of you for your help in providing insight and details re: our clients and their programs to help me prepare questions and slides for the Total Rewards Conference. The relationships you each have with Michaela (Merck), Ted (Autodesk), Darlene (Corning) and Amanda (Cardinal) contributed to our success in first getting them to be on the panel, and second to share compelling different stories to inspire the audience. From sharing important differentiators like Merck and Corning are very interested in the WARI D&I results to Corbrina, working with Ted in the last few days ensuring he was comfortable sharing his WARI data, I felt confident we would have unique insights to share to separate us from all the others in our space. Thank you all for your teamwork!

title: Help with Recruitment
message: I wanted to thank you all for your help throughout the recruitment process over the past few weeks.  You've been a real help; you've been willing to change interview processes, reviewed countless CV's, gave constructive feedback and made yourself available for interviews when needed and at short notice.   It's great to work with a team willing to put recruitment first and we'll see the rewards of that going forward.

title: GE Inspiration
message: Sheri---INCREDIBLE momentum with GE this week! Not only did you get some great humans to WH but they were anxious to get back together and get MOVING on making change. This email kind of blew me away...what a change in attitude and enthusiasm! Bravo!  "Thank you Sheri!! You did a great job, giving the businesses just enough to digest. I can sense some excitement around the program again.    I‚Äôve been thinking about the People Leader education piece. I think GE really missed the mark on this when rolling out the Impact Award Program. They are such an integral part of this. While we can implement a great program, we really need them to execute it properly. The fact that peer awards have declined and award approvals are happening primarily at year end, is a red flag. I think budgeting creating some panic around it as well. I‚Äôm excited to get a fresh start and deliver it more effectively on our end this time around.   Thanks for everything!"

title: Synchrony Prep and Homerun Meeting
message: Sheri, I want to call out the excellent work you've done over the past several weeks to prep our Conversations team on the Synchrony opportunity. Your very detailed business background, insights into Synchrony's culture and thinking, and knowledge about the people of Synchrony set us up for an incredible meeting. I am super impressed by the thoughtful microsite that you shared over that went VIRAL ahead of your big meeting. SO organized, so strategic, so well done! Way to inspire, guide, and position us!

title: Keeping CSX On Track
message: Team, thank you for all of your help conducting CSX's UAT. They ended up being a little more demanding than expected especially in branding aspects, complicated rule changes, and employee privacy. I appreciate all of your patience with the number of tickets opened through the past couple of weeks as they reviewed the site. They are wrapping up now and preparing to sign off on UAT by the end of the week, with their launch day is right around the corner. I wouldn't be able to do this without your help and support!

title: Thanks for the support
message: Thanks for the on-site support during today's training session. I figured we'd run into some issues with the conference rooms and there's not much I can do when working remotely. I asked for help in advance and you all agreed. One room worked out fine and the other....well....it needed some fine-tuning. Thanks for your patience and problem-solving, we started and ended on time!  Thanks again!

title: Shining at Corteva
message: Team, thanks for a great kick-off at Corteva this week! It was a true team effort starting with Chris setting us up for success before we even got on site by building a great relationship with the Corteve team, who buys into what we do and how we do it! Sarah, you coordinated all the logistics and kicked off the day, paving the way for a productive discussion, and you positioned yourself up as a trusted partner they can depend on post launch. Cam, I'm thrilled to be working with you again! You have a wonderful way with our customers, sharing your insights and best practices, strategically steering them in the right direction. And Melissa, thank you for joining the team last minute as you were integral to our brand brainstorming exercise given the large number of folks who were joining remotely from around the globe! I'm looking forward to working with you all in the weeks to come as we help Corteva "Grow What Matters."

title: To a true client partner!
message: Cam ‚Äì I wanted to take a minute to recognize all the work you‚Äôve done for and with the Fisher team.   Despite initially wanting a quick launch, they have had a tough time making firm decisions and have, on occasion, over thought some pieces of their program and I really admire your approach and patience with them.  Whether it‚Äôs setting up additional calls with the program manager to talk through things in advance of our weekly project calls, having a really patient and low pressure approach to sharing our best practices, or just being that extra support for the program manager as she tries to push things internally, you have definitely put in many hours with this customer and it hasn‚Äôt gone unnoticed.  I personally learn a lot from you on the weekly calls and appreciate your partnership on one of my first customers!  Thanks!

title: Thank you
message: Thank you very much Conor for providing me with and answering the huge amount of queries I had around the Q1 salary and bonus reviews for the finance team.I appreciate you making my queries a priority as you were busy with the Q1 finance review.

title: Dublin in 48 hours
message: Sheri, thank you for being a key part of & onsite for the recent ICON review meeting.  It's great working with you on this account and it was a wonderful opportunity to share Workhuman Live insights, discuss the current program, bring research & analytics opportunities to the fore and spend some time on their investment.  It was really beneficial having this meeting so close to Workhuman Live especially as the team received the Amplify award and renewed for another 3 years.  Thank you for the great work you do with this customer and the continued support!

title: BSI Event Security Presentation
message: Thanks for your swift work to turnaround the Security presentation updates for me. With Workhuman Live upon us and without much time to the event date you pulled out the stops and got me a finished product in doublequick time. Many Thanks

title: Getting to YES with SPS!
message: We are officially an SPS Commerce client!  Thanks to this phenomenal cross-functional team for all of the time, thoughtfulness, and dedication put into the evaluation of supplier integration partners and for the hard work to get us to this point.  This process has truly taken an army - from evaluating our current processes, to brainstorming and investigating ways to achieve scale on order flows, invoicing, returns and more, to thoroughly evaluating SPS and their fit for our needs.  Between the many internal workshops and the hours spent with SPS thus far, we have all learned a lot and have come a long way in our thinking of how we will expand and evolve to meet our business goals.  I am thankful for you and appreciate the unique and deep experience that each one of you brings to this team .  I am excited about reaching this milestone and am looking forward to partnering over the coming months to bring our plan to life!  Thanks and cheers to all of you!

title: Questions & Answers
message: As the sun sets on a yet another audit, I want to say a huge THANK YOU for your contribution to the 2018 edition. We have had auditors onsite for a gruelling 5 weeks now. In this time, each one of you has contributed in providing reports and reconciliations (& answering questions), invoice testing (& answering questions), variance analysis (& answering questions), process documentation (& answering questions), preparation of memos (& answering questions) and much, much more. In all, there has been a hell of a lot of questions, to which we can now safely say, all have a valid answer! This has all been done with a view to giving the external auditors comfort over our 2018 Financials. Massive congratulations and thank you all for your hard work and dedication in both getting us to this position, and ensuring the audit has run on time, successfully and without much disruption to day to day activities.   Well done everyone, now we can all breathe a sigh of relief :)

title: J&J
message: While most people will see J&J and think "Johnson&Johnson" (even myself in customer experience), I now think of it as Jill&Jen! You two have been incredible leading up to and during Workhuman Live. I appreciate you giving me access to be part of the "core team" and be involved in so many things that are new to my role and give me a better understanding of the inner workings of the event. Jill - you never miss a thing. Not one! Always on top of every single detail and that is SO appreciated. You are a master! Jen - your creativity inspired me to thing bigger and better every time. You helped me create a vision for items in the lounge that were an absolute HIT! Thank you for sharing your beautiful brain! HUGE thank you to the both of you for all you do day in and day out to make Workhuman Live incredible and inspiring.

title: The Best Workhuman Ever!
message: Jen, Ellen & Jill, congratulations on delivering an absolutely incredible experience for our customers and future customers. We had our fair share of challenges, but each one was overcome with aplomb and grace while you remained focused on delivering something exceptional. Workhuman continues to be the best conference I have ever personally attended, and judging from the reaction of our attendees - they agree wholeheartedly! Well done!

title: May I Chime In
message: Thank you so much for your team work and being a room host at our Executive Forum dinner at Husk. From setting up name badges, welcoming guests, ringing those chimes to move guests along, keeping track of time, clearing tables (Ellen), and making sure guests left with everything they came with - your efforts to make this event a success were truly remarkable! Thank you for being part of this team and this event!

title: Juggling it all to deliver success!
message: Thank you for literally dedicating every waking hour to ensure Workhuman 2019 was a success! Many people may not have seen the incredible amount of dedication, determination, resilience, innovation and imagination that you put into this event.  They may not be aware that you had a hand in almost every single detail and may not have seen the blood, sweat and tears that went into the planning and on-site execution.  They may not appreciate the re-engineering of vast areas of the event that occurred in the final hours to reduce costs.  I saw much of it and I hope you know I appreciate all that you have done.  From the customer events perspective I could not be happier.  The Wildhorse was a resounding success. Thank you for working with me on the details to ensure it was a perfect realization of the experience we envisioned.  Customer connect was a huge success and we will blow it out for next year.  The customer demos were awesome.  Cocktails and connections was a wonderful evening of bonding and connection, Innovations and Libations was a success and the last-minute band addition and menu changes were well received!  The customer lounge was a huge hit and you even managed to move my team over to the Gaylord on day 2 so they could be close to the customers they were responsible more readily.  It is very easy to let the opportunities for improvement take the forefront when we reflect on the success of events, but I hope that you can look at what you have achieved and pause for a minute appreciating the vast success that was Workhuman 2019.  Yes, there were a few hiccups and there are always going to be things we learn from and can do better next time but Workhuman 2019 was the best yet and you should be incredibly proud of your massive contribution to the success!  Well done Jill.  I am very excited to start planning 2020 !  You are a joy to work with and thank you for dedicating so much energy to the customer experience and to supporting my team!  WE appreciate you!

title: My partner in crime
message: It feels so crazy to be on the other side of the enormous undertaking that is Workhuman (Live!). I can't imagine having done this with anyone else ‚Äì¬†if I was the imagination, you were the determination. Every time I have a wild and crazy idea, you were the one figuring out how we can actually make it happen‚Äìfrom humans on boats to executing the perfect CXO dinner. You are the one crunching the budget numbers, crossing them with what systems can do which things, you are the one jumping through hoops of fire to guard the integrity of the vision-but also helping me craft that vision. As strategic as you are logistic -you leave me in awe of how you think of every last detail. The amount of seats, the waffle wednesday, the perfect bite size of a piece of hot chicken. Every. Last. Little. Thing. I love making this event with you ‚Äì I am beyond excited to wipe the slate clean and start thinking about Denver. Knowing you're in it with me makes all the difference.

title: Where can I help?!
message: Thank you Thank you Thank you!!!! You all stepped up and was willing to help whenever we needed an extra staff member to hold a sign for seating, registration, room monitors, and many many more!!! I could just be passing by you heading across the huge space to cover another area and you would immediately follow asking if I needed help anywhere. You were there to support Customers in all other areas during the day and night but always was willing to jump in when we needed you!!! Thank you all so very much for all your support last week!!!  Your the best!

title: Thank you!
message: Thanks to you all for being there last week! It really isn‚Äôt nice getting bad news when you are away but you were all there giving support!

title: Customer Entertainment
message: It is such a sincere pleasure to work with such great colleagues.  Each of you was instrumental in helping us care for the approximately 500 cowbell-ringing customers who attended WH19.  From hosting tables and driving conversations on the first night at the Crazy Horse to executive dinners at Husk and hosting tables again at Innovations and Libations.  And it wasn't just sitting at those tables.  Each of you engaged in many, many discussions with a passion and energy befitting the Workhuman movement.  Many customers remarked to me how cared for they felt and how much they enjoy engaging with our exec team.  I'm grateful to be part of your team.  Thank you!

title: So.Dope.
message: Strategic Client Director/Badass Story Tellers/Moment Creators/Momentum Shifters---this week has been one for the ages. We set a goal to drive up attendance for WH19 with specific emphasis on executives that have voting power and influence on real change at our most strategic accounts. Not only did you all (y'all) slay those numbers but you dug in, got super focused, and created specific moments for each of those accounts to really experience what this WH movement is all about. Not a second went by at this 5 day shindig where you weren't all communicating, supporting, connecting, and engaging with some of the most influential people in Nashville. I could not be prouder of the master class level preparation and execution of your plans, the quality of the conversations had, the next level situational awareness and lightening speed with which you moved on openings, and the absolute delight I witnessed and heard directly from your clients. We thought we kicked off this year thinking about the Dream State but I believe we've just scratched the surface. Get some rest, sheroes, your limits just opened up again!

title: Comms & Content Mastery at Workhuman Live
message: Wow. This team rocked Workhuman Live. It is truly an immersive adventure - with hard work and focus leading to "our water" - an incredible experience that will empower and enrich our leaders. On the content side, Dan - incredible leadership. You support and lift your team when they need it most - and spearhead so many other initiatives, particularly the post-show content strategy. Lauren C - words cannot fully describe your enormous impact on the event in managing our speakers and tracks. So many details - you get it done with poise, class, and determination. Sarah - your efforts leading our blog strategy has resulted in another step up for our on-site thought leadership. The bar has risen again! Lauren B - your creative approach continually up-levels the words that our attendees see throughout. And at the event, you were a huge part of the blogging efforts. Aaron and Lynne - fantastic job blogging at the conference, finding the right insights to help our attendees take back key learnings to help their organizations grow. Jess - while you were not able to join us at the event, you were invaluable leading up supporting so many writing needs (and your editing skills rock too!). For internal comms, Colleen - fantastic work leading our strategy this year, helping our company "feel" the event better than ever. Kristen - your creativity & determination brought it to life internally, plus your support on social was huge! Clare - loved your timely updates and great ideas. Your idea to ask Kat for an internal video was genius! For external comms, Mike - masterful job with our influencer community once again. Their engagement was incredible! 20 interviews including some of our keynotes with Workhuman Radio (your baby). Just amazing! And Amy, while you couldn't be there, your impact on our PR coverage was huge with some fantastic pieces and more to come. Thank you to the best comms and content team the event world has ever seen. Grateful for all of you.

title: Exec Forum Dinner Excellence!
message: Team, you did a stellar job last night taking our most important group through an amazing and unique experience that they will never forget. The food and drink were top-notch, the venue gorgeous, the event beautifully choreographed, and the networking incredibly successful - as demonstrated by the warm conversation in the exec forum lounge all day today. I know it was a high-stakes, high-pressure event, and you pulled it off wonderfully. Everyone I spoke to absolutely raved about what a great time they had. Well done!

title: Amazing Partner!
message: Jill, well done for all the amazing work you have done this year for Workhuman Live in Nashville!  I know that this has been a crazy year and we have had more bumps in the road than normal, but you have handled each with grace and professionalism.  On a customer front I want to thank you for being an incredible partner and support throughout the process!  Whatever the time of day or night when I have reached out to you, I have been stunned by the speed of your turnaround!  You have been so helpful throughout every single change/addition/modification and challenge!  You have helped me realize my vision of bringing the Workhuman cloud to life at The Wildhorse and I am SO excited that we are in the final stretch now.  Thank you for being an amazing partner.  I love how well we work together and thank you for understanding when I have pushed for certain things to be done a certain way.  I love and respect your opinion and feedback and appreciate how we can find the win win compromise each time that is required!  Thank you, Jill, ‚Äì I hope you can take a moment and breathe.  Look around you and be proud of what you have achieved!  Enjoy every moment of Workhuman Live!  I can‚Äôt wait to see you tonight in Nashville!

title: Sharing all the Workhuman things!
message: I wanted to take a moment, before we head to Nashville to recognize each of you for all your help making sure we shared information with employees so they know what's going on in terms of their travel to and in Nashville, their roles on site, the guidelines around meals, etc. If I actually had an excel with every little detail it would be thousands of rows worth. I cannot count how many questions I've asked each of you, and you always respond quickly and with the info I need. In particular, our biggest work was the training for all staff going to TN - a wee 70-something slide deck. The team did a great job delivering, answering questions, and just being prepared in general. You've been great partners to the internal comms team and I am excited to see all of your work come to life next week. Thank you!

title: Vitamin C
message: Is the juice worth the squeeze. You bet! This recognition is for getting every ounce of juice for Nashville. Working tirelessly to get every last message to every potential attendee - local, agenda, celebrities - you targeted all the profiles. Sharpening and re-sharpening the budget pencil to make sure every dollar spent is impactful. 110% mindful of the attendee experience. Not giving up on a reg system that is maybe not perfect to make sure it will be just right for all our needs - bootstrapping is real. Here's a final boost of vitamin C - cheers to you!

title: Rescue!
message: See that picture - that's you, jumping out of the 'copter to "save" me. In the lead up to the big event there is a lot going on. You've been a great teammate, offering to help at every turn. I am so very appreciative of you taking on the briefing book and getting it in such great shape while I was focused on other things this week. Thank you for all the great work you did and for continuing to say "what else can I do to help?" You're awesome!

title: Taking the time
message:
Hi Conor,

Thank you taking the time to meet with me today to talk to me about what your team do and also explaining more about how the company operates from a financial perspective. I found it really useful and you explained everything in a really easy to understand way that was really interesting. Thanks again Thomasina :)

title: Adapting to Change
message: I am grateful to have you at the helm of this enormous budget.  We have had to make some difficult decisions and you have maintained our goals and zealously protected the true intent behind the activity.  You treat this program with the respect it warrants, and yet have found ways to manage the expenses.  Well done!

title: The Great Communicators of Workhuman
message: I am grateful for your collective amazing work on the brand evolution in the past couple of weeks. Each of you stepped up in different, very important ways to ensure we announced it to the wider world (and internally) in an effective, meaningful way. There were twists, turns, changes - but you rolled with it and focused on the larger objective. And of course, as big projects tend to do, the time needed to get everything done crept into evening hours (and sometimes early morning hours given our global needs). And yet, you were all undaunted and got it the timing and the messaging right.  Well done team!

title: Final Stages
message: Ladies, I have been extremely lucky enough to be called a part of this "core" team building out Workhuman Live 2019! You both need to take a moment and so extremely proud of your accomplishments leading up to right now. Jen, your vision, strength, experience, and leadership skills have exploded through everything you touch! You make everything you do looks so smooth and elite! Workhuman is blessed to have your eyes as the vision of this company. I hope you walk into Workhuman Live with a smile on your face because you deserve it all with all efforts and determination you bring everyday to work! Jill, leading lady of all things Workhuman Live! You pulled this rookie onto this team and have made me a better person because of the things I learn from you everyday. You show so much perception, well organized, driven, and are a true asset to this Workhuman Team. Your leadership shines throughout every aspect of each piece of this conference. You both work so well together as teammates because you trust each other and all your decisions are a group effort. I look forward to see this amazing conference shine more than any other year and you both should be extremely proud. Cheers ladies!

title: The North Star
message: Jill, every year without a doubt you serve as my north star. I don't know how one person can have the brain capacity to hold so much detail but somehow you do. I can only speak for the customer side and from an outsiders perspective, it seems quite simple: 2 events, a few ambassadors, some demos, a lounge... we are good, no? HA! I know I can speak for Alice and Amanda when I say, we could not do this without you. Every year, you keep us on our toes - in line and with nothing forgotten. You help us deliver the extras, give us resources to make it happen and you never miss a beat. Here we are in year five and we are in the eye of the hurricane. I wanted you to know that you are killing it.  There is nothing we can't do as long as we can see our north star. Thank you.

title: Making a Big Impact Immediately
message: Amy -  I am so very grateful that you joined the team. I have been so impressed and amazed by your work since coming aboard just a few weeks ago. You started during an incredibly busy time (even by our standards!) and have never been fazed. Even as we announce our brand evolution, you stepped right in to help bring it to market very successfully in both the US and Ireland. You continually ask the right questions, probe on the right topics, and are curious about the right areas of opportunity.  We have incredible momentum ahead for the company and brand, and your experience and knowledge has already paid dividends.  Cheers to the bright future ahead!  Kevin

title: Working on a Holiday
message: Ladies!!!! Thank you so much for stepping in and helping us get everything out the door for the polos and the t-shirts for WorkHuman!!! We had a tight deadline and I needed answered and approvals for everything on one of the only holidays we get!!! You worked together and got everything approved and out the door yesterday! I can‚Äôt thank you enough!!!

title: Long weekend
message: = extra time to work on the event called Workhuman! Thank you for answering texts, Slacks and emails, and putting in hours over the long weekend to keep the work on track. Necessary and appreciated!

title: Teva is now GLOBAL!
message: A more than two-year journey became a reality in just under two months...and it's all thanks to this amazing team! A huge thanks to each of you (and so many more I did not mention) for your specific role in helping Teva bring the new and improved Stars to over 43,000 employees across 60 countries. This relaunch included an entirely new look and feel for the site, a complete change in program design, the addition of 40 new languages including Hebrew (first client!), an entirely new communication strategy, and so much more. The new Program Manager was extremely aggressive in her plan to launch Stars in such a short time frame, but this team made it happen. In just a few days, there have been over 700 awards issued worth approximately $30K. Teva went through an extremely tough year of organizational change and uncertainty in 2018 and because of the work of all of you, we can honestly say that we are helping make 2019 a much brighter year for its employees. Well done all around!

title: Acceleration Kickoff Team
message: A big thank you and much gratitude to the entire team involved in kicking off our global internal 'review' of our top 5 customers! It took many hours of prep to do the research, thinking, and reporting for each of your areas of expertise AND then several more hours to come together as a team and review all of the great insights.  Thank you for digging in, thinking BIG, and committing yourselves to this important effort. One more review meeting to go! With every call we've made some connections, identified some opportunities, and put ourselves in a better place strategically.  Great work!

title: Impressing ADP
message: Sheri, Greg & Alan - I‚Äôm a little overdue on this, but I wanted to make sure you know how impressed and supported I felt by you as we collaborated on ADP‚Äôs 2018 program performance review. This was a rare opportunity to get in from of the executive sponsor, Rita Mitjans, and illustrate the impact of their recognition program on their business. Sheri, you led things off with a personalized, convincing overview of the Workhuman cloud - so convincing that it led Rita to request a demo of all the solutions they‚Äôre not currently using. This is a major opportunity to expand our relationship with them, and it wouldn‚Äôt have presented itself without your effective presentation. Alan & Greg, you then took it a step further with your in-depth analysis of how recognition happens at ADP across gender and departments. Rita was impressed enough to proactively bring up the possibility of connecting us with their People Analytics team for data sharing that can further enrich our analysis. This meeting was a major first step towards growing our relationship with ADP. Thank you once again for your hard work.

title: Fast, Accurate, Inspiring Hands
message: For all of you lasered focused on all of the varied communications going out to our customers, THANK YOU! It's a race to Nashville and I am SO happy to have you all on our team! Lots of details and first impressions to be made and you are all making every effort to knock them out of the park.  YOU ROCK!

title: Such a Welcoming Team
message: Okay it's a long time coming!  I wanted to thank all of you so much for welcoming me to the SCD team.  It is such a great team to be a part of and I can't thank you all enough for your assistance in making the transition.  All of your help, input, suggestions and guidance were, and still are, invaluable.  So very proud to collaborate and work beside all of you!

title: Launching into 2019
message: Thank you team, for a fantastic offsite as we had a 2018 year in review and then a look towards 2019. You all brought your whole selves on self reflection, process improvements, customer relationships and management and personal growth. I‚Äôm excited for the year ahead and the strides we‚Äôll make as a team to be the best yet! I love being a part of this team.  And a special thanks to Shawn...for your help in the logistics, your design insight and my co-chef!

title: Dream State
message: Excellent work preparing thoughtful action plans that map our work toward the dream state with all of our strategic customers. What an excellent QBR session! I challenged you all to think big and you blew me away. It‚Äôs hard to believe how much we discussed, developed, and dreamt up in just one day! It was possible because you all put the work in ahead of time. Having Rebecca and Traci join us and start to immediately aligning with our work was the icing on our Valentine cake! Well done all! Really proud to work with each of you!

title: Seeing Green in a Good Way!
message: When Citizens asked us to help them "Show Some Love" and come onsite to assist with and film their launch activities on Valentine's Day, this group hustled into action.   Michelle, you and I are co-conspirators in ensuring that Citizens has the best experience in every Workhuman interaction they have with us, down to finding the right shade of green to wear to help staff their launch events. You were everywhere assisting the team, whether it was talking with colleagues at the Credo Awards table and answering the numerous requests coming from Derek. Also, my Fitbit confirms we officially hit 10K steps for the day!  Amanda, James and Matt - you had no hesitation being onsite at 7am at Citizens' request. While the Citizens team was nervous at the prospect of being filmed, you reassured them that they'd be captured in the best light (literally) and they were all put at ease with your mix of professionalism and reassurance. Amanda, you were on top of ensuring that we were capturing the release forms that Citizens required, no matter how many random superusers were tossed our way! James, your interview style helped our subjects relax off the bat and give us those quality sound bites we were looking for. Matt, you were the life as the party as always! Although people tend to treat anyone with a video camera as a pariah at times, you were there capturing all the key moments in an unobtrusive way, and also charming the Citizens team with your comments.  Cam - I also have to acknowledge your efforts and presence in spirit. Every time the project team talked about their partnership with Workhuman on film, they were effusive in their praise of our launch support, and would mention you, Michelle and myself by name.   Ashley, you've been along for the whole Citizens journey. Your work was evident everywhere and helped bring a cohesive look and feel to the Credo Awards event. Thanks for hustling on the launch event handout that helped dress the tables.

title: Let's Go Global
message: Sheri---it's happppppenING! Your sheer determination and incredibly well honed negotiation and persuasion skills have been exercised over the past several months with our friends at Teva Pharma. You created a vision for the team to fight to take this program to a truly global place.  You built incredible relationships and managed to get a key champion to visit us in Boston during the HOLIDAYS! And, what is most incredible and a true testament to your expertise, in a year where Teva was cutting costs by $2.2B, you got them to double down on recognition.  So well done, Sheri! Congrats on getting this baby over the "finish line"!

title: An LSM, Prod Support and a DBA walk into a room...
message: A launch team first ‚Äì Launch Success, Prod Support and DBA all sitting in the same room together! Thanks to GFORCE20, we were all brought together for Akamai‚Äôs launch day. I can‚Äôt thank you enough Cam, Paul, Stephen and Enda for putting the customer first and our community celebration activities aside to ensure we had the right support all day. This support level puts the customer at ease, and they even shared that repeatedly on the day long war room session with Cam, as they saw you in the background. We had a small but into the evening nagging item that was successfully resolved due to your dedication, Cam and Paul. You were huddled up in the hotel room pin pointing the issue until you found the needle in the haystack. The end result was a happy client. Akamai had a great launch and each of your efforts contributed to that success!

title: Year end number crunching
message: Well done everyone on successfully closing out the books for 2018.  The hard work and collaboration was exceptional and the many hours spent working through our busiest time of the year supporting our growth whilst also preparing for year end was evident for all to see.  On top of our end of year busy period you hit the ground running in January by rolling forward schedules, revising estimates, running through reconciliations, pulling data from other sources, running reports, checking and reviewing and rechecking culminating in our best quarter end review.  This allowed us to review the fruits of our labor in a concise and informative 60 slide pack!  As we continue to grow it is comforting to see the various improvements that we have made over the past 12 months and I look forward to seeing us successfully execute in 2019 ..... well done!

title: WorkHuman Mastermind
message: Jill,  I need to thank you for constantly going above and beyond to create an amazing experience for all attendees at WorkHuman. I'm privileged to work closely with you on many items behind the scenes regarding this event. It is amazing to watch you navigate thousands of different details that feed into the experience that is WorkHuman. What is even more masterful is watching you keep an eye to the strategy behind the event constantly. Add extra session, accommodate a new product element, adjust a budget down significantly, know the difference between different dulcimer instruments....the list of details you manage for the team is unbelievable. What I'm most impressed with though is your calm and steady approach to everything. We are so lucky to have you as part of the team. Thank you for all you do! Anne Marie

title: New Rent Accounting

title: CSX Launch Excellence
message: Cam, I just wanted to call out the great work you're doing on the CSX launch. We're only a few weeks in, but from the minute this was handed off, your main focus has been making sure the their program is set up for success.  Right away, you identified a potential issue for offline access which would have made for a bad experience for over 90% of their population. Rather than glossing over this and simply hoping for the best, you quickly gathered information, reached out to the appropriate internal teams to investigate, and got the ball rolling on a solution. All of this, along with a plan B,C, and D if needed, before going onsite for the design lab. Although there's still work to be done (and a few more hurdles to jump), it's real comforting to know that you're always thinking about the long term success of the program.  I really appreciate all the efforts you've put in so far and am looking forward to their successful launch... (after you figure out all of those other hurdles of course).

title: Bringing 21,000 Miles of New Connections to CSX!
message: Let's all jump up from our chairs and scream and shout ... "CAM's OUR MAN ... if Cam can't do it ...      no body CAN." I'm truly doing this in my office right now.  Why? Because it's so well deserved and earned. Your enthusiasm, passion, dedication and 'can do' attitude has spans miles already for CSX's upcoming April launch.  A few 'opportunities' with their offline workforce - no dedicated manager in the data file nor company issued email addresses to all  - presented themselves at the end of last year. You dug right in, tracked down others internally to strategize on potential solutions, explored and developed options all while sticking to the fact you'd do everything in your power to ensure a GREAT user experience for ALL when the program launches.  Your due diligence, extra efforts, 'make it happen' spirit really shined through.  And not only did your prep WOW me, your presence, product knowledge, credible guidance, enthusiasm for what we do and superb presentation style was truly WOW! WOW! at the Design Lab.  I haven't had the privilege to see you in action before and exactly what I envisioned was delivered! You have the ability to instantly connect with audiences, use great body language and eye contact to convey energy and confidence, pause to emphasize key points, articulate clearly and smoothly, don't mince your words, interject humor when appropriate, summarize questions for clarity before responding and engage and inspire everyone from the most senior leaders in the room to the payroll admin who crossed her arms most of the meeting! A natural talent, you are!! CSX is in such great hands with you. CSX is vital to our nation, makes tomorrow happen for companies across the globe. And our own, 'Cam the Man' is vital to unlocking the potential, purpose and passion for the 30,000+ CSX employees who will soon spring out of bed to do their lives best work because they feel valued, appreciated and recognized for their contributions!! YOU ROCK!!

title: Steward of giving good feedback in conversations
message: Cam, I want to publicly share my appreciation of our work together on CSX to date and how you are a steward of giving feedback. You and I have worked on many accounts together, beginning way back with General Cable. You are a great teammate. But this week, you did something that I want to share with others as an example of what an even better teamwork can look like. I asked you for feedback after the CSX design lab. When requesting feedback, I followed the instructions I had given Dell employees in their training videos--I stated what I thought went well and stated an area where I thought I could improve. This request was designed to make you more comfortable when giving me feedback. I then prompted you to give me something I could "continue" and something I could "consider". And this is where I am grateful for your teamwork this week. You responded within 24 hours, you gave me thoughtful feedback on what I did well AND something I could consider. And when giving the feedback on where I could improve, you did it in a kind, thoughtful way. Thank you for giving me something I can work on professionally that can help my career development. It was a perfect example of how to give feedback and how powerful it can be in the hands of the receiver.

title: Calm, Cool and Collected
message: I wanted to give you a shout out for how calm, cool and collected you were with the few issues encountered with Citizen‚Äôs, days leading up to their launch. You took control of the situation, balanced gathering the details while keeping calm in the face of the customer‚Ä¶in both situations. Communicating at a regular cadence in this pressure cooker time, was key and you nailed it. The relationship you have built thus far was a significant contributing factor for the customer‚Äôs controlled reaction to the issue. He was confident you were on the issue on his behalf and you proved him right. Great job on your leadership and congrats on the first launch of 2019!

title: Thank you
message: Hey Guys this is an overdue award, I just wanted to thank you for all the support and guidance in our weekly float reviews throughout 2018. I really appreciate you all taking the time out each week to meet with myself and review how floats are.  It's great to have this support as a group and individually to be able to meet and review all of the accounts each week, these weekly reviews have brought a great deal of support when planning and getting payments out the door. Float accounts are such a key part in AP & we have a lot of volume going through some of these accounts but with your continuous support , suggestions and planning allows us to get through the busy periods more efficiently . We ended this year in a very good position on all float accounts breaking all records when it comes to payments. We got through year end with all Float accounts reconciled. It's been the busiest year yet for floats , with continuous growth we added 5 new float accounts and together we successfully got them all set up and running smoothly. We seen Merchandise grow and double in volume, we had new clients added to debit cards and with all this going on we still met every week to review and catch up. I really appreciate the time you all took to give your support on floats. It's amazing to see how much it has grown in 2018, I'm excited to see how well everything goes in 2019. Thanks again everyone

title: Journeymapping Stars!
message: A sincere thank you on behalf of the CX Team for participating in our first ever journeymapping aimed at the buyers experience. Each of you represented core areas of our business and stepped into the shoes of our customers to provide deep insights to create a picture in time of our current state. Journeymapping is an extensive project that requires many! Every single phase of the journey is critical to our business, from first awareness to contracting‚Ä¶ from launch to even potential shut downs. Thank you so much for your passionate participation and honest candor. It's a pretty amazing thing that we have to remind folks to table brainstorming or solutions so that we can first nail down the current state. To me, this shows how eager our people are to learn from our past, dip into research and data, to push the boundaries on innovation and to challenge the status quo so that Globoforce can be way above the pack. These sessions and your input will propel us forward in every single corner of the business to be more aware and aligned with each other and with our customers. That is powerful - THANK YOU!

You pick up the load and remind me that the deluge won't last forever.  Thank you for being such an amazing foundation.

title: Teamwork makes the Dream a Reality!

title: It takes a village...
message: Team, I wanted to call out the immense group effort today on an unusual situation. Even the most thorough clients can overlook things during UAT testing and we came across that today. Gulfstream missed that the Timelines digital award messaging was not exactly what they wanted and they had no approval to use the CEO's name on the tool - a serious issue for them. This meant we had over 500 awards to cancel...and reprocess. Due to their extremely custom mgr pack process, we had a lot of systems pieces to work out. Jillian, when I texted you the heads up that I'd need assistance early, you replied with "Not a prob-we'll get it done!". You worked the test WBAU with an assist from Nicholas and created the new WBAU that I needed their approval for within an hour of coming in; this included multiple tests of the new award msg. Bill/Amanda/Gavin, we had to figure out how to reprocess all these awards without triggering add'l orders to Allied - thank you for taking the time to work through this very important piece together! We vetted out the scenarios, found the best option and I was able to configure as needed. Cam, as always, you supported through the entire process. While this was a ton of work internally, to the client it did not appear that way; they were happy/appreciative that we could have 500+ awards tested, processed and confirmed within the same business day. I could not have done this without your collaboration, time, effort, support and willingness to get it done. Amazing team effort - thank you, thank you, thank you!

title: August Company Meeting
message: Eric, Conor, Vineet, and Maggie - Thank you for sharing your updates at the August company meeting. I appreciate the preparation that goes into creating your material and delivering it so all can benefit from hearing what's happening throughout the company. I've heard positive feedback about the topics and know that many are thankful for the information shared!

title: Over The Hump
message: Team, as you can see, getting Dell through Recognition and Conversations UAT was a herculean effort from over 15 people on five different internal and external teams. Each and every one of you contributed significantly to help me manage this and I can‚Äôt thank you enough. Throughout the past 3 weeks, there have been 80 Jira tickets opened in relation to their UAT ‚Äì slowness in Sandbox, award highlighting issues, translations galore, static drive updates, invoice updates, email template problems, transformation rules, privacy language changes, login errors, escalations‚Ä¶ the list goes on and on. As if everything I just listed wasn‚Äôt enough work for you, all of this was going on through ADL issues, general sandbox issues, and releases. A special shout out to Stephen and Yuliya for joining daily calls and helping sift through all the tickets and ensuring the right ones were looked at with urgency. The team has seriously stepped up to resolve all these tickets to help get Dell through UAT. With your help, they are slated to officially sign off on UAT this week! Thank you all for helping Dell through this significant milestone. Your support has truly been invaluable to me.

title: A little help from my friends!
message: Team, thank you SO very much for all jumping in to help me out while I was out of the office last week getting my eyes lasered (or fixed! however you want to look at it!). This week out of the office was last minute by my standards, and i left with more than a little bit of nerves / anxiety, but the truth is is I never needed to worry (and I knew it!). Joyce, thanks for running with all of Harvard Pilgrim's requests. For such a quiet client, they had lots of questions while I was out, and some of them were completely unrelated to comms. You still jumped in, followed up and made sure they got the answers they needed. Sarah - as always, the yin to my yang with our many launches. DJO was in the best of hands, and you re-scheduled meetings, fielded questions, followed up on outstanding items, and kept the project moving while I was out. Do you even need me anymore?!? And Cam - thank you for stepping up to answer the launch related questions my clients had while they were out. Just having you on my out of office made me feel better, and seeing your responses to questions and hearing how you supported with some of DJO's more nuanced questions - I really can't thank you all enough! THANK YOU!

title: Because of you, we SOAR
message: Cam, enormous thank you for all your continued support with Gulfstream, post launch. With some bumps in the road in their crazy custom mgr packs, you stayed on after we launched to guide the process, support the technical processes and ease the clients mind - all equally important pieces. You have also proactively done work (setting up the Retirement program in Sandbox so I could demo next day for 1 example) without being asked, which was just plain incredibly kind of you and allowed me to focus on the bigger issues at hand. On top of that, during our handover meeting, we discussed the standard items (unusual processes, relationship knowledge, etc) but also highlighted areas of interest for them that I can now use as I manage the program - coming at it from an account management perspective! This blew me away; proactively knowing these areas of interest means I can add those metrics to the other areas I would normally watch and include in account reviews. Sharing info at this level is priceless for me as the CSM. I cant thank you enough for your work ethic, your time, effort, thinking outside the box and the care you have shown for this client, which is reflected in the relationship I am lucky enough to inherit. You are amazing Cam!

title: Sometimes it takes a village..
message: Cam, Meghan, and Sam - thank you all for all the support while I was on vacation! I was able to enjoy a few days away knowing my clients were being looked after by you three. Sam, you must've run at least 25 WBAUs in 3 days. You were responsive to urgent requests from important clients, all while balancing you own workload. Cam, thank you for jumping in with Meghan on FINRA and helping get them up and running. I know how much you have on your plate at all times so I greatly appreciate you putting things aside to help investigate. And Meghan, holy cow. I thought our Friday evening of fighting fires would be the last of it, but surely I thought wrong. Thank you for giving a high maintenance client the attention they needed during a tricky situation. You were following up non-stop letting our program team know you were working on it. You were in early on calls with the necessary team and you let me enjoy my time off.   Thank you all again for being rockstars!

title: Spreading Smiles at Hershey
message: Our first account review working together is finally over with! This has been a long time in the making...I think we actually started to plan this meeting at the end of last year! We spent countless  hours fine tuning this agenda to ensure we were going to make the most out of each and every minute we were there...and we did just that! In just a few short hours, we managed to cover a program overview, Service Timelines, Retirement Awards, Life Events, Conversations, WARI and much more. All of your hard work to get Kevin Walling, Hershey's CHRO in the room paid off as he not only blessed us with a hello, but sat down to have a real conversation about what was happening today at Hershey. Thanks to all of our prep (and ensuring we had the right data on 2018 usage), we were able to get his support in fixing the usage program! I really enjoyed working with you in preparation for our meeting- you taught me a lot while always making time for a good laugh!  On a less serious note, I thought this picture perfectly showcased our dear friend that we met at the airport on the way home! I think she definitely would have made her way up where the luggage goes for a nap if we weren't on such a small plane:-) Thanks again for all of your support! Look forward to all of the great things to come for the Hershey's Smiles  program!

title: A series of small things...
message: Trying to be funny, I was searching for a cheesy teamwork poster to include on this award. I ended up coming across this one with the following quote: "Great things are done by a series of small things brought together." If this is not applicable to our team right now, I don't know what is! You have each jumped in without a single hesitation to help with Dell, Edwards, and PwC over the past couple of weeks - config changes, data file loads, slides, Jira tickets, and more. All of the things that might seem like just one little task or project all add up and are having a big impact to these clients. And for me personally, it just reminds me (literally daily) how lucky I am to work with such an amazing, caring group of people. Thank you so much for being amazing teammates and helping me get through.

title: It's all happening!
message: Jill, it's early months still in WorkHuman 2019 planning but what a pleasure it is to work with you knowing you are 2 steps ahead in scoping out the cadence and interdependencies involved in a very complex project. I appreciate the initiative you've taken across so many elements -- housing (saving money!), transportation/airfare (saving more money!) registration software (to improve attendee experience and help us optimize by segment), evening event planning (giving us more options) and being smart about how we use agency time and talent. Great work, look forward to what's next!

title: SOARing to Success
message: Eboni Lott, the Program Manager for Gulfstream, had just left a post implementation meeting and immediately emailed me their team‚Äôs praise. ‚ÄúHands down, the team agreed that having Cameron Torre as the Implementation Manager for this project made this a successful project for our team.  Throughout the project, he was supportive, flexible, and provided the expertise needed to guide our decisions.  He was receptive to the ‚Äúquirks‚Äù of our business, and offered useful solutions to help navigate roadblocks we faced.  Most importantly, he was very responsive, which made all the difference when we needed to feed information to our business leaders.  I personally agree that it has been a pleasure to work with him.‚Äù  As they can‚Äôt send you a ‚ÄúMach Award‚Äù from their system, Eboni wanted to recognize your leadership in helping them SOAR to a new platform. Congratulations on building such a positive experience with Gulfstream!

title: SOARing with Gulfstream
message: Team, a huge thank you for the great work you all did launching Gulfstream this week! The team was excited, had nothing but positive feedback about your work, launch itself and the feedback they've already received from EE's. Cam, you did an amazing job explaining best practices, educating and working with their team to set them up for success now and moving forward, including navigating what could have begun difficult convos with ease, respect & in turn gaining their trust; keeping everyone on track to meet some crazy goals/deadlines and most importantly building a fantastic relationship with the entire group! Danielle, great work on comms - I'm not sure I've seen a team so prepared/excited to get the word out and boy did they! They communicated thoughtfully and were comfortable/confident in the tools they head and how to explain to their EE pop. Thet used different events during the week to really spread the word about SOAR, Thank You Thursday (a day dedicated to sending eThanks during launch wk) being my favorite. Shawn, you were a tremendous support throughout the whole launch & I especially appreciated the assistance this wk. Thank you all for your dedication, knowledge, thoughtfulness, respect and for being the driving force behind such a successful launch!

title: Creating Conversations with Merck
message: Team, thank you all for your expertise, anecdotal input and strategic direction with the recent Conversations review with the Merck team.  You all played such critical roles from the prep meetings, lending your amazing input and expertise to the client discussions and helping to develop strategies for the next steps we took from the meeting.  Merck is an important client in our Global Adopter program and we had some work to do as Merck was a few months in to their Conversations pilot.  As a result of your efforts we were able to craft some important questions for this meeting and leaving the Merck team with a number things to consider as the pilot progresses.  The Merck team was looking to understand some of the key learnings we've seen with other Conversations customers as well and having each of your unique perspectives was critically important at the meeting.    I truly appreciate everyone's contributions at the meeting and the follow up discussions that are underway now.  It is wonderful to be working with a team of true professionals who understand the importance of helping to drive the Conversations product with our customers.

I know WD has been set up for success because they have you guys on their team. Thank you for your leadership, guidance, and dedication!

title: Workhuman Wonder woman

You're running a million different floor plan versions, agenda version, budget plans, housing options for everyone. You're making presentation plan after presentation to help everyone see the big picture vision. This is an event that touches our entire company but no one more than you. Your love of this event shines through when I get to see how much care and nurturing you put in daily to make it the massive success it's become. Keep up the great work! I appreciate all that you done and continue to do! Anne Marie

title: It Takes a Village..
message: I want to thank all of you for inviting me to be a fly on the wall for Synchrony's Annual Review! Your teamwork and collaboration was apparent in the meetings leading up to the client meeting and also during. You all added great insights and action items to move Synchrony forward.  Kara-as the CSM you have created this great relationship with Dino over the past year. He is ready to take action and make changes like turning on the newsfeed, increasing mobile usage, streamlined manager communications and diving into the data to see opportunities.  Lauren-after hearing feedback on the India redemption options, you jumped at the opportunity to schedule a call to get feedback from the India team themselves.  Sheri-you provided great thought leadership around nominations and how increasing the "giving" in their company not only is a feel good benefit, but most importantly these individuals who are nominating are the people who know and look for the behaviors that are driving core values and success in the company. Dino said "I have never thought of it that way". Great feeling to actually have these points validated!  Great work team and can't wait to hear what the future will bring for Synchrony's program!

title: It Takes A Village...
message: Team, Maine Med is live with an additional 1400 employees on the platform!!!!!! In January at Ignite, my PM called to talk about adding an additional population of people to the platform. Over the last couple of months, that evolved to 2 new populations, new homepage branding, logo changes, new icons & colors and different approval rules & eligibility rules for each of the 4 populations. Christine and Cam, the 2 of you jumped right in to help me decipher the complex rules and figure out the best way to make them all work! I could not have done it without your help and guidance! Michela, when I was out for the few days, I thought we were all set and all they needed to do was begin testing. Little did I know that they would need to change up the branding and icons again! There was a lot of back and forth that week between that piece and about 100 other questions from them...Thank you for treating them like they were you own client and keep the ball rolling while I was out. Jill & Nick, between the testing, icons, program guidelines, FAQ's and test WBAU's, you 2 killed it every step of the way! There was a ton of requests for changes that came in and all within a 2 week window as they were testing. You 2 took each request in stride and helped make it possible to meet their deadlines! Sarah, thank you for the work you did to get the homepage updated. Right at the last minute, they needed another change done and you made sure it was all set before you went out for your long weekend! Each one of you made this possible and I could not have done it without you! Cheers!!

title: Can we go through this one more time?
message: Cam and Danielle- where do I even begin? The two of you have been so patient with FINRA and their influx of questions as we get closer to their launch date. Cam, you've taken the time to hop on 4 calls with the PM in the last week to help him understand Spend Management. You have a way of making complex (at least for FINRA) concepts easy to understand. Danielle, you have been working so hard to get the FINRA team trained and explaining to them best practices for their communications. You have waited patiently for their side to make what feels like 10909099090 edits. I'm truly thankful to both of you for all you've done and will continue to do. I know FINRA has been set up success with you guys on the team!

title: GDPR Cross Functional Puzzle Masters
message: Each one of you managed a significant piece of the GDPR puzzle to get your teams ready for May 25--no small feat. We are now ready to forget people upon request, properly secure and encrypt personal data wherever it appears, and be fully transparent with our users about how, when and why we make use of their data. Along the way, we‚Äôve developed new approaches to generating invoices, incorporated new technology to keep our data secure, cleaned up old processes we‚Äôve been meaning to tackle for years, and better defined the rules of the road for going forward. It‚Äôs through your extraordinary efforts that we are able to say with confidence that we are prepared for GDPR. Thank you for your ongoing participation in our weekly check-ins and side meetings, your proactive look at how we can best address the requirements, and the active follow up throughout these past several months. Kudos to all of you for ensuring Globoforce reached this milestone!!

title: Launch Team Sounding Board

title: Moving Conversations Forward at Fannie Mae
message: Naomi, Lynne, and Sheri - great meeting yesterday at Fannie Mae with the Conversations program team.  With Phase 1 of their pilot complete, we took the opportunity to go onsite for a debrief of the program and discuss the strategy as we look to begin Phase 2.  Fannie Mae had previously held focus group sessions with their pilot teams and this was a great chance for us to learn from them on what employees thought of the program.  There was a lot of great feedback collected that we can now use as we move forward.  Although Fannie Mae took more of a "hands off" approach during Phase 1, they now realize that the key to success will be "Prescription and Accountability." They even suggested themselves that for Phase 2, they will make a bigger splash in communicating the launch as well as continuing the communications throughout the pilot.  It's always great to have a customer come to these realizations themselves which means we are all on the same page moving forward.  Although they still have some final decisions to make internally with both Phase 2 and beyond, this was another big step in moving our partnership forward with the Conversations team.  Thank you all for your efforts and continued support through Fannie Mae's Conversation journey, I greatly appreciate it

title: Support on MasterCard
message: Sheri- it was difficult to just pick one of our core values, because you really covered them all! Thank you so much for jumping in to support me on an amazing opportunity that I am working on for MasterCard. We have the attention of their EVP of Global Total Rewards right now to grow their recognition program to possibly 1-2% of payroll, and we needed to build a business to tell this story in less than 6 slides...and to do all of this within a 2 day turnaround  I had over 10 decks up on my laptop when trying to figure out the right slides to include here, but needed some help organizing my thoughts. You got on a call with me, listened to what the opportunity was/ a background on the account, and somehow turned around an amazing story in less than 2 hours! You then helped me craft a meaningful message to send in addition to the slides, which was just perfect! In just a few sentences, we were able to demonstrate how strategic recognition not only reinforces the values of a company, but also has been found to be one of the least expensive levers to make an impact on an employee's experience at work. Only two days after sharing this information, my main contact, the VP of Total Rewards, Rosanne was able to secure a meeting with the EVP of Global Total Rewards & the Business Financial Officer of HR. During this meeting, Rosanne's goal is to use this data to not only secure additional funding for this year to support the activity levels that have far exceeded their budget thus far for 2018, but to set up the proper investment for 2019. When I asked if she thought we were going to have any pushback in getting additional funding for 2018, the VP said absolutely not! In fact, she is thrilled to kick off a partnership with WorkHuman Research Institute Team to further build the case with their own data. All of this is possible because of you, and your support in this crucial time. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

title: Sensei Cam

They had asked some pretty tricky questions and I wanted to ensure I covered all the bases and responded to them in a timely manner. Your support in writing the note was so helpful to me. title: We will find a way - we always do
message: It takes a village, yes it does. It has also taken two extremely determined, dedicated, passionate individuals to keep the cart on it's tracks to the finish line! The two of you are a powerhouse. So much of what we accomplished this year would not be possible without you. When I was working with you on Customer Experience, I felt like that was your #1 priority but somehow you managed to offer this level of support/guidance to other departments as well as build on relationships with external parties at the same time. How was it all possible?! Great relationships make a huge difference in business and this rang true when we were on-site in Austin and Ash and his Marriott Team were willing to do anything for us (fully comp'ing the cabanas, saving the best rooms for our rain back up, etc.). We have received rave reviews on all customer events ranging from the drinks to the atmosphere. I received so many thank you's and compliments from customers and it reminded me of Ash when he shared the coins and how important it is to thank those in the "back of the house." It's not just the customers though who do not know all the faces of WH, there are so many team members who aren't fully aware of the herculean effort put forth by the two of you. I don't have a coin but if you can believe it, I found these two pins LOL. I'll shine them up and get them over to you. I can't thank you enough for the tremendous effort and care you put in to every engagement, detail, task, request, deadline, relationship, reservation, experience, the list goes on.....! I know that working with you we will always find a way for everything - we always do!

title: Allied Irish Bank Goes LIVE...& We Appreciate YOU!
message: Allied Irish Bank (AIB) is second largest bank in Ireland and they launched their global program to 10,000 employees (9,500 in Ireland alone!!) today - Monday 26 March.  This has been an amazing achievement not just for Globoforce but for AIB as well. The amount of bureaucracy that AIB had to go through to get approval was not an easy one. First, Globoforce had to build a site for them to use as a pilot and test it and get approval from the Irish Government, then there were the technical challenges of working with the banks many security restrictions but we as true partners we got through it and only after all this was achieved were they able to launch their program to all their employees. Last week at a VIP gala dinner at their headquarters this story was echoed to their guests from both their CEO, Bernard Byrne and CHRO, Triona Ferriter when they officially revealed that Appreciate! will be launching officially and that they are all very excited to start this amazing journey with Globoforce. This amazing journey could not have been done without the unique team spirit that comes with all of you working together to bring us to today! Everyone that I have interacted with at AIB have been so impressed at how efficient and how Globoforce is always over delivering in all areas, be it from a communication, technical or product point of view!  Thats some praise!!! Well done for helping us create a bigger footprint into Ireland!!!

title: Integrated Invoicing is live!
message: Thanks to vision, ambition and guidance across many releases by Arann, Greg, Louise and Martin McG, supported by the FIN and OPSDEV teams, we now have an integrated solution for invoicing. When the MD App summarizes a required invoice, all the total values are sent to Epicor which returns the allocated Invoice number and any VAT due, so that the MD App invoicing solution can generate a final invoice needing no manual edits. Gone are the days of data entry on Epicor of total values for HUNDREDS of invoices twice a month. In the last days, we even eliminated the manual edits to add VAT.  Merck took the honours on Mon 22nd as the first integrated invoice generated.  Thank you to the visionaries, architects and implementers of this giant leap forward for our AR team.
